Гайбуллаева Матлюба возрост 45 лет замужем имеет 4 детей ,работает в Совместном предприятии "чавони" швеей по пошиву мужских сорочек .Старший сын , которому 20 лет в отъезде в Россию на заработки. У Матлюбы планы на будущее , женить сына, начать пристройку дома. Для этого ему нужны реальные финансы, но сдесь и она и ее муж зарабатывают мизер который хватает только на жизнь.Поэтому ее муж решил тоже поехать в Россию на заработки. Для его отъезда ему необходимо 1500 сомони.Поэтому Матлюба решила обратится в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Personal loan

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru:
Djamshed K. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 37 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. He does not have a job, but makes his living by animal husbandry. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves and small cattle which he sells after feeding. This brings in a good income for his family. Djamshed has been in this business for the past ten years. Right now the prices for cattle are a little bit lower so he wants to buy a few goats and sheep. He needs additional money and this is why he applied for a loan. He will be able to increase the number of heads of cattle which in turn will increase his profits from sales. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Карахонов Джамшед проживает в городе Яван.Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет пятерых детей.Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , но зарабатывает занимаясь животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник в котором разводит бычков и мелко рогатый скот. А потом после откормки их продает. Это дает неплохой доход его семье.Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 10 лет.Сейчас , когда цены на животных немного ниже клиент хочет купить овец и коз. Но для этого клиенту нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил получить кредит. Таким путем , он сможет увеличить поголовье скота, что даст возможность увеличить доход от продаваемых животных. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy small cattle

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul Zuhurovna E. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 44 years old, married with six children. She has secondary education and is a housewife. She has a small farm which she keeps by herself. She has a few calves, which she feeds and sells, but she needs one milk cow. She wants to buy a cow to supply her family with milk and sell the remainder to neighbors. This will give her family fresh milk and milk products and give her additional income, as well as let the neighbors who don't have cows buy milk at an affordable price. This is her dream at this time. Kurbongul needs the loan so she can be able to buy a cow. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Элбегиева Курбонгул Зухуровна проживает в городе Яван .Возраст 44 лет, замужем имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшое хозяйство, которым занимается сама. Имеет несколько бычков, которых она откармливает и перепродает , но ей не хватает дойной коровы. Она хочет купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам. Это ее мечта на сегодняшний день. Для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Djurabek

texts.ru:
Djurabek Holikulovich G. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. He has secondary education. He does not have a job, but he has his own business - animal husbandry. He has several calves which he feeds and resells. After that he buys young calves and after feeding them for 40-45 days resells again on the same markets. He has a cow house where he keeps them and has been in this business for four years.

Animal husbandry is one of the main types of business in the rural areas. The season of buying and selling of calves is here and Djurabek wants to buy another calve. It will help him increase commodity turnover and receive additional income. He does not have enough money and decided to apply for a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гульмирзоев Джурабек Холикулович проживает в районе Рудаки. Клиенту 37 лет , он женат и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Определенного места работы не имеет, но имеет свое дело. Он занимается животноводством. Имеет несколько бычков , которые откармливает и продает. Затем покупает молодых бычков и после откормки , которая длится около 40-45 дней продает на тех же рынках. Имеет коровник в котором держит бычков.

Занимается клиент этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года .Эта деятельность одна из основных видов бизнеса в сельской местности. Сейчас сезон купле-продажи бычков , поэтому клиент хочет купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот , что даст возможность получить дополнительный доход. Но для этого у него не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. А погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calve

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.ru:
Sheraly B. lives in the region of Rudaki. He is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. Sheraly graduated from high school; he does not work anywhere. The only source of income for his family is an animal rearing business, which works out well in the rural area. Sheraly has a small cow barn where he grows calfs for sale. He purchases young animals on local markets, takes care of them for about 40-45 days, when animals get bigger he sells them on the same markets. Now is the season of animal trading, therefore the client needs additional help. He needs additional money, and this is why he came to us in order to obtain a loan. Additional resources will help him not only to purchase more animals, but also to receive profit, which he needs. This will help his family to have a little bit of a better life. The client plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобокулов Шерали Акмирзоевич проживаетв района Рудаки. Возраст 34 года. Женат .Имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее, нигде не работает . Единственным источником дохода его семьи является занятие частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства, что актуально в сельской местности. Имеет небольшой коровник, в нем он разводит бычков для продажи. Покупает молодых животных на рынке , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , после того как они подрастут , клиент их продает там же , на тех же рынках. Сейчас начался сезон торговли животными , поэтому клиенту нужно как –то увеличить товарооборот. Для этого ему необходимы дополнительные деньги, а для этого он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. Дополнительные средства помогут ему не только увеличить товарооборот , но и получить доход в котором он так нуждается. Это поможет его семье немного улучшить свою жизнь. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calfs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ahmad H. lives in the region called Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 31 years old and married. He graduated from high school. Ahmad has an agricultural business, he has a plot of land where he plants wheat. This is Ahmad's main activity and the principle source of income for his family. After the harvest he leaves a part of the crops for the family and he sells the rest. Ahmad has been in this business for 5 years. Now is the time to sow, therefore the client needs a loan to purchase wheat seeds in order to obtain a quality harvest. This will help add new clients and sell all his crops. The client plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Хамаев Ахмад проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Клиенту 31год,женат. Образование среднее.Хамаев Ахмад занимается сельским хозяйством , имеет участок земли который засеивает пшеницей.Основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода его семьи является сельское хозяйство . После того как он получает урожай , часть его он оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 5 лет. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиент нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет ему закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
I am Nazira A. Khan from Lahore, a city famous for its gardens in Pakistan. I have six children, four boys and two girls, three of whom still live with me. My husband is a retired officer, and one of my sons drives a loading van to transport goods on order. However, his van’s condition is deteriorating and requires immediate repairs.

My loan group friends are: Shamim B., who wants to buy a floor grinding machine; Naseem S. and Saira, who both operate separate beauty salons, and Maqsooda M., who wants to buy a cow. All of us have been together for a year, and during this period we have learned to be punctual, responsible, and frugal, as well as healthy and confident.

loans.use: For the repair of our loading van.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zareena S. Ali. I have been married for 15 years and have six children: four girls and two boys. My girls are learning sewing from a stitching centre and my boys attend a local school. My husband works at a restaurant for a meager income, whereas I am a seamstress. I create beautiful ready-made dresses, which my husband sells in various markets.

I would like to borrow with a group of four other women: Sughran S., who runs a grocery store; Sumereena, who will purchase a sewing machine with her share of the loan; Bushra P., who is also borrowing for her grocery store, and Saima, who sews clothes. These women dream of building a house, buying land, improving their business, and ensuring a good education for their children.

loans.use: To buy cloth for the business

loans.name: Vimla's Group

texts.en:
My name is Vimia G.. I was married 21 years ago and have four children: one girl and three boys. I reside with my family in Lahore, Pakistan, where my husband operates a catering business, providing his services at a variety of functions, including weddings. It is now the high season and in order to promptly respond to the many catering orders we will receive, we need loan assistance.

The loan will be disbursed to my group fellows as well so that they can also improve their businesses. Saima is borrowing to fix her husband’s rickshaw; Nasreen embroiders clothes; Allah R. will invest her share of the loan to improve her family’s barber shop, and Khursheed B. needs this loan for her grocery store. The dream of each of these members is to get out of poverty. They simply want to escape from the clutches of a reality that does not allow them to develop to their full potential.

loans.use: To expand the catering business.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
My name is Asma V.. I have been married for five years and have two children, a boy and a girl. We live in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore, where I run a beauty saloon within my house. My husband works at a local factory, and we also have a rickshaw that we rent out to supplement our income. We bought this rickshaw by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Currently, we need a loan to repair it.

My sub group members are: Alice and Zahida, both of whom run separate beauty salons, and Voliet B., who is borrowing for her daughter, a dentist. I request your help for all of us so that our simple dream of a nice and comfortable life can become a simple reality.

loans.use: To repair our rickshaw

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
I am Nargis R., married and a mother of six: two sons and four daughters. I have lived all my life in Lahore, Pakistan. My husband works at a local hospital. One of my sons wants to buy a taxi that he plans to rent out to supplement our household income. We will also add in our savings to your loan for this purpose. I plan to save this extra income to collect dowries for my daughters.

I am joined in my loan group by four other women: Balqees B., who runs a tailoring business; Samina, who is borrowing for her family’s beetle-nut shop; Rubina and Walayat, who both run beauty salons. These women are very hardworking entrepreneurs and wish to give their children a decent living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi

loans.name: Ashura's Mzinga Group

texts.en:
Ashura A., age 42, is a single parent with three children aged 13, 18 and 22. She started a small street cafe six years ago, and began selling clothing and sarongs last year. At these businesses, she works daily from 7:30 a.m. to 2 p.m., making a profit of about $235 a month from food and clothing sales.

In the past, Ashura took two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania and used them to buy food to sell and start her sarong business. Having paid these loans back successfully, she hopes for a new loan to buy more food, clothing and sarongs to sell. She will share this loan with her group Mzinga, which totals 15 members.

In the picture, Ashura is standing in the back row, second from the left.

loans.use: To buy food, sarongs and other items that will be sold by several small businesses.

loans.name: Salelologa Tumupapa Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these three women of Salelologa Tumupapa on the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development to guarantee on-time payments.

Mafutaga Y., 34, is married to a cattle farmer and has three children. For five years, she has sold various items at the flea market. With her loan, she will purchase Samoan sarongs (lavalavas – wraparound skirts worn by the men), 2 dozen bottles of perfume, 2 dozen sticks of deodorant, and a box of cups.

Lagi A., 49, is married, with two children. She will use her loan to start a BBQ business. Specifically, she will purchase a BBQ stand, mutton flaps (lamb ribs), chicken legs, soy sauce and tomato sauce. She plans to earn 250 Tala (~100 USD) per week of net cash flow.

Kirita A., 53, is widowed, with eight children. She desires to start a pancake business to sell to the local school children 5 days a week. Specifically, she wants to purchase sugar, flour, oil, a pan fryer, noodles, coffee and tea.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment for market businesses

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
Marifat Astonakulovna N. lives in the Gissar region. She is 49 years old, is married and has 7 children. She does not have an education. She is self employed. Her business is raising cattle. When the animals are grown, her husband sells them on the market. Currently the prices of animals have gone down a little and for this reason Marifat would like to purchase a milk cow. This will allow her to provide her own family with milk and milk products. If there will be a lot of milk she will be able to sell it to her neighbors. This is why Marifat has come to Kiva for a loan. She is planing to repay the loan within a 12 months period. She has been in the business of raising cattle for the past 6 years. Her business is working well.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Нарзикулова Маърифат Астонакуловна проживает в районе Гиссар. Клиентке 49 года , она замужем и имеет 7 детей.Образования не имеет , работы нет, поэтому приходится подрабатывать. Клиентка имеет небольшое хозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , муж клиентки выводит их на базар и продает. Но в данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому Гулизор хочет купить дойную корову. Она сможет обеспечить свою семью свежим молоком и молочными продуктами. Кроме этого , если молока будет много клиентка сможет продавать его сосесдям. Для того , чтобы купить корову Гулизор хочет получить кредит. А погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.Занимается животноводством клиентка уже 6 лет. Опыт имеет , поэтому весь бизнес у нее налажен хорошо.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew N. is a commercial motorcyclist. He has been in his business for 5 years. He is married with 4 children. He is 40 years old. He needs the loan of $600 to buy a new motorcycle. He is from Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 52 years old, married and has two children, ages 17 and 20. She sells cold and hot beverages in a bar she started in 2002. The bar is open from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily, and she makes a profit of about $70 monthly from her business.

In the past, Salome took out took a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more beverages to sell in her bar. Now, she hopes for a new loan to buy more chairs. In addition to using them in the bar, she will also start a new business that rents chairs out for functions.

Salome belongs to the loan group Tiger, which totals 25 members who keep each other accountable for paying back loans.

loans.use: To buy chairs for her bar.

loans.name: Salelavalu Tai Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these 14 women of Salelavalu Tai on the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development to guarantee on-time payments.

Naomi U., 45, has eight children and a husband who is an engineer. Five days a week, Naomi works at her stand in the Salelologa market where she sells gel, soap, shoes and powder. With the loan, she intends to buy a resupply of the hygiene products to earn a net cash flow of 270 Tala (~ 108 USD) per week.

Fetaiai T., 50, has three children and is divorced. Once a week she has a stand at the market in Salelologa where she sells taro and bananas, both staples of the Samoan diet. With the loan, she intends to buy a pick, shovel, spade and fencing materials to keep animals out of her plantation. She intends to earn a net cash flow of 120 Tala (~ 48 USD) per week.

Paese T., 41, has one child and is single. Over three days per week, Paese sells clothing (t-shirts, dresses and school uniforms) from her home. She has over three years of experience in the business. With the loan, she intends to buy a sewing machine, cloth and other materials to earn a net cash flow of 170 Tala (~ 68 USD) per week.

Perenise S., 30, has three children and her husband is a fisherman. During three days of the week, she sells sea cucumbers and fish in Salelavalu. With the loan, she will buy a boat, nets, knife and other fishing materials that her husband will use to fish. She plans to earn a net cash flow of 110 Tala (~44 USD) per week.

The other women will use their loans for the following purposes:

Eka S., Fanaafi S., Tulai F. and Taumafai L.: farming materials for growing taro, yams and bananas.

Sau Taulelei, Kemeta N. and Pilua M.: boats and nets for fishing.

Limasene S.: Elei printing (traditional Samoan way of fabric printing).

Telesia A.: raising cattle.

Fiamama N.: selling yeast, flower and sugar to make pancakes (round lumps of fried bread) in the market.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell at the market

loans.name: Djurabek

texts.ru:
Djurabek K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 41 years old, is married and has 6 children. He has a degree in teaching. He works in a High School in Yavan. His salary is however too small to provide for his family and he is forced to have a business on the side. He is a very optimistic person and supplements his measly salary by raising cattle. The profit from this business provides the necessary additional income that allows him to provide for his family. Currently the prices of animals have gone slightly down and it would be beneficial to his business to purchase calves now. This will allow Djurabek to increase turnover, get more profit from the business and take better care of his family. The business also contributes to the development of cattle raising in the region. This is why the client has come to Kiva for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within a 9 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Карохонов Джурабек проживает в городе Яван . Клиенту 41 год , он женат и имеет 6 детей.Образования высшее , по специальности Педагог. Работает в средней шуколе города Яван. Зарплаты на жизнь не хватает , поэтому приходится подрабатывать. Не смотря на это Джурабек не унывает. он очень веселый человек. Джурабек имеетхозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , клиент выводит их на базар и продает. Этот бизнес приносит доход , который помогает ему обеспечивать семью.В данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому ему необходимо купить бычков пока цены не выросли. Это поможет уаеличить поголовье скота . Кроме того это поможет зарабатывать немного больше , что даст возможность прокормить свою семью. А еще занятие животноводством отдельно позволит развитию животноводческого сектора в целом. Для этого клиент должен получить дополнительное финансирование путем кредитования. А погасит кредит клиент в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday O. is a commercial motorcyclist. He is married with 5 children, and he is 46 years old. He has been in business for 3 years. He needs the loan amount of $600 to buy a new motorbike. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Gulisor

texts.ru:
Gulisor D. lives in the Gissar region. She is 53 years old, is married and has 5 children. She has a degree in Accounting. She works as an accountant at the local court. Because the pay is relatively small she is also in the business of raising cattle on the side. When the animals are grown, she sells them on the market. Currently the prices for animals have dropped and it would be a perfect opportunity to purchase a milk cow. This will allow her to provide her own family with milk and milk products. If there will be a lot of milk, she will be able to sell milk and milk products to her neighbors. Gulisor has come to Kiva to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase the cow. Her family will help her take care of the animal. Gulisor plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Джобирова Гулизор Эргашевна проживает в районе Гиссар. Клиентке 53 года , она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Имеет высшее образование и специальность Экономист. Работает в районном суде экономистом. Заработная плата не большая, поэтому приходится подрабатывать. Клиентка имеет небольшое хозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , муж клиентки выводит их на базар и продает. Но в данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому Гулизор хочет купить дойную корову. Она сможет обеспечить свою семью свежим молоком и молочными продуктами. Кроме этого , если молока будет много клиентка сможет продавать его соседям. Для того , чтобы купить корову Гулизор хочет получить кредит. Ее близкие будут довольны ее покупкой , и будут все вместе ухаживать за коровой. У них очень дружная и веселая семья .Погасит кредит Гулизор сможет в течении 12 месяц.

loans.use: Purchase several additional animals

loans.name: Satupaitea Satufia 2 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these nine women of Satupaitea Satufia, from the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business endeavours to guarantee on-time payments. All the women of this group are involved in farming.

Aiga N., 48, married, with seven children, intends to use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer, fertilizer, chemicals, knife, knife sharpener and other farming equipment. She grows taro on her plantation and sells it once a week.

Fetalaiga I., 36, married, with one child, grows taro, bananas and kava. Taro and bananas are staples of the Samoan diet. Kava is a calming drink taken before all ceremonies and on other special occasions.

Fili F., 30, married, with six children; Potoae Fio F., 62, married, with five children; Repeka L., 63 and married; Masina F., 56 and married; and Sivaitoi U., 37 and married, grow taro and bananas and yams to sell at the Salelologa market on Saturdays and to local villages. They are requesting loans for chemicals, a weed killing sprayer, knives, wheel barrows and spades.

Sifiti R., 27 and married, sells taro and bananas and also pancakes (round lumps of fried bread). She will use her loan to buy farming equipment including chemicals, a knife and knife sharpener.

Vera Taavaomalii I., 25, married, with three children, is also in the vegetable business, selling cabbage, tomatoes and cucumbers. She will use her loan to purchase all the farming equipment needed to produce these vegetables and sell them 3 days a week.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha O. sells dried fish. She has been in this trade for 3 years. She is married with 3 children and is 35 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more dried fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, age 27, is the single parent of a 7-year-old girl. Since 2004, she has made a living selling clothing and cosmetics door to door from 7:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. From her sales, she makes a monthly profit of about $620.

In the past, Halima used a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more clothing to sell. Having paid it back successfully, she hopes to take a new loan to once again buy more clothing.

Halima is a member of a loan group known as Tiger, which has 25 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell door to door

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. is married with 5 children, and she is 38 years old. She sells foodstuffs like beans, vegetable oil, etc. She has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nurmuhammad

texts.ru:
Nurmahammad A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 33 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has a High School education and is self employed. He is in the business of raising cattle. When the animals are grown, he sells them on the market. Currently the prices have slightly dropped and it's a perfect opportunity to increase turnover. This will allow Nurmahammad to earn a little more and thus take better care of his family. This business also helps the development of cattle raising in the region as a whole. This is why Nurmuhammad has come to Kiva for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Эрганов Нурмухаммад проживает в городе Яван . Клиенту 33 год , он женат и имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее , нигде не работает. Но несмотря на это он зарабатывает на жизнь животноводством. Клиент имеет небольшое хозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , клиент выводит их на базар и продает. Но в данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому ему необходимо купить бычков . Это поможет увеличить поголовье скота . Кроме того это поможет зарабатывать немного больше , что даст возможность прокормить свою семью.А еще занятие животноводством отдельно позволит развитию животноводческого сектора в целом. Для этого клиент должен получить дополнительное финансирование путем кредитования. А погасит кредит клиент в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase several additional animals

loans.name: David

texts.en: David A. has a mini factory for processing palm kernel. He has been in business since1986. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan amount of $600 to buy palm kernel for processing. David is 53 years old, is married, and has 6 children.

loans.use: To buy palm kernel for processing

loans.name: Salelavalu Tai Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these two women of Salelavalu Tai, from the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loand from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business endeavours to guarantee on-time payments.

Sulufaiga L., 35, has 5 children and is married to an engineer. Her family has been involved in farming for many years. Specifically, she grows taro, bananas and other produce. For two days of the week, she sells themto the people in her village and during the rest of the week, she sells them to the other public. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, three knives, a filing, two spades and three laborers. She expects to earn 100 Tala (~40 USD) per week in net cash flow.

Koreti L., 44, is married, with seven children. She has over five years experience with her shop where she sells donuts, snacks, drinks and other times 7 days per week. With her loan, she will purchase flour, sugar, oil, yeast, chicken legs, lamb ribs, butter and boxes of noodles. She expects to earn 200 Tala (~80 USD) per week in net cash flow.

loans.use: Purchase assorted goods to sell at the market and farming equipment, etc.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony O. is married with 4 children. He is 49 years old and owns a computer center. He has been in business for 3 years. He is from Uromi, Edo State. He needs the loan amount of $700 to buy computers and a photocopier. He said this will help him serve his customers better.

loans.use: To buy a system unit and photocopier

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Fahriddin Turdievich A. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 22 years old and single. Although he is not married, he is part of a large family. His father and him both work to provide for their big happy family. Each of them has their own business. Fahriddin is in the business of raising cattle. When the cattle is grown, he sells the calves on the market. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. Currently the prices for the animals have slightly dropped and it provides a perfect opportunity to increase turnover of the business. The profit from the business will increase and help Fahriddin take better care of his family. In addition to that the business helps the development of cattle raising in the region. This is why Fahriddin has come to Kiva for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period. His family and friends will make sure that he is able to do so.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Анаев Фахриддин Турдиевич проживает в районе Рудаки . Клиенту 22 года , он холост. Он не женат , но унего большая семья, в которой они живут дружно и весело.Зарабатывают на жизнь вместе с отцом. У каждого свое дело. Фахриддин имеет небольшое хозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , он выводит их на базар и продает. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 2 лет. Но в данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому ему необходимо купить бычков . Это поможет увеличить поголовье скота . Кроме того это поможет зарабатывать немного больше , что даст возможность прокормить свою семью.А еще занятие животноводством отдельно позволит развитию животноводческого сектора в целом. Для этого клиент должен получить дополнительное финансирование путем кредитования. А погасит кредит клиент в течении 12 месяцев , с помощью близких , котрые помогут ему в его делах..

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif S. sells cosmetics, hair weaves, and jewelry. He is married with a child and is 28 years old. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in business since 1993. He needs the loan of $525 to buy more cosmetics, hair weaves, and jewelry for sale. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, hair weaves, and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. is married with 4 children. He is 40 years old and hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells firewood and has been in business since 1998. He needs the loan amount of $600 to enable him to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy firewood for sale

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Mahmadali Tovarovich S. lives in the region called Khuroson. He is 57 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He has finished high school. Mahmadali has an animal rearing business. He raises large farm animals and then resells them for meat production. He purchases calves at the local market, feeds them for 40-45 days and then resells them for a larger price. He has been in this business for 3 years. This business is the main source of income for his family, therefore, business development will help him increase profits and improve the quality of life. Additionally, development of this business sector helps ensure that markets have fresh meat. The client would like to obtain a loan in order to buy young calves. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Шеров Махмадалли Товарович проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 57 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver I. is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells car accessories, like fan belts and engine oil. He is married with 6 children and is 42 years old. He has been in business since 1985. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy engine oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for sale

loans.name: Hamis' Salasala Group

texts.en:
Hamis, age 24, is married and has a six-month-old baby. For the past four years, he has made a living selling fish. He works from 7 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from his sales.

In the past, Hamis took out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more fish to sell. He now hopes for another loan to buy more fish and to also start a fruit and vegetable stand. Hamis will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in fish, chips, clothing and fruit and vegetable sales.

In the picture, Hamis is the second person standing from the left.

loans.use: To buy more fish and other items to sell

loans.name: Taga 1 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these four women of Taga 1, from the island of Savaii, passed their written test on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) in order to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individiual business developments to guarantee on-time payments.

Ana L., age 32, married, with three children, sells taro, tuamu and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet. Her husband and sons are experienced farmers. Her loan will be used to purchase a weed killing sprayer, a knife, knife sharpener, an axe, chemicals and a wheel barrow.

Kalameli Ufi L., age 25, married, with five children, and Leatuvai F., age 54, married, with six children, sell taro, bananas, tuamu and other vegetables. They will use their loans to purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, knife sharpeners and laborers.

Soonalau T., age 42, married, with ten children, sells raw fish to the people in her village and at the market five days per week. Her husband has been catching the fish for over three years. She will use her loan to purchase a flashlight, goggles and other fishing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase farming and fishing equipment

loans.name: Sharifamoh

texts.ru:
Sharifamoh S. lives in the Khuroson area. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a community college degree. Her business is selling peanuts. She buys them raw, dries them in the oven and then sells them in the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. The profits from this business are not very big, but Sharifamoh is not discouraged. She has decided to increase her inventory and sales, so as to also then increase profits. This business is the sole income for her family. She would like to use the loan to help increase sales and plans to repay it back in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Шерова Шарифамох Махмадалиевна проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 33 года, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей фисташек. Закупает товар у оптовиков , сушит их в духовке и продает в розницу на рынке. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 2 года. Дохот от торговли фисташками не очень большой , но Шарифамох не унывает.Она решила увеличить оборотную сумму. Это поможет увеличить доход, который необходим для ее семьи, так как этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. А увеличить оборотную сумму путем получения кредита. А погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory and sales

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick O. is married with 5 children, and he is 45 years old. He sells provisions and soap and has been in business since 2002. He is from Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan of $875 to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph A. is married and has 9 children. He is 55 years old and hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He sells bicycle parts and has been in business since 1976. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more bicycle parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle parts for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet B. is married and has 6 children. She is 34 years old and sells clothes (wrapper). She is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2005. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.ru:
Bahromjon H. lives in Rudaki. He is 30 years old, married with 3 children. He also has a community college degree. He is a farmer, owns some land and plants wheat and other grains. The harvest goes for his own family needs and for sale. The sales help his family buy food like flour, vegetable oil and other essentials. Right now it is planting season and Bahromjon needs money to buy seeds. He hopes to get a loan that he can use to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. He will repay the loan in the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Холикулов Бахромджон проживает в городе Рудаки . Клиенту 30 лет , он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее , занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеиват пшеницей и другими злаковыми культурами. Полученный урожай использует для семьи и для продажи. Это помогает обеспечить семью мукой , льняным маслом , то есть продуктами первой необходимости. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиенту нужны деньги для засева земли. Найти деньги он решил путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту купить качественные семена и удобрения.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anastazia's Salasala D Group

texts.en:
Anastazia, age 28, is single and makes a living selling clothing door-to-door. She started this business in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $30. She works from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily.

In the past, Anastazia took outy a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and used it to buy more clothes to sell. Having paid this loan back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for $1,575 that she will use for the same purpose. She will also share this loan with the members of her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in food, timber, chicken, snacks and store sales.

In the picture, Anastazia is in the front row on the right.

loans.use: To buy clothing that can be sold door-to-door and help fund several other small businesses.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Bahromjon Holikulov lives in the Khuroson area, in the village of Haeti-nav. He is married with 1 child and has a community college degree. He is a farmer who owns some land and plants wheat and other grains. The harvest goes for his own family use and also for sale. The sales help his family buy food like flour, vegetable oil and other essentials. Right now it is planting season and Bahromjon needs money to buy seeds. He hopes to get a loan that he can use to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer. He will repay the loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Холикулов Бахромджон Махмадаллиевич прживает в районе Хуросон в поселке Хаети нав.Женат , и имеет 1 ребенка. Образование среднее , занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеиват пшеницей и другими злаковыми культурами. Полученный урожай использует для семьи и для продажи. Это помогает обеспечить семью мукой , льняным маслом , то есть продуктами первой необходимости. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиенту нужны деньги для засева земли. Найти деньги он решил путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиенту купить качественные семена и удобрения.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine O. is married with 5 children, and he is 51 years old and hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in business since 1987 and sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs. He needs the loan amount of $700 to buy drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy drinks for sale

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru:
Zarif K. lives in Radki. He is 33 years old, has a community college degree and is married with 3 children. His family is large, noise and happy and Zarif loves his wife and children a lot. He works as a driver, at the moment driving a big 'Kamaz' make truck. He has been working as a driver for 8 years. The job is profitable and is the sole income that his family relies on. However, there are always mechanical problems and breakdowns that need repair and this is why Zarif is asking for a loan of $875. He will repay the loan in the course of 15 months. Having the loan will greatly help him and his family.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Кутбиддинов Зариф житель района Рдаки .Ему 33 года . он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование средне специальное. По специальности он водитель.В данный момент Зариф работает шофером грузовогй автомашины Камаз. Работает уже 8 лет. Кроме того эта деятельность приносит доход , которым он обеспечивает семью. Семья у него большая, шумная и веселая, и его работа является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Он очень любит своих детей и свою жену.Но не смотря на это техника постоянно ломается и ее надо время от времени ремонтировать . Для этого ему нужны деньги и он хочет получить кредит в размере 875 длларов США. А погасит кредит Зариф в течении 15 месяцев. Эта помощь сильно выручит его и его семью.

loans.use: Mechnical repairs for a truck

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. is married with 7 children and is 45 years old. She sells jewelry, clothing, and household utensils. She has been in the business for 20 years and is from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more household utensils, jewelry, and clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, household utensils, and clothes for sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica E. has been in business since 1993. She sews and sells empty sacks for packaging cereals like rice, corn, beans, etc. She is married with 7 children and is 43 years old. She needs the loan of $450 to buy more empty sacks for sale.

loans.use: To buy corn and empty sacks for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence E. sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She is married with 5 children and is 33 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy O. sells dried fish. She is married with 5 children and is 42 years old. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1996. She needs the loan of $600 to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel I. is married with 3 children. She is 35 years old and hails from Uromi Edo State, Nigeria. She sells dried pepper and has been in business since 2000. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more pepper to sell.

loans.use: To buy pepper for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses A. sells drinks and plastic products. He is 28 years old and married with 3 children. He hails from Uromi, Edo State Nigeria. He has been in business since 2005 and needs the loan of $450 to buy more drinks and plastic products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and plastic product for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort E. sells firewood. She is married with 6 children. She is 55 years old and hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy firewood for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella O. is a fashion designer and also sells drinks. She is married with 2 children and is 37 years old. She hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business for four years. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more male and female materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy male and female materials for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: O. Joy is married with 3 children. She is 25 years old and has been in business since 2005. She is from Edo State Nigeria and sells fruits. She needs the loan of $350 to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy pawpaw and pineapple for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Magaret O. is married with 9 children. She is 49 years old and hails from Uromi Edo State Nigeria. She sells firewood and has been in the business since 1980. She needs the loan amount of $275 to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy firewood for sale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: O. Justina is married and has 5 children. She is 45 years old. She hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes and has been in business since 1997. She needs the loan of $700 to buy more used clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fairly use clothes for sale

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday U. sells electronics. This is a business he has been into for 2 years. He is from Edo State, Nigeria. He is 27 years old and married with 7 children. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more electronics for sale.

loans.use: To buy electronics for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. sells yams. She is married with 9 children. She is 65 years old and hails from Ewohimi in Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1972. She needs the loan of $875 to buy yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina A. sells provision and food. She is married with 9 children and 40 years old. She has been in business for 4 years. She hails from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria and needs the loan of $875 to buy more provision and food to sell.

loans.use: To buy provision and food to sell

loans.name: Glady

texts.en:
Gladys is a forty-year-old mother of two daughters. One of Gladys’s daughters is in university and the other is in secondary school. Gladys sells soaps and detergents on a busy corner in central Kumasi. This is her second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust. As a result of the business training she has received in connection with the loan process, she asserts that she is now able to save money more easily.

With the proceeds from this loan that she is seeking, she would like to purchase better quality detergents and to begin paying for her inventory up front (as opposed to with credit). The savings generated by the profits of her business are used to pay for her daughters' school expenses.

Gladys is a member of the trust group In Him is Life. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase higher quality soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is the mother of four children. She sells pigs' feet at the local market in Kronum. All of Grace’s children are currently in school. Her eldest son is about to enter a polytechnic institute.

With the proceeds of the loan she is seeking, she would like to increase her inventory so that she can increase her sales. Grace expects to generate additional profits from her increased sales, which would enable her to pay for her son's school fees. In addition, she wants to start saving money so that she can build her own house someday.

Grace is a member of the trust group Eye Nyame (It is God). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs' feet

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a widowed mother of four children. She has been selling yams at the local market in Kronum for ten years. Yams are a staple in the Ghanaian diet and are a popular gift to bring home to family and friends after traveling. This is Hannah’s tenth cycle of six month loans with Sinapi Aba Trust. Her first loan was the equivalent of approximately $60. Over time, she has been able to increase her inventory and has recently bought a new space to sell her yams.

The loan she is now seeking will allow her to prepare the space for the market and to expand her inventory of yams. She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate additional profits from her expanding venture so that she can pay for her children’s school fees.

Hannah is a member of the trust group Nyame Ye (God is Good). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional yams

loans.name: Osatohanmwen

texts.en: Osatohanmwen E. is 60 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells yams. She requests a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more yams to sell. She studied this business for 12 months and started her own business in 1980, and for two years she has been a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is the mother of a young daughter. She sells palm nuts, okra, and cornmeal at a street-side stand in the market at Kronum.

She is seeking a loan in order to begin selling cassava at her stand and to increase her inventory of maize (for cornmeal). With the profits from the expected increase in sales, she hopes to pay for her daughter’s school fees.

Ama is a member of the trust group God’s Love. The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To add cassava and additional maize to her inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence S. is 57 years old, is married, and has seven children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells yams to the people in her community. She is very good in this area of business, which she learned from her mother over a period of 12 months. She started her own business in 1973. She is now requesting a loan of $875 to buy more yams to sell. She has been with LAPO as a dedicated client for two years.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a widowed mother of two children. She operates a street-side stand selling roasted cocoa yams and plantains. She also sells charcoal to other food stalls. Cocoa yams are a popular traditional Ghanaian food and are often used to prepare fufu, a thick pasty dish made by boiling the yams and smashing them with a mortar and pestle.

Vida is seeking a loan to expand her inventory of both yams and charcoal. With the loan, she hopes to increase her profits to help pay for her children’s schooling.

She is a member of the trust group Kristo Abusua (Christ's Family). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To increase her supply of cocoa yams and charcoal

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen I. is 36 years old; she is married with two children and lives in Benin City with her family. She sells provisions and drinks for a living, a business she learned from her mother over a period of 12 months. She started her own business in 2004. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She has been a faithful LAPO client for five years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Esther Osairhunmwen

texts.en: Esther Osairhunmwen O. is a 34-year-old woman who is married with two children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells pepper in one of the famous markets in Benin City. She is requesting a loan of $875 from Kiva lenders to enable her to buy more pepper to sell. She learned this business from her mother and started her own business in 2003, and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past four years as a faithful client.

loans.use: To buy more pepper to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is a 42-year-old woman who is married with five children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She spent 18 months learning about the business and then established her own in 2003. She has been borrowing from LAPO for four years and is very dedicated to her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily E. is 50 years old. A widow with one child, she lives in Benin City. She runs a restaurant in a very good location in Benin City, where she sells all kinds of drinks and pepper soup. She acquired the knowledge of her business from her sister over a period of two years and started her own restaurant in 1996. She has been with LAPO for eight years as a dedicated client, and now she needs a loan of $875 to buy more drinks for her restaurant. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys I. is 28 years of age and lives in Benin City. She is single and runs a beauty salon, where she earns her living. She studied her business for four years and opened her beauty salon in 2005. She has been a faithful client of LAPO for three years. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy weavons, relaxer, hair cream, and other hairdressing materials for her salon.

loans.use: To buy weavons and other hairdressing materials

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia O. is 38 years old; she is married with four children and lives in Benin City with her family. She is a fashion designer. She studied the profession for two years and started her own business in 2000. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials for her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is 52 years old and lives in Benin City. She is married and has five children. She goes to the northern part of Nigeria to buy yams, which she sells in Benin City. She spent a year learning this business and started her own business in 2002. She is seeking a loan of $450 to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro I. is a 39 year old woman, who is married and lives in Benin City with her husband and 5 children. She sells women's clothing, shoes and bags. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more women's clothing, shoes & bags for sale, which, she said, will enable her to retain her customers. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 3 years and has been a dedicated client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing, shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Osayomore

texts.en: Osayomore O. is 48 years old, and is married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City.  She goes to the northern part of Nigeria to buy yams, and then sells them in Benin City. She started this business in 1987 and learned how to do it for some years from a friend. She would like a loan in the amount of $1050 to enable her to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is 42 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Benin City. She buys yams from the northern part of Nigeria and sells them to retailers in Benin City. She started this business in 2005 and learned how to do it for 16 months prior to that from her friend. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $875 to enable her to buy more yams to sell. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose I. is 30 years old, married with 4 children and she lives in Benin City with her family. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $875 to buy more soup supplies for sale. Her mother taught her this business for 6 months. She will be glad if she finds favor with the KIVA lenders. She started her business in 2003 and has been with LAPO for 4 years as a client.

loans.use: To buy more soup supplies for sale

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 38 years old, lives in Benin City, and is married with 4 children. She sells tailoring materials from her home, which she learned how to do for three years before starting her own business in 1999. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $875 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a young woman of thirty-five years of age and married with three children who are currently in primary school. She has been selling baby products like nappies, towels, soaps, dresses, etc. for five years now.

Hannah is so happy that Sinapi Aba Trust gave her an earlier loan to increase her working capital. She has now been able to take care of two other family members who are currently in Senior High School through her regular savings.

Hannah now wants to use this new loan to increase her inventory of items such as baby dresses and add additional product like sanitary pads which she says sell faster in the market.

She is a member of the group “Nyame Aseda” (meaning God’s Thanksgiving). Groups guarantee principle, support each other, and help all members to repay the loan on time.

Hannah has happily displayed her products.

loans.use: To buy more baby products like nappies, towels, soaps, and sanitary towels

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. Is 46 years old, and lives in Benin City. She is a widow with 4 children. She sells plantains and yams, and needs a loan of $875 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 6 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy yams and plantains for sale

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen N. is 35 years, is married with two children, and she lives in Benin City. She sells women's bags and shoes. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more bags and shoes for sale. She is a LAPO client, and she has 5 years of experience in business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy bags and shoes for sale

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.en:
Jose is 23 years old and is originally from Maputo. He is the sixth son among 9 brothers and sisters, and in 2004 he moved to Ponta D’Ouro following 4 of his siblings. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Jose completed primary school (up to 7th grade) and since 2005 is a waiter in one of Ponta D’Ouro’s great restaurants (Kaya Kweru). His initial salary was MTn 1,500/ month, but since last year it was increased to MTn 2,000/month (around US$80). He works 8 hours per day, from 7am to 3pm or from 3pm to 10pm, six days per week.

Jose got married 2 years ago, and although his wife Cassilda (20 years old) is now working, they are barely able to save any money in the end of the month. As Jose is a very family-oriented person, he goes personally to Maputo once a month to bring his family money (MTn 1,000) and salute his mother. He pays MTn300 back and forth to Maputo, so in fact he just gives MTn 700 to his parents.

Jose heard about Hluvuku at work, and after seeing a friend repaying his loan, he decided to apply for his first loan ever to improve his living conditions. Today Jose lives in a house with a plastic roof, and with this MTn 3,000 loan he will be able to buy aluminum roofing in South Africa and stop heavy rain from entering the house.

As soon as Jose finishes repaying this first loan, he intends to apply for a second one in order to go to driver’s school and get his license. The school takes 1 month and costs MTn 6,000. Jose believes that he can earn significantly more as a driver (the driver of the restaurant he works for, for example, earns 3 times more than he does). He is a very motivated young man and has many plans, such as building his own brick house and having his own restaurant.

The picture shows Jose with one of his nieces, Edna, at his house.

loans.use: Buy construction material (aluminum roofing)

loans.name: Elidio

texts.en:
Elidio is 25 years old and is originally from Ponta Malongane, a beach 20km north of Ponta D’Ouro, where he currently lives. Ponta D’Ouro is also a beach village, but on the border of South Africa and very famous for its tourism. Elidio and his family moved to South Africa for 10 years during the Mozambican civil war, returning home in 1993.

Elidio didn’t complete primary school. He studied up to 5th grade and left to find a job and take care of his newly born daughter, who is today 5 years old. He is married and just had a new baby boy a month ago. On top of supporting his family, Elidio helps his younger brother (17 years old), who is doing secondary school in Bela Vista (the only village around with a secondary school).

Working at one of the most famous resort/camping ventures in Ponta D’Ouro, Elidio helps with the boat, going to the sea with clients and so on. He has been a permanent employee for 2.5 years now, working from 5:00am to 4:00pm and earning MTn 2,210 per month (around US$90). Life in Ponta D’Ouro is not easy, though. There are no public hospitals or clinics and food is very expensive. Elidio prefers to pay the 20 rand (around US$2) transportation costs and shop in Manguza in South Africa every other week (or at least once a month). Last month he sent his wife to Maputo (the capital) to have his baby, all increments to his monthly expenses.

This is Elidio’s second loan with Hluvuku. He used the first loan of MTn 3,000 to buy bricks and cement to start his own house. He was able to complete repayment in advance and has applied for this second loan of MTn 5,000 to buy aluminum covering to use on the roof. As soon as Elidio finishes paying this second loan, he intends to apply for a third one to continue building his house. All he is missing now are the floor and some other details in order to move there. And he is very positive that next year he will already be there with his family.

loans.use: Buy construction material (aluminum roofing)

loans.name: Joao Ernesto

texts.en:
Joao is 27 years old and is originally from IN. Island, close to the capital Maputo. He has been married since 2000 and has 3 children: a 6-year-old boy, a 4-year-old girl, and a 6-month-old boy. The oldest boy started school this year, although Mozambican law changed the initial school age to 7 years old. Joao and his family moved to Ponta D’Ouro in 2002 searching for work opportunities. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

In 2005 Joao was able to open a grocery shop at the Mercado Central (the open-air central market) with MTn 7,000. He sells mainly food and basic products. Wheat is his most famous product: 1Kg is sold for MTn 25. Sodas are also products that sell a lot, especially South African brands that he brings from there. A 2L bottle costs MTn 70 and the small one costs MTn 15. Joao goes to South Africa every time he manages to save (and buy) Rand, normally once or twice per month. He pays R60 (around US$6) for transportation and he buys all his inventory and also food and clothes for his family.

With this shop, Joao makes between MTn 1,500 and MTn 2,500, depending on the tourist season. During high season (summer time), he also works as a temporary employee in the camping site, washing dishes or helping with the tourists. His wife stays at the grocery shop and they are able to almost double ther monthly income, so they are able to save for winter months.

This is Joao’s first loan with Hluvuku. He decided to apply after seeing a few colleagues succeeding in life with Hluvuku loans. This MTN 5,000 will be used to increase his inventory for the holidays. He believes sales will increase significantly and he will be able to repay the loan very fast. In the future, Joao intends to apply for a second loan to open a new shop, where he will work full-time in summer and winter as well.

loans.use: expand the inventory of his little store

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre is 27 years old and is originally from the north of Mozambique. His family moved to Ponta D’Ouro 13 years ago, and today only his father and an uncle lives here, the rest of the family is in Maputo (the capital). Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village in the boarder with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans. Married, Alexandre has a 2 years old daughter. He also helps to support his 2 younger brothers that are still in school. He has another younger brother that is working in South Africa. 

Alexandre studied until 6th grade (only 7th grade missing to finish primary school) and worked as a construction worker for almost 7 years. Soon after, he got a job as a gardener at Ponta D’Ouro campsite, where he worked for 5 years earning MTN 1,200 monthly until January 2008. He decided to resign to focus in what he really likes to be: a photographer. Alexandre charges R15 (~US$1) for a regular size photo and between R50 and R100 (around US$5-10) for posters. He goes to Maputo every week to develop all pictures, paying MTn 300 (around US$15) for both ways transportation. With this business, Alexandre makes approximately MTn 3,500 per month. On top of that, Alexandre has 4 rooms that he rents, making up to MTn 1,500 per month, and still does some construction work when asked. 

This is Alexandre’s first loan with Hluvuku. This MTN 5,000 was used to build a grocery shop next to his house. He lives in a distant part of Ponta D’Ouro, and believes all his neighbors will use his shop. At this first step, he will sell food and basic products. His wife will work at the shop, from 7am to 6pm daily, and will be able to continue to take care of the house. In the future, Alexandre dreams with a second Hluvuku loan to bring electricity to his shop, buy a fridge and start selling drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and meat. What an entrepreneur that is eager to succeed in life!

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde lives in the street "8th of December" in the Senkata zone in the city of "El Alto." She has two children- 19 and 11 respectively. She is in the business of selling clothes in the informal and large market in the city of El Alto that is located on the "16th of July Avenue."

The loan will be used to purchase better wholesale merchandise. This will help because inflation has caused the price of ingredients for food preparation to rise each day. In this method, she will be able to reduce her bills and not have to increase the price of her food and run the risk of loosing her clients.

This is her fifth credit with IMPRO; her evaluation that was taken qualifies her for this loan. Clotilde has been a client of IMPRO since the year 2006.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer. Clotilde vive en la calle 8 de diciembre de la zona de Senkata en la ciudad de El Alto, tiene dos hijos de 19 y 11 años respectivamente. Se dedica a la venta de comida en la feria de comercio informal mas grande de la cuidad de El alto, ubicada en la Avenida 16 de Julio de dicha ciudad. El crédito lo destinara para el aprovisionamiento y compra al por mayor de mercadería, pues debido a la inflación que ataca al país, los precios de los insumos para la preparación de sus comidas están subiendo cada día. De esta forma ella podrá reducir sus gastos y no tener que aumentar el precio de sus comidas y correr el riesgo de perder clientes. Es el quinto crédito con impro; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito. Clotilde es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To buy food to prepare foods (whose prices have gone up due to inflation).

loans.name: Racia

texts.en:
Racia is a lively and beautiful 21-year-old woman, originally from Maputo. Soon after she finished primary school, in 2003, she moved to Ponta D’Ouro to work. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Racia has 2 daughters: Beluxa who is 3 years old and Jessica, 6 months old. She was married for 3 years and recently went through a divorce; her ex-husband left her soon after she returned with Jessica after a month in South Africa (the baby got sick and there are no hospitals in Ponta). Beluxa is currently living with her mother-in-law in Maputo, and Racia visits her whenever possible (roughly once a month).

Racia has been working as a cleaning lady at the same house since 2003. Her bosses are South Africans and have 2 houses in Ponta, one where they live and other to rent for tourists. Racia cleans both houses, does some laundry and other things when asked. She had her monthly salary raised from R250 in 2003 to current R900 (around US$ 80) and also learnt how to speak English. Racia works at the houses from 8am to 1pm daily, and leaves Jessica with her neighbor, paying her R200 per month to look after the baby. As food is too expensive in Ponta, Racia gives half of her monthly salary to her bosses, who bring food and clothes from South Africa. They are also helping with the baby expenses after Racia’s husband left her. In the summer and during holidays, Racia works with tourists and is able to increase her monthly income significantly, especially because of the tips.

This is Racia’s second loan with Hluvuku. The first loan of MTn 5,000 she used to build the walls of her house. She repaid the loan in advance and was able to apply for this second loan of MTn 6,000. She wants to build a new house in a quieter place, as the neighborhood where she is currently living is too noisy and she doesn’t feel safe by herself. She already started buying some construction materials, and with this loan she will be able to buy the rest and potentially start construction. Soon after the house is built, Racia wants to rent out her current house to increase her income.

In the future, Racia intends to apply for a third loan to finish building her house and to buy a fridge. The picture shows Racia with Jessica.

loans.use: Buy construction material to continue building a house for herself and her baby

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara P. is the proud mother of three grown children. She and her family live in Primorsk, Ukraine. Tamara sells women’s clothing and footwear in the local central market. She always offers the same good quality merchandise, which makes her vending kiosk a popular destination for customers. Moreover, her honesty and friendliness with clients only adds to success of her trade. Presently, Tamara’s turnover capital is about $8000. Her monthly net profit is about $5000.

High inflation in Ukraine has hurt Tamara’s business and has caused some losses for her recently. That is why she is hoping to secure additional financing so she can purchase more merchandise for retail sale. Tamara is planning to open one more vending facility at the market in the near future. We believe her consistency and hard work will help Tamara reach her goals and take her business to the next level.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loans.name: Celio

texts.pt:
Celio M. was born in August, 1981 in the Magude district and grew up with his parents. When he was 2 years old his father, who worked for the Ministry of Health, was transferred to the Namaacha district Hospital which meant his whole family had to move. He began his education in 1988 at a local school and finished 12th grade in 2005. The following year his father informed him that he was financially unable to continue with the cost of his college studies now that he was also paying for school for his younger siblings. His father had retired.

It was in this situation that Celio decided to begin producing income raising chickens. He got experience from the other operators that do the same thing. With HLUVUKU beginning operations in 2007 he submitted a request for financing to purchase chickens to enlarge his business. He says that he had success and that is the reason he is submitting a second loan request for 25,000MT for the same purpose. He intends to increase his business and hire 3 people to care for the business while he resumes his studies at a university in the Capital of the country (Maputo) that is located 72 km from the town of Namaacha.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Celio M., Nasceu em agosto de 1981 no distrito de Magude e cresceu na companhia dos pais. Com os seus dois anos, o pai que trabalhava para Ministerio da Saude foi transferido para o hospital distrital de Namaacha tendo significado mudança de residençia para toda familia. Iniciou os estudos no ano de 1988 na Escola local e concluiu a 12ª- classe no ano de 2005 No ano seguinte o pai informa lhe da indisponibilidade financeira para contiuar a custeiar os seus estudos no nivel superior, uma vez que tambem estava a pagar escola para os filhos mais novos. O pai ja encontrava se reformado.

Foi perante esta situaçao que o celio decidiu iniciar a pratica de actividade de rendimento, fazendo avicultura. Buscou experiencia nos outros operadores que fazem a mesma actividade. Com a entrada da HLUVUKU a operar, em 2007, submeteu um pedido de financiamento para compra de pintos para ampliar o seu negocio. Diz que tem tido sucesso, razao pelo qual submete o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 25.000 meticais com o mesmo proposito. Tem como perspectiva, ampliar a sua actividade de forma a empregar 3 pessoas para cuidarem do negocio enquanto ele retoma os estudos numa das universidades da cidade capital do pais (Maputo) que dista se 72 km da vila de Namaacha.

loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga K. is married with two children. She is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Olga owns a vending kiosk where she sells dishware, souvenirs, and gifts at the Yubileinyi market. She always plans her business policies very carefully, which brings her good profits and helps in the success of her business. Olga has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, her working capital is about $5,400. Her monthly net profit is about $1,200.

Olga loves working in this sphere of commerce because she believes the gifts and souvenirs she sells bring more smiles and happy moments to people’s lives and make their lives brighter and more diverse. She would like to continue expanding her venture. Today, Olga is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her turnover capital which she believes will help her be successful in maintaining the stable growth of her business.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a daughter named Svetlana. She is an enterprising business owner who works in the sphere of clothing sales. Ludmila runs a small business selling men’s shirts in one of the most popular markets in Zaporozhye. Ludmila offers merchandise that is unique – there are very few kiosks with the same inventory in her market. She has been in this trade for 5 years. Her turnover capital is about $2500. Some of the strong characteristics of her business are its stability and the quality of merchandise offered.

Ludmila wants a loan of $1000 to purchase a wide range of clothing items. which will help her improve the quality of her work and get more customers. Ludmila is willing to take business risks, but she knows how to weigh all her decisions before committing to anything. Moreover, she is very devoted to the success of her business and has proven that she will be able to repay this loan without a problem.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Marta Arlinda

texts.pt:
Marta Arlinda M. was born August 9, 1972 in Maputo where she spent her childhood. In 1979, due to her father being transferred, she came to Namaacha and began school in the same year at the elementary school of Mugado. She completed 5th grade in 1983.

Her father left her mom and went to neighboring South Africa abandoning his children. Despite this situation in 1984 she went to High School and with many difficulties finished 6th and 7th grades, and in 1986 she was able to finish 8th and 9th grades.

In 1989 she entered the Namaacha Center of Formation of Elementary Teachers and she did her first year living in a boarding school. Her father returned from South Africa in 1990 and prevented her from continuing her studies alleging that she was too young and couldn't live in the boarding school. He ordered her to stop her general education.

In 1991 she returned to High School and tried to finish 10th grade, but unfortunately she was not able to finish. In 1992 her father returned to South Africa and again she faced a financial crisis so she went back to the boarding school to conclude her teaching courses in 1994.
