In 1995 she started work in an elementary school in Mugado as a teacher where she still works. In 1999 she married her husband. She became pregnant in 2002 but lost her child and never had any others.

With help from her husband and his earnings she was able to construct a small commercial establishment and an installation to raise chickens. She learned of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA through a conversation with her colleagues so she solicited a loan for 15,000MT to purchase products for her business. In the future she intends to construct a house and improve the chicken coop infrastructure so she can run 2 businesses and diversify her risk.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Marta Arlinda M., nasceu aos 09 de Agosto de1972 em Maputo, passa a sua infância na cidade de Maputo. Em 1979 devido a trasferência do pai vem a namaacha e inicia os seus estudos no mesmo ano na Escola Primaria de Mugado onde conclui a 5ª classe em 1983. O pai separa-se da mãe e emigra parra a vizinha Africa do Sul, abandonando assim os seus filhos, devido a esta situação em 1984 ingressa na Escola Secundaria e com muitas dificuldades faz a 6ª e7ª, e em 1986 consegue terminar a 8ª e 9ª classe. Em 1989 ingressa no centro de Formação de Professores Primários de namaacha e faz o 1º ano vivendo no internato. O pai volta da Africa do Sul em 1990 e impede-a de continuar com os estudos alegando que ela era menor de idade e não podia viver no internato, manda-lhe concluir o ensino geral. Em 1991 de volta a Escola Secundaria tenta fazer a 10ª classe e infelizmente não consegue transitar de classe. Em 1992 o pai volta para Africa do Sul entra assim de novo numa crise financeira e volta de novo ao internato e conclui o curso de Professorado em 1994. Em 1995 começa a trabalhar na Escola Primaria do Mugado como professora, onde está a trabalhar ate então. Em 1999 une-se com o seu esposo, fica grávida em 2002 e perde o seu filho, e assim não teve mais filhos, com ajuda do marido e do seu vencimento consegue construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial e um instalacoes para criação de frangos. Soube da existência da HLUVUKU- ADSEMA numa conversa com seus colegas e a aproximou-se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 15,000MT para aumentar stocks de produtos no estabelecimento dela. Pretende futuramente construir a sua casa e melhorar as infraestruturas de criacao de frangos para gerir dois negocios, diversificando desta maneira o risco.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a motivated young businessman from Zaporozhye, a city in the central part of Ukraine. He operates his own key duplication business on the south side of Zaporozhye. Igor’s business has grown in the four years since he started and he is making preparations for further expansion. Recently, he purchased a small kiosk that he’d like to remodel to use for an additional location. He rents one of his business places, but by owning, he can help keep his overhead costs down. Igor has around $3000 invested in his business and he makes about $700 profit each month.

Igor has requested a short term loan of $300 to help with expenses involved in opening his new business location. Igor has proven to be a smart, responsible business owner. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist with the ongoing success of his business.

loans.use: Help to open a new business location

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married and has one son. He supports his family by driving a taxi around the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. Ivan has been a taxi driver for eleven years and, while working, has never had even a fender-bender. The flexibility of taxi driving allowed Ivan to take care of his father when he was ill. He was able to help his dad during the day and work as a taxi driver at night. Ivan owns his own vehicle, but has an agreement with one of the taxi dispatching companies in Ivano-Frankivsk. A radio in his cab allows Ivan to receive taxi requests and increase his business.

Ivan has requested a loan of $1000 to have repairs done to his vehicle including some repainting. This loan will help Ivan maintain his important business asset and allow him to continue earning a good income.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for HOPE Ukraine/Nadiya, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Ana F. was born in 1963 in Maputo in the Chamanculo district. She grew up with her parents and began school at age 6 at the Indisna elementary school where she finished 3rd grade. She moved on to the Mista school of Chamanculo where she completed 4th and 5th grade. In the following year she attended Lhanguene School. During seventh grade in 1981 she became pregnant with her first child and had to interrupt her studies. Ana and her husband had 6 children together and lived in Maputo in the Maxaquene district.

Because she was unemployed her sister-in-law invited her to farm in Namaacha and she began building for it in 1990. In 1993 she decided to go to Namaacha taking all of her children with her and leaving her house in Maputo with her husband because he worked in the city. In 1997 she decided to construct a small commercial establishment next to her home that functioned only 2 years due to the frequent visits to her husband in Maputo. She was unable to manage her business and had to stop operating for some time.

Starting in 2005 she decided to open for business again since her husband's income was not sufficient for the necessities of her family in particular the expenses of education for the children. She learned of HLHUVUKU-ADSEMA through her friend who was already a client, and she solicited a loan for 25,000MT to purchase inventory. In the future she will begin raising chickens to grow the basis of her business with the help of HLUVUKU and their partners.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Localização: Bairro da fronteira-Namaacha Cliente: Ana F. Actividade:Comercio Valor do empréstimo: 25,000.00MT Aplicação: compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Inicio: 05/03/2008 Fim: 27/02/2009 Ana F., nasceu em 1963 em Maputo no Bairro Chamanculo, cresceu com seus pais e iniciou os estudos com 6 anos de idade, na Escola Primaria Bairro Indisna onde conclui a 3ª classe. Passa para a Escola Mista de Chamanculo onde faz a 4ª e 5ª classe e no ano seguinte passa para a Escola secundaria de Lhanguene. Quando frequentava a 7ª classe em 1981 fica grávida do seu 1° filho e teve então que interromper os estudos e junta-se com o seu marido e passaram a viver no bairro com o qual tiveram 6 filhos em Maputo no bairro de Maxaquene. Porque ela era desempregada a cunhada convida-lhe para praticarem a agricultura em Namaacha e em 1990 começou a construir, em 1993 decide passar para Namaacha levando todos filhos com ela deixando a sua casa em Maputo com o seu esposo uma vez que ele trabalha na cidade do Maputo. Em 1997 decide construir um pequeno estabelecimento comecial junto a sua residência que funcionou apenas 2 anos devido as suas visitas frequentes ao seu marido na cidade do Maputo, desta maneira não conseguia controlar o seu negocio e teve que parar por algum tempo com o negocio. Apartir de 2005 decide reiniciar com a actividade uma vez que a renda do marido nao satisfaz as necessidades familiares, com particular destaque as despesas de educacao dos filhos. Soube da LHUVUKU- ADSEMA através da sua amiga ja cliente da instituicao, tendo solicitado um credito de 25,000,00MT para reforçar o stock de produtos. Futuramente iniciar com a criação de frangos para aumentar o fundo do seu negócio e para tal conta com ajuda da HLUVUKU e seus parceiros.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Elias Comé was born on April 11, 1964 in the Inharrime district and spent his childhood there. He began school in 1971 at the elementary school in Magula but quit going that same year due to the distance. In 1976 they moved to Namaacha where he went to school at the elementary school in Namaacha. In 1981 he finished the sixth and seventh grades.

In 1983 he was recruited to fulfill his obligatory military service which ended in 1986. In the same year he began to work in the money office of a warehouse, and in 1988 he was promoted to be head of the office at the same company. In 1989 he married his wife with whom he has 5 children. 2 years later he became Chief of Finances until 1993 when the company closed.

In that same year he began to work in the Society of Namaacha Farming as head of the office and assistant to the book keeper until 1996 when it also had to shut down. He went one year without work.

In 1998 he went on to work in Mozal as a stonemason with a contract for 5 months. In 2000 he began work at Delta Security where he only remained for one year because the work conditions were not good.

In 2001 he worked in security for the TDM company where he works today. He learned of the existence of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA through his colleagues and solicited a loan for 10,000MT to purchase construction materials to finish his family home. In the future he intends to access more credit to construct a local brick factory, a skill he acquired with his friends in the years he was unemployed.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Elias Comé, nasceu ao 11 de Abril de 1964 no distrito de Inharrime, passa a sua infância no mesmo distrito. Inicia os seus estudos em 1971 na Escola Primaria de Magula, e desiste no mesmo ano devido a distância. Em 1976 mudam de residência para Namaacha, reC.ça os estudos na Escola Primária de Namaacha, em 1981 passa para escola secundaria onde frequentou a 6ª e 7ªclasse .

Em 1983 é recrutado para cumprir com o Serviço Militar Obrigatório, tendo concluído em 1986. No mesmo ano C.ça a trabalhar como fiel do armazém, em 1988 passa a ser chefe da secretaria na mesma empresa. Em 1989 junta-se com a sua esposa com a qual tem5 filhos, dois anos depois fica como chefe das finanças até 1993, quando a empresa fechou. No mesmo ano C.ça a trabalhar na sociedade Agro-pecuária de Namaacha como chefe da secretaria e auxiliar de contabilidade até 1996 esta também veio a fechar, e fica um ano sem trabalhar.

Em 1998 passou a trabalha na Mozal como pedreiro num contracto de 5 meses. Em 2000 C.ça a trabalhar na Segurança “ Delta” onde só permaneceu por um período de um ano alegando não ter boas condições de trabalho.

Em 2001 trabalha na Segurança da empresa TDM onde trabalha até então. Soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA através dos colegas e aproximou solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10,000.00MT para a compra de material de construção para concluir residencia familiar. Pretende futuramente adquirir mais crédito para construir uma fábrica de tijolos local, arte adquirida com os seus amigos nos anos que ficou sem emprego.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a family home

loans.name: Saasaai 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
These are the first loans from SPBD for these 11 women of Saasaai on the island of Savaii. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account. They have passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee.  Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and in guaranteeing on-time payments.
The women will use their loans for the following purposes:

Faaoo S. (56, married, 4 children): to purchase paint, paint brushes, roll of material and designs to do Elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of fabric printing) and produce lavalava (wraparound skirt worn by men).

Fuamata T. (55, married, 5 children) to purchase 3 spools of wire and laborers to make a fence for her cattle farming.

Fuatia S. (41, married, 5 children), Seuao F. (42, married, 6 children) and Le S. (48, married, 6 children): each will purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings (knife sharpeners) and fertilizers to cultivate and sell taro, bananas and tuamu.

Luafalealii P. (46, married, 7 children) to purchase canned tuna fish, flour, a bag of rice, chicken legs, soap, sugar and milk to sell at her shop.

Nelly A. (70, married, 9 children) to purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, knives, filings and fertilizers to cultivate and sell bananas, cucumbers, tomatoes and other vegetables.

Pelesepi M. (25, married, 3 children) to purchase cement, metal, iron roofing and cooking ingredients to build a bakery and sell pies, donuts, biscuits and other baked goods.

Siauga F. (24, married, 1 child) to purchase a weed killing sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, spade, crowbar and fertilizers to cultivate and sell taro, bananas and tuamu.

Soo F. (64, married, 3 children) to purchase a stove, flour, sugar, oil and baking powder to make chicken and pancakes (round lumps of fried bread).

Talai I. (53, married, 2 children) purchase fertilizer, spade, filings, cabbage seeds, cucumber seeds, tomato seeds and a knife to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase various items for farming and food production

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta I. has been in business for four years now. She runs a flea market business in the City of Apia selling shoes. This business has helped Elisapeta support her family, especially her children's education. She has a very good loan history and has already paid back her previous loans with no difficulties. Elisapeta has 5 grown up children, with two of them working now, and three still in school. She is requesting a loan of $1000 which she will use to purchase 3-dozen  shoes for her business and also iron roofing for her house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for her flea market

loans.name: Faapito

texts.en: Faapito G. is a 36-year old mother of 4 children. Faapito used to be employed at Samoan National Provident Fund, but resigned 3 years ago due to her husband's illness. When Faapito left work, she joined SPBD for financial support in starting up her business, which is now very successful. Her business has helped her support her family very well. And she aims to stay in the program and continue doing her business, so that she can move up to another level of success. She hopes that one day she’ll be able to turn her BBQ business into a restaurant. She wants to give her children the best education so that they can be well employed in the future and help her out with her dream.

loans.use: To purchase lamb ribs, chicken, sausages and rice for her BBQ business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena T. is a 26-year old mother of 2 children from Faleseela. She was educated in Samoa College (high school) and finished there. She didn’t have the chance to go to the university due to lack of finances, because both her parents got sick and had no strength to continue to work in their plantation. So, in 2005, Filomena joined SPBD, and borrowed $300 to restart her parent’s plantation. Her business was improving slowly month-by-month, until her father passed away. After her father's death, Filomena paid back her 300 loan and stopped working on the plantation. For a period of time, she relied on her husband's salary for supporting her family. Now her children are ready to start schooling, but she can’t afford to send them to school. That is why Filomena wishes to restart her plantation business. She is requesting a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for her plantation and vegetable garden.

loans.name: Fololina

texts.en: Fololina M. runs a plantation and vegetable garden business.  She’s a very hard working lady with 3 children. Her husband is unemployed but helping her in running her business. Fololina has paid back her debts and is requesting another loan of $500.  She will use the profits from her business to pay back her loan and for renovation to her bathroom. She’s a very active member in our program and motivates other members in her community.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana T. is a mother of four children from the village of Salamumu. Her business is working a plantation (taro) and making handicrafts like earrings made out of coconut shell,s etc. She’s from an extended family with a total number of 14 members. Apart from her earning money to support her family, her sister-in-law is employed in one of the surf resorts in their village. But she idoesn't earn much in that job. Hana's husband is unemployed, but gives great support to Hana and the business. She owns a 3- acre taro plantation, that also has coconut trees. With the profits from her requested loan, she plans to extend their family house to accommodate their extended family. She has successfully paid off all her previous loans, and is now requesting more financial support.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for handicraft business.

loans.name: Iliganoa

texts.en: Running a canteen business is not easy for Iliganoa, but what motivated her to keep her business is the service that she wants to offer to the children of her district. She explains that from Monday to Friday she has to get up at 4am in the morning to start her preparation: making sandwiches, sausage rolls, hot dogs, etc. She doesn’t hire anyone to work for her, but she has two daughters that are helping her out with the preparation before they depart for work. This business has become really successful for Iliganoa due to the service she provides and the nutritional value of the food she sells. She has been in business for more than three years now, and she is 55 years old and still willing to keep her business running well. With her requested loan she plans to buy an electric stove to so she won't have to wake up so early to gather fire wood.

loans.use: To purchase an electric oven for easy preparation of her canteen food.

loans.name: Lopepe

texts.en: Lopepe is a married mother of three children. She is requesting a loan of $700 to pay for a fence around her taro plantation.  With the profits from her plantation, she can pay for her eldest daughter’s semester fee. Her daughter is entering University this year.  This will be her 3rd loan with SPBD and it shows how SPBD has helped her out very much in supporting her family. Lopepe’s business is the main source of income in her family, and she is very pleased with the great support that her family is giving her business. She aims to find a good market for her taro overseas.

loans.use: To purchase fencing materials for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia T. has joined a community of twelve ladies in the village of Letogo. The common business in their community is growing vegetable gardens. She says that there is always a high demand for vegetables everyday and especially during weekends. Having the same business as the other ladies is not a problem for them, because they each have their own customers (the supermarket and hotel owners). Lusia earns about $40 a day and double that on weekends if she sells to general public. When she supplies her regular customers, she will double her earning in one week. Her business is very much improving, and she want to increase her output because of high competition with the other ladies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and more vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun S., age 34, is married with three children. One child is too young to attend school, and the other two are students. Mrs. S. works as a farmer growing rice on a plot of her farmland. She normally earns around $1 a day. Her husband Mr. Sout Sambuk (pictured here), is 36, and is a motor-taxi driver. He makes a profit of about $2 a day.

Mrs. Samouen requests a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer for her farmland. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy rice, take the husks off the rice, and then resell to the villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem M., age 52, is the mother of eight children, and she and her husband work as farmers. Usually, they earn around $3 a day. Four children are married and two of them live away form home. The other children help with the farming. (Mrs. Nem M. is pictured here with her daughter in the background. )

To improve the family’s income and help them produce more crops, they request a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Mrs. Duch C., age 47, and her husband (pictured here) own a plot of farmland and grow rice. They earn approximately $3 a day. This couple has five children; one of them is employed as a garment worker and has a salary of $70 a month. Other children stay at home and help them grow rice.

To increase the family’s income and reduce expenses, this couple requests a loan to purchase a grinding mill that takes the husks off the rice. They will hire the local people to run the machine. They will have more rice to sell, which will provide more income to sustain the family.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Mrs. Huy N., age 50, has seven children, and she and her husband raise pigs on a piece of land at their house. They earn about $5 a day. Two of their children are garment workers who each earn $80 per month. Three children are students, and two others are married and live separately.

Mrs. N. is requesting her second loan from Credit MFI. She plans to use the loan to increase her business breeding pigs by purchasing more pigs. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy food for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to expand the herd

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov T., age 37, owns a plot of farmland, and she and her husband (pictured here) grow rice. Usually, they earn a profit of about $2 a day. They have three children and all of them are students.

To increase the family’s income, this family would like to create another business. Mrs. T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase mangoes and resell them in the market.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes and resell them in the market

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hà, 39, was having a difficult life. She was having some health issues so she could not work on tasks that require force. She has 3 children and 2 of them had suddenly developed illness which had left sequela. So everything is relied on her husband, Mr Liên, who works on their small piece of land so things are very difficult for the family. She then joined TYM and got a loan which she used to buy goods from H. Noi city then to resell. Everyday her husband would go to every hamlet in the village to sell the goods. After a while, someone she knows teaches her how to make those paper horses and other religious objects made with paper and bamboo that people would burn as offerings in religious ceremony. So she learned the trade since it is not a forceful task. She applied for a loan and started this business. She had since then obtained numerous loans totaling in the thousands usd. This had turned her life around, things have really improved for her family. She has a lot of customers especially during the end of the year (when there are a lot of ceremonies). Her income is 200-220 USD a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy material (paper, bamboo).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hoàn cảnh gia đinh chị Nguyễn Thị Hà, 39 tuổi, trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ rất khó khăn về cả vật chất lẫn tinh thần. Bản thân chị sức khoẻ yếu không làm được công việc nặng, 2 trong 3 đứa con, 13, 15 tuổi, đang khoẻ mạnh lần lượt ốm và để lại di chứng. Tất cả trông chờ vào anh Liên, chồng chị, với vài sào ruộng, cuộc sống quả thật rất vất vả. Tham gia vào Quỹ, chị đã dùng đồng vốn nhỏ bé ban đầu mua hàng từ Hà nội về. Hàng ngày chồng chị rong ruổi trên các đường làng ngõ xóm bán hàng rong, thu nhập từ đó cũng được cải thiện. Sau một thời gian có người quen bàn chuyện và dạy cách làm hàng mã. Thấy công việc khả quan và rất phù hợp với sức khỏe của mình, chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn lớn đầu tư cho dự án này. Đến nay số vốn đầu tư lên đến vài nghìn USD, cuộc sống đã thật sự thay đổi với chị và gia đình. Khách hàng đến với cửa hàng ngày càng đông, nhất là những dịp cuối năm nên chị tất bật suốt ngày. Thu nhập của cả gia đình đạt 200-220USD/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị Hà tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua nguyên liệu (giấy, nan tre) làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy paper, bamboo to make votive objects

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Since her house's location is excellent to run a business, Mrs Lương Thị V. had applied for a loan and opened a restaurant to serve the workers in the area. She is 42 years old. Her husband is a cadre so he has a lot of contacts plus the food that she serves is good so the restaurant is quite busy. The revenue from the restaurant is stable. She makes 250-270 USD a month. One of the secret to attract and retain customers is to have an excellent service, friendly and warm. Her plan is to obtain a loan of 950 USD to buy food, add more items to the menu to better serve the customers. She's living in Bình Xuyên, Vĩnh Phúc with her husband and their 4 young children

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tận dụng nhà ở là địa điểm thuận lợi cho việc kinh doanh, buôn bán, chị Lương Thị V., 42 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn vay vốn kinh doanh bán hàng ăn phục vụ công nhân viên chức. Chồng chị là một cán bộ đang công tác cộng với món ăn sạch và rất ngon nên cửa hàng có nhiều khách quen. Nhờ đó thu nhập từ cửa hàng khá cao và ổn định. Mỗi tháng chị thu từ 250-270USD. Một trong những bí quyết giúp thu hút khách hàng của chị V. là phục vụ chu đáo, nhiệt tình và luôn niềm nở. Thật tuyệt nếu được thưởng thức một bát phở do chính tay chị chế biến. Dự định của chị V. là sẽ xin vay 950USD mua nguyên liệu làm hàng ăn và mở rộng cửa hàng, phục vụ khách ngày càng tốt hơn. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 4 con trong độ tuổi đi học tại Bình Xuyên, Vĩnh Phúc.

loans.use: Buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị N. is 29 years old. She is a 5th year TYM member, branch Bình Xuyên. Her husband, Hoàn, is from Minh Tân (Yên Lạc) area which has a reputation for skilled woodworker. He got married with N. in Gia Khánh and they settled there. Since he is a skilled woodworker, they had decided to open a wood shop in their house. After a while, they made themselves known to the customers by the quality of their work so there are a lot of customers who come from far away to make their orders. After 5 good years, they have built a nice house, their shop had expanded as well. Their investment in this business totals 20000 USD. Their monthly income is 300-350 USD. Since they are successful, Mrs N. wishes to continuing getting loans from TYM to invest. This time she is requesting 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị N., 29 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh Bình Xuyên. Anh Hoàn, chồng chị, quê ở đất Minh Tân (Yên Lạc) là nơi có nghề truyền thống làm mộc, lên Gia khánh lấy vợ năm 2002 rồi lập nghiệp tại đó. Thấy được tiềm năng phát huy tay nghề vốn có, chị N. cùng chồng đã quyết định thành lập xưởng mộc của gia đình. Sau một thời gian ngắn cở sở của chị N. đã có được uy tín với khách hàng, nhiều khách ở nơi khác cũng đến đặt mua. Sau 5 năm gia đình chị đã có một cơ ngơi với ngôi nhà hai tầng khang trang, cơ sở sản xuất của cũng khá lớn. Vốn đầu tư của gia đình giờ đã lên đến 20000USD, thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 300-350USD. Đầu tư vốn lớn làm ăn có hiệu quả nên mong muốn của chị N. là sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn lớn mở rộng sản xuất kinh doanh. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
It requires a lot of capital to invest in transport business. It also requires a lot of guts & determination to make it work. Mrs Nguyễn Thị Chí is 46 years old. She and her husband had used a loan from TYM to buy a truck to start up a transport business since they live near a brick factory. They have signed a contract to assure the delivery of bricks to the company's customers. This business is stable. They make about 370-400 USD a month. Her husband drives the truck all day, she's at home raising poultry. She is very busy but she always participates in TYM group meetings. This time she applies for a loan of 1200 USD to repair the truck so it does require a lot of money. In the future, she will apply for other loan to invest in retails.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Đầu tư vào kinh doanh vận tải là một trong ít số dự án có vốn đầu tư lớn, đòi hỏi phải mạnh dạn, dám nghĩ dám làm. Với lợi thế ở gần nhà máy gạch men gốm sứ, chị Nguyễn Thị Chí, 46 tuổi, và chồng đã huy động vốn của gia đình và vay của Quỹ mua xe tải chở hàng. Chị ký hợp đồng với nhà máy vận chuyển gạch men cho khách hàng ở nhiều nơi, nhiều tỉnh. Công việc nhiều và đều dặn nên thu nhập rất ổn định. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả gia đình từ 370-400USD. Chồng đi chở hàng cả ngày, chị Chí ở nhà chăn nuôi. Công việc bận rộn nhưng chị vẫn luôn tích cực tham gia vào các hoạt động của cụm. Vòng vốn tới chị đầu tư để đại tu và nâng cấp lại cho xe nên vốn vay cần cũng lớn, chị Chí dự định xin vay 1200USD. Thời gian tới kế hoạch của chị là tiếp tục vay vốn lớn để đầu tư mở cửa hàng buôn bán kinh doanh dịch vụ tổng hợp

loans.use: Repair her van

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
When TYM started its operations in the hamlet where Mrs Tươi lives in May 2002, most of the families in the region were facing difficult living conditions. This region is sided by the river so there is not much land for cultivation. So it was not easy just to rely on the land to provide the income. In the beginning, Mrs Tươi received 70 USD as the first loan. She used this money to raise pigs. After one year, considering that it was a success, she had applied for bigger loans. She has invested in farming fishes and pigs. Her installation is large scale. Today she has a 4/10 acre fish pond, 1 dozen of pigs, vegetables and fruit plants. After 5 years with TYM, her family living condition has improved considerably and so did a lot of other families in the region. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs, fishes and food for the animals. Mrs Tươi lives with her husband and 2 of their 3 children, the oldest one is working in Ha Noi city.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tháng 5 năm 2002, khi Quỹ Tình thương mở rộng về thôn, phần đông gia đình các thành viên nói chung và gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Tươi, 39 tuổi, nói riêng thuộc vào diện khó khăn. Là vùng bãi ven sông diện tích đất có hạn nên cuộc sống người dân chỉ quanh quẩn vài sào ruộng khoán trồng lúa và rau màu, thu nhập thấp và không ổn định. Ban đầu chị Tươi cũng chỉ vay 70USD chăn nuôi nhỏ. Sau một năm, thấy được hiệu quả từ vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn lớn hơn đầu tư cải tạo vườn tạp, đào ao thả cá và chăn nuôi khá . Hiện tại gia đình chị có hơn 4 sào ao thả cá với vài tạ cá thịt sắp cho thu hoạch, một chục con lợn, hơn 3 sào trồng rau hành, cây ăn quả thu nhập đều. Sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ cuộc sống gia đình chị và các gia đình thành viên khác đã và đang thực sự thay đổi từng ngày. Vòng vốn này chị Tươi xin vay 1200USD để mua lợn, cá giống và thức ăn gia súc. Hiện chị Tươi đang sống cùng chồng và hai con trong độ tuổi đi học, con trai lớn của chị đang làm công nhân ngoài Hà Nội.

loans.use: Buy pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Like any other family in her neighborhood, Mrs Nguyễn Thị Diện and her family were facing difficulty. With determination, hard work and self confidence they have raised above poverty. Mrs Diện is 35 years old. She joined TYM 5 years ago. She had a business plan and she was quite certain to success.After much discussion with her husband, they had decided to invest in fish farming which would yield high profit. Beside that they also cultivated vegetables (1/2 acre), planted 100 grapefruit plats and built a pig pen to raise pigs. After numerous rounds of loans, they have riped fruit from their hard work. They have overcome poverty. Now they are living comfortably. They manage their farm following the VAC process. Their annual income is 2000-2500 USD. Her wish is to remain TYM member, continuing to expand her business. This time she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cũng gặp khó khăn như nhiều gia đình khác trong cụm nhưng gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Diện, 35 tuổi, thực sự đi lên nhờ sự tự tin, mạnh dạn, dám nghĩ dám làm. 5 năm trước, tuy mới tham gia Quỹ nhưng chị đã biết suy nghĩ tận dụng điều kiện đang có để đầu tư dự án đạt hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Năm 2003 chị Diện bàn với chồng nhận thầu khúc sông thả cá với số vốn khá lớn. Bên cạnh đó chị còn dồn điền đổi thửa đấu thầu thêm hơn 5 sào đất trồng rau hành và hơn trăm gốc bưởi Diễn. Ngoài ra chị còn xây dựng truồng trại chăn nuôi lợn. Sau nhiều vòng vốn vay đến nay cơ ngơi của gia đình chị Diễn đã khá khang trang, đời sống kinh tế gia đình từ chỗ khó khăn trở thành gia đình khá. Mô hình VAC mỗi năm mang lại cho chị Diễn từ 2000-2500USD lợi nhuận. Mong muốn của của chị và gia đình là sẽ tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ để vay vốn lớn phát triển kinh tế. Mức vốn đề nghị vòng này của chị Diện là 1200USD

loans.use: Buy pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Narida

texts.en: Narida A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has lived with her family in Beylagan since 1993. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business more than seven years. She has applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $400. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. E. Oun was born around 1955 in the village of Prek Ta Chor, in Kandal Province. She is a subsistence farmer and mother of four children, three of whom are working in a garment factory, and one who is enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Bunlong Ny, a hard-working farmer cultivating his own land near his house, needs to support his family, but he gets sick often. To assist him, his wife is requesting a loan of $400 to treat his disease.

loans.use: To treat her husband's disease.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Ms. Sareth S., 39 and single, has lived in the village of Prk Rang in Kandal Province since she was a child.  She is a garment worker earning about $2 per day in the factory located next to her village.  However, Sareth would now like to start an animal husbandry business in her village and therefore is requesting a loan of $525 to purchase some pigs to begin this enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Sampan I Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Sampan I Village Bank consists of 29 people who live along the Basac River. Most of them are farmers, and Mrs. Kimly N., Village Bank President, dedicates herself as a subsistence farmer I. the local village. Mrs. N., 43 years old, is a childless widow who can generate an income of about $1.50 per day through her bean crop.  She and her group are now requesting a loan to purchase more bean seeds with which to cultivate their land.

loans.use: To purchase more bean seeds to cultivate their land.

payments.comment: Mrs. Leangleak Teng and Mrs. Sokeng Hot, two members of this village bank, were able to make an extra repayment in the amount of $25 each.

This repayment is for May 2008; this group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Sreang Mich decided to pay off her repayment.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Sok Chheng And Mrs. Chantha Team Decided To Do Their Pre-Payment. Additionally, Mrs. Choy Sok, Mrs. Sokcheng Heang, Mrs. Silon Chheng Decided to Finish Their Loan Term So They Paid All The Loan Amount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya B. is married with an 11-year-old son named Pavel. They live in Novaya Kahovka, in the Kherson region. Nataliya sells clothing at one of the local markets. One of her fundamental policies has been to always have an individual approach to each of her clients. Nataliya has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, her net profit is about $100-$160 a month.

Nataliya is very open-hearted and sincere. She and her family are Christians and approach everything, including business, with a Christian mindset. Nataliya believes that being honest in doing business and dealing with customers is paramount to business success. Using this loan of $500, Nataliya is hoping to expand her trade so she can save enough money to purchase a new vending location, do well in the world of business, and help to ensure a secure future.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana Z. is married with one daughter. She lives in downtown Primorsk and sells women’s clothing and men’s footwear at the central city market. The type of merchandise she sells is designed for middle-aged office workers. Tatyana’s inventory always sells well thanks to its good quality and an assortment of affordable inventory. Currently, her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $1000.

Tatyana is an entrepreneur of integrity with long experience working in this sphere of trade. Moreover, she’s very communicative and outgoing. Today, Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional merchandise and possibly open an additional vending location in the future. We believe Tatyna’s professionalism, which has always been one of the most important keys to successful entrepreneurship, will help her reach her goals and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Akouto

texts.fr:
Miss Akouto A. was born on June 6, 1984 in Lomé. She is single and presently runs a liquor store, also selling cases of canned drinks wholesale in her little shop, "A. & Fils". She began this business in 2006 and was selling retail at that time. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 which will permit her to purchase certain drinks that she does not presently have available in her shop. She would like to buy 10 cartons of whisky with half of the loan money and use the rest to have a display case made for her merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Akouto est née le 6 juin 1984 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire et exerce actuellement le commerce de liqueur et de boissons en canette en gros dans sa boutique « A. & FILS ». Elle a commencé cette activité en 2006 et vendait en détail. Le crédit de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter les boissons dont elle ne dispose pas dans sa boutique. A cet effet elle désire acheter dix (10) cartons de whisky avec la moitié des fonds et le reste faire un étalage pour exposer ses marchandises.

loans.use:
Expand her inventory of drinks

Augmenter le stock le stock de boissons

loans.name: Vladislav

texts.en:
Vladislav is a sharp young entrepreneur from Zaporozhye, Ukraine. He owns a small business making duplicate keys. Vladislav started his business about five years ago with just one location. Since then, he has opened two additional kiosks and has hired employees to work for him. Each of his business places are in locations with good visibility, convenient access, and plenty of passing customer traffic, all of which helps to ensure stable demand and profits. Vladislav makes around $700 per month from his business.

Vladislav has requested a loan of $1000 to increase his available working capital. He has proven to be a reliable, goal-oriented business owner and has established a good relationship with Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy to be able to further assist him with operating a successful, profitable business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Adjoyo Elom

texts.fr:
Born on December 24, 1978 in Agou, which is located 110 kilometers from Lomé , Miss Adjoyo Elom A. is single but is the breadwinner for two other people as well as herself. Her primary business is selling photographic accessories such as batteries, film, paper, memory cards, etc. in the central market in Lomé , a business she has been engaged in since 2001.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 which will permit her to purchase 25 cartons of film, 12 cartons of batteries, and 6 cartons of paper. In this fashion, Adjoyo Elom A. will expand her inventory so that she can better serve her customers and make more profit from her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 24 décembre 1978 à Agou localité située à 110 km de Lomé, Mademoiselle A. Adzoyo Elom est célibataire et a deux personnes à charge. Elle a pour activité principale, la vente des accessoires de photographie (piles, pellicules, papiers, cartes mémoire etc.) au grand marché de Lomé depuis 2001.

Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter vingt cinq (25) cartons de pellicules, douze (12) cartons de piles, six (6) cartons de papiers. Ainsi A. Adjoyo Elom augmente son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients et en retour tirer un profit.

loans.use:
Expand her stock of photographic accessories

Augmenter son stock d'accessoires de photographie

loans.name: Akoélé Monique

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoélé Monique E. was born on September 24, 1979 in Tchékpé Dévé in the Kloto Prefecture, 125 kilometers from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been working as an ambulant vendor of generic pharmaceutical products in the Agoè area since 2002. She uses the money she earns to contribute to the daily expenses of her family.

Mrs. Akoété Monique E. would like to be able to sell lengths of African print cloth at the same time as her other products, so as to diversify her sources of income.

For this reason she is requesting a first-time loan of US$ 725 to purchase 20 lengths of cloth as well as generic pharmaceutical products so that she can earn more money.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Akoélé Monique est née le 24 septembre 1979 à Tchékpé Dévé dans la préfecture de Kloto à 125 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse ambulante des produits pharmaceutiques génériques dans le quartier d’Agoè depuis l’année 2002. Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille à travers le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité.

Madame E. Akoété Monique aimerait ajouter le commerce de pagne à son activité principale pour pouvoir diversifier ses sources de revenu.

A cet effet, elle sollicite pour la première fois un crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter vingt (20) pièces de pagnes et des produits pharmaceutiques génériques afin d’améliorer ses recettes

loans.use:
Purchase of lengths of African print cloth for re-sale

Achat de pagnes destinés à vendre

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Mrs.Dopé A. D. is married and the mother of eight children who are all enrolled in school. She was born on January 23, 1961 in Lomé and is married to Mr. Kodjo Sowou. She buys and sells locally produced mineral water in the market of Agoè Assiyéyé which is located to the north of the city of Lomé. With the income from this business, Mrs. Dopé A. D. helps to pay her children's school fees. She would like to add the sale of rice and vegetable oil to her primary business venture.

The loan of US$ 600 that she is requesting should allow her to purchase 10 sacks of rice and 10 tins of vegetable oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. D. Dopé est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est née le 23 janvier 1961 à Lomé et s’est mariée à Monsieur SOWOU Kodjo. Elle achète et revend de l’eau minérale produite localement dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé situé au nord de la ville de Lomé. Avec le revenu de cette activité Madame A. D. Dopé contribue à la prise en charge scolaire de ses enfants. Elle souhaite ajouter la vente de riz et d’huile végétale à son activité principale.

Le crédit de 250.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite devrait lui permettre d’acheter dix (10) sacs de riz et dix (10) bidons d’huile végétale.

loans.use:
Stock up on oil and rice

Faire le stock d'huille et de riz

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana Z. is married with a 7-year-old daughter. Her family lives in Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Tatyana has been an entrepreneur for 7 years. She sells men’s footwear in the local market. Currently, her gross income is about $12000. Her net profit is about $5000.

Tatyana’s family lives with her parents. It has been Tatyna’s biggest dream to repair and remodel their apartment to make it more comfortable for their big family. That is why she remains very consistent and constant in her pursuit of business expansion and development. Tatyana is currently seeking a loan of $600. She hopes to re-stock her inventory and work to improve the living standards for her family.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Residing in Lomé for more than 10 years, Mrs. Afi A. comes from Yopé, which is located 40 kilometers from Lomé. She was born on July 15, 1975 and is married with two children. A very dynamic woman, Mrs. Afi A. retails charcoal, yams and other vegetables, smoked fish, and other foodstuffs in the Adidoadé neighborhood in Lomé. At present, her stock of charcoal is almost gone.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 725 to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal which she intends to sell during the rainy season, when the price of charcoal is high.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Installée à Lomé depuis plus de dix (10) ans, Madame A. Afi est originaire de Yopé localité située à 40 Km de Lomé. Elle est née le 15 juillet 1975 et est mariée avec deux enfants. Très dynamique, Madame A. Afi est revendeuse de charbon de bois, tubercules, de légumes, de poissons fumés et d’autres produits alimentaires dans le quartier Adidoadé à Lomé. Présentement son stock de charbon de bois est presque épuisé.

A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour acheter trente (30) sacs de charbon de bois pour pouvoir vendre en saison des pluies, période pendant laquelle le charbon de bois coûte cher.

loans.use:
Stock up on charcoal for re-sale

Faire le stock de charbon de bois

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with grown children. She lives in Mikhailovka, Zaporozhye region, and sells household chemicals in the local market. Victoria enjoys little competition in her area of trade, which has been one of the reasons for the speedy growth of her venture over the past 12 years. One of the last biggest acquisitions Victoria made was the purchase of a vending kiosk, which has considerably helped in her entrepreneurial endeavours. Presently, Victoria has about $1800 in gross income per month. Her business has been the main source of income for her family.

Victoria has experienced many challenges both as an entrepreneur and an individual, but they have only inured her to overcome difficulties with optimism, patience and hope for a positive outcome. Moreover, all these life circumstances have also taught Victoria to be decisive and multifaceted, which are valuable assets for a small entrepreneur in a competitive market. Victoria is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and her profits as a result.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Adegnika

texts.fr:
Mr. Adegnika A. was born on March 23, 1970 in Lomé. He is married and is the breadwinner for seven people. He owns a little cafeteria and bar which he has named "Great Place". He manages to support his family with the income from his business. Recently, he has had electrical problems since he draws his elecricity from his neighbor's place. In view of these problems, he would like to deal directly with the electric company and have his own meter installed so that he will be able to cool the drinks he sells and thus better serve his customers.

Mr. Adegnika A. would also like to purchase 10 empty drink cases and twenty plastic chairs which will allow him to seat more customers.

Accomplishing these upgrades to his business venture will make it more profitable and allow him to earn more income which he will be able to use to take full responsibility for educating his children and supplying their needs. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 which will allow him to make his plans a reality.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Adegnika est né le 23 mars 1970 à Lomé. Il est marié et a sept (7) personnes à charge. Il est propriétaire d’une cafétéria et d’un bar qu’il a dénommé « GREAT PLACE ». Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec le revenu de son entreprise. Ces derniers temps il a des problèmes d’électricité car il avait fait le branchement auprès de son voisin. Mais compte tenu des problèmes, il voulait faire le branchement directement à la compagnie électrique et avoir son propre compteur afin de pouvoir mettre au frais les boissons qu’il vend et de mieux servir ses clients.

Monsieur A. Adegnika désire également acquérir dix (10) casiers vides de boissons gazeuses et vingt (20) chaises plastiques pouvant lui permettre d’accueillir assez de clients.

La parfaite réalisation de son projet lui permettra d’améliorer la rentabilité de ses affaires et d’accroître ses revenus en vue de prendre entièrement en charge l’éducation de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins. A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA qui lui serviront à réaliser son projet.

loans.use:
Upgrade his business venue

Aménager son lieu d'activités

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina R. is married with two sons. She owns a specialized sportswear store at the central city market in Novaya Kahovk. She sells about 40 different, nice quality, trendy sport suits, sports equipment and accessories. Yekaterina is one of the leading sportswear vendors in the market where she works. She is very perseverant and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 10 years. Yekaterina has about $5000 in inventory at the moment.

Yekaterina is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Yekaterina has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. Yekaterina would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of $500 for 3 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. One of her personal goals is to generate additional profit so she can remodel a new apartment she recently bought for her family.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Yevgenyi

texts.en:
Yevgenyi is single. He’s from Mikhailovka, in the Zaporozhye region of Ukraine. Yevgenyi runs a small business selling appliances and electrical supplies in the local city mall called “Torgovyi Dom” (Trade House). His mom is helping him with his trade. The location of his business is very favorable, because many people shop in the mall and it is always busy. Yevgenyi has only been in this business for one and half years, but his gross income has gone up to $3000 per month.

Yevgenyi is hard working and kind, which gives him the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Yevgenyi has a strong business base. Currently, he is seeking a loan of $800 to increase his turnover capital and hopefully purchase a new vending facility and expand his business. With the increased income, he plans to continue growing his business and improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Aba Amivi

texts.fr:
Born in Gboto in the prefecture of Yoto on September 11, 1982, Aba Amivi T. is married and mother of one child who is enrolled in primary school. She owns a little spare parts store she calls "Les Ezekias", in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase 50 motorcycle tires and 30 innertubes so that she can better serve her customers and increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Gboto dans la préfecture de Yoto, le 11 septembre 1982, T. Aba Amivi est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui fait les études primaires. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de vente des pièces détachées dénommée « LES EZEKIAS » située dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé.

Elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA pour acquérir cinquante pneus (50) de moto et trente (30) chambres à air afin de mieux servir ses clients et d’augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use:
Stock up on tires for re-sale

Faire le stock de pneus

loans.name: Innocent Chukwuemeka

texts.fr:
Of Nigerian nationality, Mr. Innocent Chukwuemeka N. was born July 21st in Aba, Nigeria. He has been living in Togo for over ten years. He is married and has seven children. Mr. Innocent Chukwuemeka N. has been doing business selling suitcases, shoes, and television stands in the Assivito neighborhood of Lomé since the year 2000. He manages to meet the needs of his family with profits from his business. The 500,000 franc CFA loan he is seeking will allow him to buy 20 crates of shoes and re-supply his stock for retail.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

De nationalité nigériane, Monsieur N. Innocent Chukwuemeka est né le 21 juillet 1972 à Aba au Nigeria. Il réside au Togo depuis plus de dix (10) ans. Il s’est marié et a sept (7) enfants. Monsieur N. Innocent Chukwuemeka exerce l’activité de vente de valise, de chaussures et de table de pose télé à Assivito à Lomé depuis l’année 2000. Il arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec le revenu qu’il tire de son commerce. Le crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA devait lui permettre acheter vingt cartons de chaussures et de refaire son stock pour pouvoir mieux vendre.

loans.use: Stock shoes for retail

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Christine G. was born July 24th, 1984 in Lomé. She is married and supports four people. Since the year 2000 she has been selling fabric in Lomé’s main market. The quality of fabric she sells attracts many buyers. Mrs. Christine G. uses her profits to help her husband pay school costs for the children he is responsible for. She is seeking a 500,000 franc CFA loan to buy new, high-quality fabrics in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Christine est le 24 juillet 1984 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a quatre (4) personnes à charge. Depuis l’année 2000, elle vend des tissus au grand marché de Lomé. La qualité des tissus qu’elle vend fait diriger beaucoup d’acheteurs vers elle. Madame G. Christine se sert de son revenu pour aider son mari à payer les frais de scolarité des enfants qu’ils ont à charge. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA pour acheter de nouveaux tissus pagnes de qualité supérieure afin de pouvoir mieux servir sa clientèle.

loans.use: Stock the latest lines of new fabrics

loans.name: Moradeké Fasilatou

texts.fr:
Born April 16th, 1977 in Lomé, Mrs. Madeké Fasilatou B. is married and the mother of four children. She is a retailer of plastic bags and table cloths in Lomé’s main market. She has been doing this work since 1998 and has now become a wholesaler. She currently receives merchandise from Accra in Ghana and Lagos in Nigeria, and resells it to sub-wholesalers and retail dealers in the main market. The 500,000 franc CFA loan she is seeking will allow her to increase her stock with the wholesale purchase of necessary bags. She can thus increase her sales and improve revenues.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 16 Avril 1977 à Lomé, Madame B. Moradeké Fasilatou est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de sachets et de nappes de tables au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1998 et est devenu aujourd’hui grossiste. Elle reçoit actuellement ses marchandises d’Accra au Ghana et de Lagos au Nigeria et les revend aux demi-grossistes et aux détaillants du grand marché. Le crédit de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat en quantité suffisante de sachets. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et donc améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: Stock plastic bags

loans.name: Akoko Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoko Abla A. was born October 23rd, 1972 in Tekponou village, in the Vo prefecture of Togo. She has three children and is married to Mr. Kpowenou ASSAGBA who is a taxi driver in Lomé. Mrs. Akoko Abla A. is a retailer of beauty and consumer goods in the Kodjoviakopé neighborhood of Lomé. She is seeking her first loan of 300,000 francs CFA to buy two dozen boxes of lotion to increase her stock and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akoko Abla est née le 23 octobre 1972 à TEKPONOU dans la préfecture de Vo au Togo. Elle a trois enfants et s’est mariée à Monsieur ASSAGBA Kpowenou qui est un chauffeur de taxis à Lomé. Madame A. Akoko Abla est revendeuse des produits de beauté et des produits de consommation courante dans le quartier de Kodjoviakopé à Lomé. Elle sollicite un premier crédit de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter deux (2) douzaines de cartons de crème pour pouvoir augmenter son stock et de mieux servir ses clients

loans.use: Increase her cosmetics stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia invirtió en compra de colas, bebidas, jugos y confites. Le dio mantenimiento a su congelador fuente de su trabajo.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Debido a que tiene mas variedad de artículos sus ventas aumentaron. Tiene buenos referidos dentro de su sector. Mantiene su horario de trabajo. Sus hijos le ayudan en la atención del negocio.

Información Personal :

Es casada. Tiene 4 hijos. Su esposo trabaja de pescador. Cuando se encuentra libre le ayuda a su esposa en el negocio. Su casita es de caña.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de una mercadería variada para su venta. Artículos como: sabanas, toldos, zapatos, pantalones. Además de incrementar su negocio de bebidas, colas, jugos.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=16602

Description of Business

Cecilia has 4 years experience at her business. She began, selling various things, as a street vendor, something that required that she spend a lot of time away from home. Her husband helped her start a business at home selling juices, soft drinks and other beverages. She works everyday from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.

Purpose of Loan

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her business. She hopes to stock it with other kinds of beverages. She also wants to buy confectionaries. She would like to help her husband, a fisherman, buy fishing gear that he needs.

Personal Information

Cecilia is married. She’s 38 years old and she has 3 children, only one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman. He comes home every 15 days to help with the household. Their house is made of cana (a reed-like wood) and has a dirt floor. Their goal is to have a small house made of cement which would improve the life of their family.

loans.use: Compra de una mercadería variada para su venta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase coffee pots, blenders, glasses, cups, clothing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase articles for their home, items of clothing to sell, and supplies for their food business.

loans.name: Gpf Pointe Sarrène Group

texts.fr:
As a business venture, our group has decided on locally processing seafoods and selling fresh fish. Since we live in a fishing port, we are of the opinion that we should be able to develop our village based on what our men produce. For this reason, we have joined SEM which has suggested a project corresponding to what we have available in our village.

Up to this point, outsiders have come here to buy up our catch for re-sale in the marketplaces of the big towns. But we would like to draw more profit from the our catch by processing it ourselves, then re-selling it to wholesalers who come to the villages along our bay to stock up on seafood. In this fashion, we will be better able to help support our families' daily needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Notre groupe a décidé de faire du commerce de produits halieutiques transformés et de la vente de poissons frais. Notre zone étant un port de pêche, nous avons donc estimé qu'il faut que nous puissions développer notre village à partir de ce que nos hommes produisent. Ainsi donc, nous nous sommes rapprochées de SEM qui nous a monté un projet qui correspond avec ce que nous avons dans notre village.

Jusque là, les gens venaient d'ailleurs pour acheter les produits de pêche et aller les vendre dans les marchés des grandes villes. Mais nous souhaitons donner une valeur ajoutée à ces produits en les transformant pour ensuite les revendre aux commerçants grossistes qui viennent s'approvisionner dans les villages de la petite côte. Ainsi, nous pourrons aider nos familles à subvenir à nos besoins de tous les jours.

loans.use:
Purchase of fresh, locally caught seafood for re-sale and for processing

Achat de produits Halieutiques et poissons frais pour transformation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw materials and an oxygen-acetylene welder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: With the new credit she could improve her business and expand its location

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs the loan to buy more goods (e.g. corn and rice) at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the merchandise he has for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs the loan to buy more merchandise at the wholesale price

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products for resale and home improvements for business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs a loan to purchase merchandise and other products that are on sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a new freezer for his ice cream business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Immediately after her divorce, Lucy K. had difficulty supporting her two children - a 9 year-old girl and a 6 year-old boy. Because they were very young, she did not want to leave them alone. 3 years ago she decided to work as a seamstress. Little by little, she has been able to earn enough to support her young children and has been able to work in a way where she doesn't have to leave them alone.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay back in three months. The money from the loan will be used to buy a portion of material at wholesale so she can continue to be able to support her children. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Lucy K. a raíz de su divorcio tuvo problemas económicos para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, una niña de 9 años y niño de 6 años, como no podía dejarlos solos puesto que eran muy chicos, hace 3 años decidió dedicarse a la costura negocio que poco a poco le ha traído beneficios económicos que le permiten mantener a sus pequeños y así no tiene que dejar a sus hijos solos.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir un lote de tela a precio de mayoreo y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aracely Elena

texts.es:
Aracely works selling name-brand shoes to the people of her town. She began selling shoes to supplement the income of the household to support her three children, as the earnings of her husband are not sufficient. Little by little she has been able to increase the number of her customers, and she wants to continue growing. But recently, her sales have decreased somewhat because she cannot fulfill the requests of her clients due to the lack of money necessary to acquire the merchandise.

She needs a loan of $250 which she will pay back in three months. She'll use this loan to buy merchandise so she can continue with her business. Let's contribute to the well-being of Aracely and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Aracely se dedica a la venta de zapatos de marca entre los conocidos de su pueblo actividad que empezó para solventar los gastos de sus 3 hijos ya que con ingresos de su marido no completaba, poco a poco logro incrementar su cartera de clientes, actualmente sus ventas han bajado un poco pero ella quiere seguir creciendo ya que tiene clientes a los que no puede surtirles por falta de capital para adquirir la mercancía.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que liquidara en 3 meses para comprara mercancía y continuar con su negocio. Contribuyamos al bienestar de Aracely y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Genny Gabriela

texts.es:
Genny wants to contribute to the income of her household and help her husband with the expenses of her young daughter. 3 years ago, she began selling clothes to friends and family members. During this time she has had good results, however, she is now going through a difficult stage in her business. She can no longer count on the money necessary to acquire seasonal clothing, and the inventory that she has isn't enough to generate good earnings.

She is requesting a loan of $250 that she will pay back in three months. She'll use this money to purchase merchandise. With your help, Genny will be able to continue on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Genny buscando contribuir con la economía familiar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su pequeña hija, hace 3 años inicio la venta de ropa entre conocidos y familiares, durante este tiempo ha tenido buenos resultados sin embargo ahora pasa por una etapa difícil en su negocio ya que no cuenta con el dinero para adquirir ropa de temporada y el inventario que tiene no es suficiente para generarle buenas ganancias.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Genny podrá continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mirian Cecilia

texts.es:
Mirian is an enterprising young women who 3 years ago, began selling shoes. Her dream is to have a shoe store in the town where she lives so she can help her mother and improve their economic situation. For this reason, she works hard to sell her shoes and collect her payments in a timely manner in the homes of her customers.

Now she needs help to continue with her business. She is asking for a loan of $250, which she will pay back in 3 months. She'll use this loan to purchase more merchandise so that little by little she can have a larger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Mirian es una joven emprendedora, desde hace 3 años combina su empleo con la venta de zapatos, su sueño es tener su zapatería en el pueblo donde habita para ayudar a su mama y mejorar la economía familiar, por ello se esfuerza en vender y cobrar puntualmente en los domicilios de sus clientes.

Ahora ella necesita apoyo económico para continuar con su negocio requiere US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y poco a poco tener un mayor inventario.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Soila

texts.es:
For 10 years, Soila has been able to find an effective way to contribute to paying for the household expenses - by selling food and bakery items out of her home. Together with her husband, she has been able to support their 5 children. They have two girls - 16 and 18 years-old and three boys - 12, 13 and 15 years-old.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will pay back in a few months, to buy merchandise for her business. With your help, Soila will have the opportunity to prosper in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Soila desde hace 10 años con su negocio ha logrado encontrar una eficaz manera de contribuir con los gastos familiares y junto a su esposo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos: 2 mujeres de 16 y 18 años, y 3 varones de 12,13, y 15 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas a domicilio y pan dulce.

Ahora necesita de US $250 que pagara en meses para comprar mercancía para su negocio. Con tu apoyo Soila tendrá la oportunidad de prosperar en su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is married with three children. Two girls, 18 and 11 years old and a boy who is 15. Thanks to her skills in sales, she has been successful in providing her children the ability to go to school. She knows that this is the way that they can get ahead in life. She sells plastic products for the home. She has the goal to buy a van so that she can get around to sell her products in different markets in the city.

She is asking for a loan of $250 which she will pay back in 3 months. She will use the loan to buy more products and continue selling. Let's help Juanita so she can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Juanita es una mujer casada con 3 hijos dos mujeres de 18 y 11 años y un varón de 15años gracias a su habilidad en las ventas ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos logrando que todos estudien, ya que sabe que esta es la manera en que se superen ella vende productos de plástico para el hogar y en un futuro tiene establecida como meta comprar una camioneta para poder vender en los diferentes tianguis de la ciudad.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprara mas artículos y continuar vendiendo. Apoyemos a Doña Juanita para que pueda alcanzar su meta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reyna Natali

texts.es:
Reyna A. started her business three years ago. She sells silver jewellery with her friends. Thanks to her insistence and her abilities, she now has a broad clientele since she sells to the entire town. As a short-term goal, she is looking to start a location in the market and to be able to dedicate herself only to that job since she presently combines her sales with a job in her mother's restaurant. She only works there in the mornings.

She needs $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and to reach her goal and start her location in the future. Let's support Reyna so she can accomplish her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Reyna A. empezó su negocio hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de joyería de plata junto con sus amigas, gracias a su empeño y habilidades ahora tiene una amplia clientela ya que vende en todo el pueblo, como una meta a corto plazo esta buscando consolidarse montando un local en el mercado y poder dedicarse solo a esta trabajo ya que actualmente combina las ventas con un empleo en un negocio de cocina económica propiedad de su madre actividad que desempeña solo por las mañanas.

Ella necesita US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y en un futuro alcanzar su meta y poner su local. Apoyemos a Reyna apara que pueda conseguir sus objetivos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olga Romelia

texts.es:
Olga O. is married and is the mother of a family with two teenagers, who are 15- and 13-years-old. Three years ago, she had some health problems, and this is when she began to use a line of natural products that helped her recover her health. This is what motivated her to sell these products. The income was also attractive. She started selling among friends, neighbors, and family members, using her experience with these products as an example. Today she sells significant quantities, and she moves the products in her car.

Now she needs a credt of $475, which she is willing to pay back in 6 months, to have maintenance done on her car, which is one of her work tools. She goes to nearby towns to sell her products. With your support, Olga will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Olga O. es casada y madre de familia de 2 adolescentes de 15 y 13 años, hace 3 años tuvo algunos problemas de salud, fue cuando empezó a consumir una línea de productos naturistas, que le ayudaron a recuperar la salud, lo que le la motivo a dedicarse a la venta de estos, además los ingresos eran atractivos, inicio vendiendo entre amigos, vecinos y familiares utilizando como ejemplo su experiencia con estos productos, hoy en día vende en cantidades importantes, y moviliza los productos en su automóvil.

Ahora necesita un crédito de US $475 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para darle mantenimiento mayor a su auto, que es una de sus herramientas de trabajo, ya que pretende salir a vender a los pueblos cercanos a su comunidad. Con tu apoyo Olga podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To invest in her tool for work

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is an entreprising micro-entrepreneur. She is married and is the mother of 5 children: 3 males who are 21, 19, and 12; and 2 girls who are 17 and 9. She has promoted her business of selling bread for 6 years, with the goal of being able to pay for the education of her children. Her husband is a baker, and she learned this trade from him. Now they make and sell bread. She has the opportunity to open a branch in another colony, which would give her a large point of sale and the opportunity to have sellers.

Currently she requires a credit of $675, which she will pay back in 6 months. She will use the money to fix up her new location. Let's support Elena and her family so they can keep prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria Elena es una emprendedora microempresaria casada y madre de cinco hijos, tres varones de 21,19 y 12, dos niñas una de 17 y otra de 9. Durante 6 años ha ido fomentando su negocio de venta de pan, esto con la finalidad de poder pagar la educación de sus hijos; su esposo es panadero y ella aprendió el oficio a través de el actualmente ellos lo elaboran y venden, ahora tiene la oportunidad de abrir una sucursal en otra colonia lo que le daría un punto de venta masivo y la oportunidad de tener sus vendedores.

Actualmente ella requiere un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses, para realizar las adecuaciones al local nuevo. Apoyemos a Elena y su familia para que sigan prosperando.

loans.use: Remodeling her location

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina N. is a 51-year-old woman who considers herself a very laid-back, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. She is married and has 2 children: Daniela, who is 25, single, and studying to be an elementary school teacher; and Rogelio, who is 21, single, and studying geosciences. Both still live at home.

Agustina started her business because of the need to have extra income that was sufficient to help her husband with their home's expenses and to pay for her children's education. She was an employee in a pharmacy, but her salary along with her husbands wasn't enough, since her children were growing and wanted to keep studying. She started in February of 1997 due to the invitation from a co-worker, who suggested that she attend a sales demonstration of a recognized cosmetics brand that is sold by catalog. Once she was there, she liked the line a lot, and started to sell among her neighbors, friends, and co-workers. Since then, it has gone very well for her, and now she organizes bingo games with the same products.

Agustina needs a credit of $375, which she is wiling to repay in 4 months, to acquire more merchandise that will let her have a better assortment to cover her clients' orders and increase her sales. Let's support her enterprising spirit and contribute to her credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Agustina N. es una mujer de 51 años que se considera una persona muy tranquila, trabajadora y entusiasta. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos Daniela de 25 años, quien es soltera y estudia para maestra de educación primaria y Rogelio de 21 años, soltero también, estudiante de la carrera de Geociencias; ambos viven en casa todavía.

Ella inicia su negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso extra que fuera suficiente para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos. Ella era empleada de una farmacia pero su sueldo junto con el de su esposo no era suficiente ya que sus hijos estaban creciendo y querían seguir estudiando. Inicio en Febrero de 1997, por invitación de una compañera de trabajo que le sugirió ir a una demostración de venta de cosméticos por catalogo de una reconocida marca, una vez que estuvo ahí la línea le gustó mucho y comenzó a vender entre sus vecinas, amistades y compañeras de trabajo. Desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad organiza bingos con los mismos productos

Agustina requiere un crédito por US $375 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 4 meses para adquirir mas mercancía que le permita tener un mejor surtido para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ventas. Alentemos el espíritu emprendedor de Agustina contribuyendo a su crédito.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
Laura A. is an enterprising 45 year old woman who describes herself as happy, optimistic and very responsible. She is married to Pedro Joaquín Lira Aguilar, who works on an oil platform. They are the parents of one son, Pedro Emmanuel, who is 17 and is in high school.

She started her business in May 1997 because she felt she needed to be busy, since she had stopped working when she got married and had a lot of free time on her hands. She also wanted to be fulfilled as a person, to feel useful and at the same time, have her own income so she would not have to depend entirely on her husband. At first she made cakes for her friends in exchange for them giving her the ingredients. One day - close to Mother´s Day - a friend recommended that she make cakes to sell. It seemed like a good idea to her and she had a lot of requests for that date. Now she makes cakes for weddings and Quinceañera celebrations (a girl´s 15th birthday, a type of "coming-out" party) and has many clients. Her wish is to organize her bakery.

She now needs a loan of US $375, which she is willing to repay within 4 months, to acquire the ingredients and baking molds she needs to fill her clients orders and also to make a greater variety of cakes and pastries. With your help, Laura will see her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Laura A. una mujer emprendedora de 45 años que se define a si misma como una persona alegre, optimista y muy responsable.
