She has always made flour tortillas and gorditas for her family. Because of how good they taste, her neighbors began to ask for them. This is why she decided to to make them for sale.

Now Angélica needs a loan of $350 that she will repay in 5 months. This loan will go to help supply the raw ingredients she needs, and to buy a machine to make flour tortillas. This will allow her to take orders from small stores to sell her food. With your help, Angélica will be able to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica R. es casada, su esposo se desempeña como albañil tienen 3 hijos de 11,19 y 24 años. Su negocio lo inicio hace 5 años aproximadamente para ayudar con los gastos de la casa a su esposo y sin descuidar a su familia. Ella realizaba tortillas y gorditas de harina para su familia pero debido a su buen sazón los vecinos le empezaron a hacer pedidos de estas por lo que decidió hacer para vender.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 5 meses. El crédito le va a ayudar a surtir de materia prima y comprar una maquina para realizar tortillas de harina y así poder dejar pedidos en las tienditas para su venta. Con tu ayuda Angelica podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and a tortilla press

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro Sánchez is married with 4 children. His wife is a housewife, and in the past his income didn't reach far enough to sustain his family. Because of this, he decided to take on his father's business. He was already certain that with strength he would be able to produce more earnings. It has been 17 years since he started working with his father. Now he works independently and has another restaurant en La Fe.

Pedro needs a loan of $575 that he will repay in 6 months in order to buy a new grill for the business and a pair of tables for his clients' convenience. Let's all support Pedro so he may be able to continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro Sánchez es casado y tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al ser el sostén de mi familia no le alcanzaba con su sueldo por lo que decidió encargarse del puesto de su padre ya que tenia la certeza que con esfuerzo podría producir mejores ganancias. Fue así como hace 17 años inicio trabajando junto a su padre ahora lo trabaja independientemente además de tener otro puesto de comida en La Fe.

El necesita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una parrilla nueva para el negocio y un par de mesas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Apoyemos a pedro para que pueda continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a grill and tables

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz is an exemplary woman with a fighting spirit. Motivated by the necessity of helping her husband with the household expenses, she saw that she needed to find work herself. 6 years ago she began selling catalog lingerie to her neighbors. Now she holds events inside her house in order to generate bigger sales, inviting people from all over.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will repay in 3 months. This loan will go to improve the manner in which she will be able to take orders that her clients pay for when the items arrive, and also to organize more sales events for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Ma. de la Luz, un mujer luchadora y ejemplar, movida por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa se vio obligada a trabajar por su cuenta para apoyarlo hace 6 años empezó vendiendo lencería por catalogo solo con sus vecinos ahora realiza demostraciones dentro de su casa para generar ventas mayores invitando a gente de diversos sectores.

Ella necesita de US $250 que pagara en 3 meses. Este crédito la va apoyar de tal manera que podrá surtir los pedidos que tiene pendientes además de ir organizando más demostraciones para el negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Ángeles is married with three children. 6 years ago she began a business in her house. Initially it was a little stall, but now she has a well established sweets shop. She started her business due to not having sufficient resources to support her children's expenses, as even the joint income she and her husband made was insufficient. Because of this she decided to begin to look for additional income to help her spouse with the expenses.

Now she needs a loan of $950 that she will repay in 6 months in order to remodel her business. With your help, Maria will be able to continue helping her husband and family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de los Ángeles tiene 3 hijos y es casada, hace 6 años inicio un negocio en su casa primero fue un estanquillo ahora ya tiene una dulcería bien establecida, esto lo hizo dada la insuficiencia de recursos para salir adelante con los gastos de sus hijos debido a que su sueldo y el de su marido eran insuficiente por eso decidido empezar a buscar ingresos extras para apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $ 950 que pagara en 6 meses, para o remodelar el negocio. Con tu ayuda Maria seguirá apoyando a su esposo y su familia.

loans.use: To remodel Maria's Store

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina M. A. is a widowed mother of three children. To care for her husband when he was still alive, she began working for herself because she couldn’t meet the household expenses. 6 years ago she began to sell fried snacks outside of a school. Eventually she created a school cooperative, and now she is solely responsible for snacks at the school. After the death of her husband she remained single, with the responsibility of paying the expenses of her little children that are now her principal motivation for making her business prosper.

She needs a loan of $375 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise and improve the variety of the products that she sells, as well as buy a larger refrigerator. With your help, Bernardina will improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardina M. es viuda y madre de 3 hijos, cunado su esposo aun vivía empezó a trabajar por su cuenta al no poder solventar los gastos de la casa, hace 6 años inicio vendiendo frituras afuera de una escuela hasta que se integro la cooperativa de la misma, y actualmente atiende por completo el snack, tras la muerte de su marido quedo sola con la responsabilidad de solventar los gastos de sus pequeños que son ahora su principal motor para hacer prosperar su negocio.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía e incrementar la variedad de los productos que vende así como comprar un refrigerador más amplio. Con tus contribuciones Bernardina saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a larger refrigerator

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
While Dulia recovers from her recent gallbladder operation she plans how she will continue working without moving around too far from her home. She currently works as a conductor for a public transportation company and at the same time has been renting a small public transport omnibus (Couster) for seven years. Her dream and long term goal is to have a restaurant in her home but for now she works to help her husband who is a mechanical engineer to provide for the education of their children who are twenty and thirteen years old.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Mientras Dulia se recupera de su operación a la vesícula a la que fue sometida hace una semana planea el modo de cómo seguir trabajando sin movilizarse tanto fuera de su casa. Actualmente ella trabaja como cobradora de una línea de transporte y a la vez alquila desde hace siete años un ómnibus pequeño (Couster) para que sea trabajado como transporte público. Más adelante le gustaría tener un restaurante en su casa, ese es su sueño y objetivo a largo plazo. Por ahora trabaja para ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como técnico mecánico, con la educación de sus hijos de veinte y trece años.

loans.use: Pay the first payment for the purchase of a Couster (omnibus)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula Ríos is a very hardworking, entrepenuerial woman. She began her business when she had to become her mother’s sole supporter. Since she didn’t have a steady job, she wouldn’t have been able to support her mother and also pay the household expenses. Because of this, three years ago she began selling clothes and plastic containers outside of her home. Now she sells directly in the open air markets.

Paula is asking for a $250 loan that she will repay in three months. The loan will go to help her buy a table and a market stall in order to better establish herself and to improve her sales. With your contributions, Paula will continue heping her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Paula Ríos es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, inicio su negocio ante la necesidad de sacar a su madre adelante ya que ella es el único sostén con que cuenta, y al no tener un trabajo fijo no podía sacar adelante a su madre y además solventar los gastos de la casa, por lo que hace 3 años empezó vendiendo ropa y vasijas de plástico afuera de su casa, ahora vende directamente en los mercados rodantes.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses, este la va a ayudar de manera que podrá comprar una mesa y una estructura para establecerse mejor y ampliar sus ventas. Con tus contribuciones Paula continuara ayudando a su madre.

loans.use: To buy a market stall

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Rodríguez started selling clothes three years ago. Initially she sold only slightly worn baby clothes, until she established herself in nearby markets. The business allows Josefina to help her husband cover the family’s expenses, as his salary alone is not enough to support their three children.

Josefina needs a loan of $475 to buy a stand for her merchandise so that she’ll be able to move to different markets nearby. She can repay the loan in six months. We need to contribute to Josefina so that she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Josefina Rodríguez se dedica a vender ropa, actividad que inicio hace 3 años vendiendo inicialmente solo ropa seminueva para bebe, hasta que logro establecerse en los mercados rodantes. Esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares ya que con el sueldo de su marido no podían solventar los gastos de sus 3 hijos.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $475 que esta dispuesta pagar en 6 meses para comprar una estructura para su negocio y así poder trasladarse en los diferentes mercados rodantes. Contribuyamos con Josefina para que pueda seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Purchase a stand for the business

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles sells food for a living. Her business started 3 years ago by selling outside of her house, given that her husband's salary wasn't enough. Additionally, the need in that moment was too large. Due to her dedication and effort, she has progressed considerably. She now supplies orders for school banquets and special events and has a location for her business.

She needs a credit of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase a table and to expand part of her business so it will be more optimal for her clients. With your help, Angeles will continue with the success of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria de los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comidas, su negocio empezó hace 3 años vendiendo afuera de su casa, dado que con el sueldo de su marido no era suficiente, además la necesidad en ese momento era demasiado grande, debido a su dedicación y esfuerzo ha progresado considerablemente, ahora surte pedidos de banquetes para escuelas y eventos especiales y cuenta con un local para su negocio.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una mesa y ampliar parte del negocio para que sea mas optimo para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ángeles continuara con el éxito de su negocio.

loans.use: To remodel her business

loans.name: Monica Lizeth

texts.es:
Mónica T. has been selling shoes from catalogs for 6 years, when she realized that her husband’s low income was not enough to support them. Because of this, their financial situation was not good and Mónica decided to work in order to help him. Mónica began selling shoes at first only to her neighbors, but now she presents to groups of friends, increasing her sales.

Now Mónica needs $250 to supply pending orders and to purchase a shelf for displaying merchandise. She will repay the loan in three months. We need to help so that Mónica can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica T. se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo actividad que desarrolla desde hace 6 años, inicio debido a el poco ingreso con que contaba, el sueldo de su marido no era suficiente por lo cual su situación económica no era buena y decidió trabajar por su cuenta para apoyar a su esposo. Inicio vendiendo solamente a sus vecinos pero ahora realiza demostraciones entre sus amistades incrementando sus ventas.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes además de comprar un estante para exhibir la mercancía. Ayudemos a que Mónica pueda salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria del Rosario started her office supplies store three years ago, when her husband was unemployed. During this time she had to cover the costs of providing a home and food for their three children, as well as pay school fees. Now Maria’s husband works as a chauffer, but she has grown her business and continues to work there.

Maria would like $250 to purchase general supplies, in order to provide a better variety of products for her clients. She will pay back the loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Rosario inicio su negocio una papeleria hace tres años cuando su esposo se quedo desempleado y ella tuvo que hacerle frente a los gastos de su casa y la manutención de sus tres hijos, ya que había que pagar las colegiaturas de la escuela. Actualmente el trabaja como chofer pero ella logro hacer crecer su negocio por lo que se dedica a esto.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía en general y contar con mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
For 10 years, Carmen has sold various brands of cosmetics. Up until 5 years ago, she worked attending a bookstore in a central location. Nevertheless, at that time, she felt that she should dedicate more time to her adolescent daughter, who at that time was only 12-years-old. This is how she left that job and started to sell out of her house.

For now, her profits go towards reinvesting and obtaining more merchandise for its sale. She has the support of her husband, who works as an administrator at a tailoring shop, to maintain their home. In the future, she would like to build a small location outside of her house and convert it into a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace diez años Carmen se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de diversas marcas. Antes, hasta hace cinco años, ella trabajaba atendiendo en una librería bazar ubicado en un lugar céntrico; sin embargo, en ese tiempo sintió que debía dedicarle más tiempo a su hija adolescente, en aquel entonces con solo doce años. Fue así que dejo aquel trabajo y empezó a vender en su casa.

Por ahora sus ganancias las destina básicamente a reinvertir y conseguir más mercadería para su venta. Ella cue4nta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como administrador de un taller de confección, para la manutención del hogar. Mas adelante a ella le gustaría construir un pequeño local fuera de su casa y convertirlo en una tienda bazar.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe sells clothing. When she started this activity, her husband was unemployed, and she had to pay for the tuition of her three children, who were in high school. She needed more income since their home's expenses were high. The situation hasn't changed much since her whole family still lives in her home, and her children are still in school. Currently, they are 21-, 20-, and 19-years-old. Her 21-year-old daughter helps her buy and sell merchandise, and her husband also joined the business.

Now she needs a credit of $675, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and to continue doing this work. With your support, she will be able to make her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de ropa cuando inicio con esta actividad su esposo estaba desempleado y tenia que pagar la cuotas de las escuelas de sus tres hijos quienes cursaban la preparatoria. Ella ocupaba más ingresos ya que los gastos de la casa eran altos y la situación no ha cambiado mucho ya que aun vive toda la familia en su casa y ellos continúan estudiando. Actualmente ellos tienen 21, 20 y 19 años. Su hija de 21 años le ayuda con la compra y venta de mercancía, y también su marido se incorporó al negocio.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar dedicándose a esto. Con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer prosperar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Every day for fifteen years, Carmen has entirely devoted herself to working at her soda fountain. She starts early to prepare everything for sale in the evening. It all started because she was unable to find work. She is trained as a social worker assistant and worked as such for fifteen years until the company she worked for went bankrupt. She tells us that before opening the soda fountain she spent some time looking for a job as a social worker’s assistant but since she did not find anything decided to work doing what she knows best, cooking. She now serves french fries and hot dogs, desserts, beverages, etc. What she most wants is to see her children grow up with a good education; thus together with her husband’s income as an electric technician almost all of their income is spent on their children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los días, desde hace quince años, Carmen se dedica íntegramente a su fuente de soda. Desde temprano ella prepara todo lo necesario para sus ventas en la noche. Todo empezó para ella a raíz de que no encontraba trabajo. Ella es de profesión asistenta social y como tal, estuvo trabajando durante quince años hasta que la empresa que la empleaba quebró. Ella nos cuenta que antes de abrir su fuente de soda estuvo buscando trabajo como asistenta social por una temporada, pero como no la contrataban decidió trabajar haciendo lo que ella sabia, cocinar. Ahora atiende en su negocio vendiendo salchipapas, postres, bebidas etc. Lo que ella más desea es ver a sus hijos crecer con buena educación, es así que casi todos sus ingresos los invierte en ellos junto con su esposo quien trabaja como técnico electricista.

loans.use: Implement her soda fountain

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
When her husband lost his job, Alicia Chávez began to sell beauty products to pay the school fees for their five children. Alicia worked hard to earn enough money to cover the high costs of keeping a home. Some time later Alicia’s daughter began beauty school, and they worked together to create a salon in their home.

Alicia needs $475 to purchase merchandise and to continue working at the salon. She will pay back the loan in six months. Alicia’s business can prosper, with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia Chávez se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza cuando inicio con esta actividad su esposo estaba desempleado y tenia que pagar la cuotas de las escuelas de sus cinco hijos. Ella ocupaba más ingresos ya que los gastos de la casa eran muchos. Tiempo después su hija empezó a estudiar belleza lo que la motivo a juntarse y poner una estética en su casa.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar dedicándose con la estética. Con tu apoyo ella podrá hacer prosperar su negocio

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amanda Yadira

texts.es:
Amanda has a business where she sells sewing supplies and gifts. She started it because her husband's income wasn't enough to cover their home's expenses, and she saw the need to support him with extra income. She started her business more than a year and a half ago, when they needed to pay for their bills, their personal expenses, and taking care of their two children.

Now she is requesting a loan of $950, which she will repay in 6 months, to supply merchandise in general as well as thread and yarn, products that her clients have requested. Let's contribute to Amanda's achievement.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Amanda tiene un negocio de venta de mercería y regalos, el cual inicio porque el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para los gastos de la casa y ella se vio en la necesidad de apoyarlo con un ingreso extra esto hace mas de año y medio cuando requerían pagar, recibos de servicios, gastos personales además de la manutención de sus dos hijos

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercancía en general además de hilos, estambres, productos que sus clientes le han solicitado. Contribuyamos a la realización de Amanda

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and shelves

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia M. sells clothing and shoes, an activity that she started more than 10 years ago when a friend invited her to help her sell. Later, she started to sell alone at a time when her husband was unemployed. She had to move ahead with paying to support their children, such as paying for bills and their education.

Currently, she needs a credit of $475, which she will repay in 6 months, to supply seasonal footwear and have a better sales opportunity. With your support, Hortencia will continue contributing to the well-being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hortencia M. se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos actividad que inicio hace mas de 10 años cuando una amiga la invito a ayudarla a vender y después ella empezó sola en ese tiempo su esposo se quedo sin empleo y tenia que sacar adelante los pagos de la manutención de sus dos hijos, así como recibos de servicios y escuela.

Actualmente ella requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir calzado de temporada y tener una mayor oportunidad de venta. Con tu apoyo Hortencia seguirá contribuyendo la bienestar de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José M. is a single, very hard-working man. Six years ago, he was left without a job, and due to the recommendation of her mother, he started to sell food in his house. He would offer it to neighbors and people who passed by, until he gained a clientele who requests his food daily. He also fills orders for office workers.

Currently, he needs a credit of $750, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase supplies for his business. With your help, José will make his business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

José M. es un hombre soltero y muy trabajador, hace unos años se quedo sin empleo y por recomendación de su mama inicio con la venta de comida esto en su casa empezó ofreciéndola a sus vecinos y gente que pasaba por ahí, hasta que se hizo de clientela que diario solicita comida y así como realizar pedidos para oficinistas.

Actualmente necesita un crédito por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para su negocio. Con tu ayuda José hará prosperar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Martínez is married and has two children. Her husband works in construction, so he is not salaried and sometimes doesn’t have work. Isabel decided to help her husband with the costs of feeding their children, paying bills and school fees. More than seven years ago a friend invited Isabel to help arrange flowers, and paid a bonus for the work. Afterward, Isabel learned the trade and started her own business.

Now Isabel needs $250 to purchase raw materials for her arrangements, which she will pay back in three months. Please contribute to the wellbeing of Isabel’s family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel Martínez es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, el trabajo de su esposo no es de nomina así que hay veces que no tiene trabajos, por lo que decidió apoyar a su esposo pago de la manutención de sus hijos, recibos de servicios y escuela. Hace mas de 7 años una amiga la invito a ayudarla a realizar arreglos de flores y pagarle una gratificación, después ella aprendió el oficio e inicio un negocio por su cuenta.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima para la realización de sus arreglos. Contribuyamos al bienestar de la familia de Isabel.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Materials

loans.name: Rodolfo Alejandro

texts.es:
Rodolfo Q. is a bachelor who has sold clothing for more than a year. He started this business because he was left without a job, and he needed to cover personal expenses and contribute to those of his house, since at that moment it was necessary to pay various bills. Due to his effort and dedication, he has increased his sales.

Currently, he needs a credit of $950, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase seasonal clothing. With your support, Rodolfo will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rodolfo Q. es soltero hace mas de un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, inicio este negocio por que se quedo sin empleo y tenia la necesidad de cubrir gastos personales y contribuir a los de su casa, ya que en ese momento había que pagar varios recibos de servicios. En base a su esfuerzo y dedicación a incrementado sus ventas.

Actualmente el necesita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada. Con tu apoyo Rodolfo podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Silvia Pérez is married and has five children. More than three years ago she realized that her husband’s salary was insufficient, and the family was always lacking money. When her husband lost his job Silvia decided to start her own business, one that would not cause her to neglect her duties at home. Her family helped her buy supplies and she converted part of her home into a store, selling school and office supplies. Her husband is now working, but Silvia continues to run her business.

Silvia is asking for $250 to for merchandise, which she will pay back in three months. With your contribution, Silvia will prosper and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia Pérez es casada y madre de cinco hijos, hace mas de 3 años con apoyo de su familia quienes le ayudaron a comprar algo de material puso una papelería en su casa, esto cuando se dio cuenta de que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente y siempre tenían carencia y falta de de dinero, ya que no completaba, después su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, y ella decidió empelarse por su cuenta, en algo que no descuidara su casa. Actualmente su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero ella continua con el negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía para su negocio. Con tus contribuciones Silvia prosperara y dará mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cristina Del Pilar

texts.es:
Cristina is a young, 29-year-old woman who has worked managing her mini-bazaar for two years. Previously, she worked selling electronic devices in a store until it went bankrupt. Upon finding herself without a job, she decided to open a store. She started with little, selling only some groceries, until she was able to obtain what she has today with much effort.

She has studied computer applications and English. Besides attending to her business, she also works as a cosmetics consultant. She invests the income from her two jobs back into her business, since she is still single and doesn't have a lot of expenses. She hopes to be able to have enough money to have a mini-market in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cristina es una joven de veintinueve años que desde hace dos años trabaja en el manejo de su mini bazar. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como vendedora de artefactos eléctricos en una tienda hasta que ésta quebró. Al verse sin trabajo decidió abrir una tienda. Empezó de a pocos vendiendo solamente algunos abarrotes hasta obtener con mucho esfuerzo lo que hoy tiene.

Ella ha estudiado computación e inglés. Aparte de atender en su negocio también trabaja como consultora de cosméticos. Los ingresos de sus dos trabajos los vuelve a invertir, pues aun ella es soltera y no tiene muchos gastos dentro de su hogar. Ella espera en un futuro poder tener el dinero suficiente para tener un minimarket.

loans.use: To expand the location of her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kos Prak Ii Group

texts.en: Mr. Nimul C. is the President of the Kos Prak II Village Bank, which consists of 13 people, most of whom are farmers. Mr. C. is 30 years old and a subsistence farmer in the village, generating A. income of about $4.50 per day. Additionally, he is the father of four children, two of whom attend school and two who are of preschool age. His wife, Mrs. Vet Ern, is also a farmer, and she usually works with her husband on the field next to the village. Typically, she cA. earn around $1.50 a day from selling vegetables. Mr. Nimul C. and his group now want to access a loA. to purchase different kinds of crop seeds to diversify their field.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of crop seeds to diversify the field.

loans.name: Kos Prak I Group

texts.en: Most of Kandal Province consists of large swaths of farmland, and most of the people are subsistence farmers. Twenty-one people make up the Kos Prak I Village Bank. Mrs. Chantho A., Village Bank President, is a farmer who cultivates many different kinds of vegetables such as maize, cabbage, etc. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in school, while the others  work. She cA. earn about $2.50 per day, and Mr. Samon ChA., her husband, a hard-working farmer, usually works on the field with his wife. Due to A. insufficient amount of vegetable seeds, Mrs. Chantho and her group have decided to request a loA. to buy more.  They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim S., age 55, has four children and sells groceries at her house. She earns about $20 per day. Her husband raises goats and sells them to the restaurants when they grow up, and earns about $33 a day. Three of the children are married and live separately and the other one helps her selling groceries.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries in bulk to save money.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to save money

loans.name: Senida

texts.en: Senida is 22 years old and lives with her grandparents in a small village known as Vukovije. She is not  married and she operates a small shop that sells mixed goods. Senida receives approximately 430 BAM for her grandparents' home-care needs. At her shop, she generates approximately 500 BAM of income per month. She is seeking this loan in the amount of 1,500 BAM to purchase additional goods for her shop, which she hopes will generate additional monthly income so that she can better support her household's needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her store.

loans.name: Senija

texts.en: Senija was born in 1962 and she lives with her husband in Vukovije, a small village near the town of Živinice. Her husband is a professional waiter at a restaurant and he earns approximately 600 BAM per month. They generate additional income through cattle breeding and their poultry business. Senija is seeking this loan in the amount of 1,500 BAM in order to buy sheep to expand their business operations. With the loan proceeds, she hopes that they will be able to earn more money and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional sheep to expand the business

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen S., age 52, lives with her husband and seven children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of farmland and grows a variety of vegetables. Usually, she earns a profit of about $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Man Samon, 54, is a teacher in the village and earns $30 a month. One child is married and lives away from home. Three children are employed as garment workers, and each earns $50 a month. The other son is a construction worker, who is building a house, and earns about $70 a month. The rest of the children are students.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a plot of land on which to build a house for their children.

loans.use: To purchase land to build a house

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en: Elvisa is a 25-year-old, married woman from the village of Bašigovci. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns 600 BAM per month on average. They generate additional income by working in the agriculture industry. In fact, her husband works the fields with his own tractor and is able to earn approximately 350 BAM per month via this activity. Elvisa is seeking this loan in the amount of 1,500 BAM to purchase a new rotary cultivator. In general, Elvisa and her husband believe that this rotary cultivator will help them perform agricultural tasks in a better and more efficient manner, which will allow them to earn more money and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new rotary cultivator.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman. Her husband works in construction in Sarajevo and his monthly salary is 500 BAM. In addition, Fatima has two children, who live with her and her mother. This would be Fatima's second loan from MCO WWI and she would like to use this 1,500 BAM loan to buy chickens for fattening purposes and to generate additional monthly household income.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens

loans.name: Paša

texts.en: Paša was born  in 1952  and she is married. Her husband receives a monthly pension in the amount of 270 BAM. Paša has two sons who work and they all (i.e., Paša, her husband, and her sons) live together. The loan she is currently seeking would be the second 1,500 BAM loan she would have received. With the loan proceeds, Paša intends to buy chickens for fattening purposes in order to generate additional monthly income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens

loans.name: Toun

texts.en:
Mrs. Toun H., age 52, has six children, and she and her husband (pictured here) work as farmers. They earn about $1 a day. Two children are married and live away from home. Three sons are construction workers who are building a house. They each earn $80 a month. One son helps on the farm growing rice.

Mrs. H. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase another plot of farmland to grow more rice to sustain the family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Sdao Kanleng Iii Group

texts.en: Sdao Kanleng III Village Bank consists of 30 members. The Village Bank President, Mrs. Chim L., born around 1964, is a housewife with no children. Mr. Rotha Chem,  Chim's husband, is a house constructor who can generate an income of about $3 a day. As prices have increased in Cambodia, due largely to increasing fuel costs, their living conditions have deteriorated, and Mrs. Chim is finding it more difficult to support her family. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy more food to improve their standard of living. This loan will be shared amongst the other group members.

loans.use: To buy more food.

loans.name: Abdul Rashid

texts.en:
Abdul Rashid lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children.

He has a catering shop, a business he started a few months ago. It is going well and he wants to maintain it, so he has requested an individual loan to complete purchasing necessary materials to attract more clients. He hopes to make a good income to support his family.

loans.use: To complete purchases of necessary materials.

loans.name: Ei

texts.en:
Mrs. Ei C., age 37, lives with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. To contribute to the family's income, she works as a construction worker and earns about $3 a day. Her husband Mr. Ngoun Tong Heng, age 38, is a construction manager, and earns about $5 a day. One son is a construction worker who earns $90 a month. One daughter is also a construction worker and earns $60 a month. The other two children are students.

Mrs. C. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair their house

loans.name: Sdao Kanleng V Group

texts.en: The Sdao Kanleng V is a 16-member Village Bank, most of whom are farmers. Mrs. Saval O., one such subsistence farmer, is also the Village Bank President. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are working while the other is studying at school. Her husband, Phaly Rom, is a laborer who is looking for wO. next to the village. Saval O. is highly motivated by her family, especially her husband, and she now wants to open a small business, a rice soup store located in the village. In order to start this business, she is requesting a loan of $2475.

loans.use: To start a new business.

loans.name: Lea Teresa's Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed in July of 2006. The contact with this group was carried out by Señora Lea Teresa R., who was informed about the foundation and of the enterprising womens committee program thanks to some friends that formed part of another committee.

The Committee is comprised of 17 enterprising women of the Neighborhood Mbachio of Lambaré. This system of credit helps them to work better with their capital, to save, to be supportive and, of course, to promote responsibility.

These women work in different types of activities to improve their financial incomes. Among these activities we can cite: sale of clothes, edibles, pastries, cosmetics, fruits and vegetables, natural products, beverages and ice creams, hamburgers and recycling. They also work to improve their families and to serve their roles of mother and housewife. In addition they carry out these activities, since the cost of living is very high and they come from very humble families. Their greatest desire is to give a better future to their children.

As a group they also carry out activities with the purpose of collecting funds for their savings. They request today a loan with the purpose of investing in the purchase of merchandise, supplies and necessary ingredients for their different activities.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo en julio del 2006. El contacto con este grupo se realizo a través de la señora. Lea Teresa R., quien se enteró acerca de la fundación y del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras gracias a unas amigas que formaban parte de otro comité.

El Comité esta integrado por 17 mujeres emprendedoras del Barrio Mbachio de Lambaré. Este sistema de crédito les ayuda a ellas a trabajar mejor su capital, a ahorrar, a ser solidarias y por supuesto, a fomentar la responsabilidad.

Estas mujeres trabajan en distintos tipos de actividades para aumentar sus ingresos financieros, entre estas actividades podemos citar: venta de ropas, comestibles, repostería, cosméticos, frutas y verduras, productos naturales, bebidas y helados, venta de hamburguesas y reciclaje. Ellas además de llevar adelante a sus familias y cumplir sus roles de madre y ama de casa, también realizan estas actividades, ya que el costo de vida es muy alto y ellas provienen de familias muy humildes; sus mayores deseos son el de dar un mejor porvenir a sus hijos. Como grupo también realizan actividades con la finalidad de recaudar fondos para sus ahorros. Ellas solicitan hoy el crédito con la finalidad de invertirlos en la compra de mercaderías, insumos e ingredientes necesarios para sus distintas actividades.

loans.use: To buy underwear (for women, men and children), ingredients for cakes and sweets such as flour, eggs, fat, yeast, sugar, gas, dulce de leche ( a carmelized milk), dulce de guayaba (a sweet made from guava), several shop supplies like hangers, spoons and knives, jugs, strainers, glasses, cups for coffee or tea, office supplies such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, colored pencils, etc. for resale

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.es:
This is a new committee full of expectations, with a desire to grow. The group arose after one of the members of the group, Paola C., had knowledge of the "committee of enterprising women" program that the Paraguayan Foundation is developing.

She was part of another group for a time, but, upon that group being dissolved, she sought to form a new group. So she contacted neighbors and friends to hold a meeting where one of the credit officers of the Foundation could explain to them better the purpose of the program.

Thus the new committee arose that now requests a loan to invest in their different activities. These enterprising and dynamic women carry out different types of activities that help to generate income for their families. Among these diverse activities we can cite: recycling, sale of clothes, lingerie, fast food, products for the home, etc.

Each one will receive a part of the loan and will work together to make their payments in a punctual manner. In this way when they pay off their first loan, the foundation will be able to agree to a larger loan.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este es un comité nuevo, lleno de expectativas, con ganas de crecer. El grupo surgió luego de que una de las integrantes del grupo, Paola C., tuvo conocimiento del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya.

Ella formo parte de otro grupo durante un tiempo, pero al disolverse este, ella busco formar un nuevo grupo, fue así que contacto a vecinas y amigas para realizar una reunión donde uno de los oficiales de créditos de la Fundación pudo explicarles mejor la finalidad del programa.

Así surge el nuevo comité que hoy día solicita el crédito para invertirlos en sus diferentes actividades. Estas mujeres emprendedoras y dinámicas realizan distintos tipos de actividades que les ayuda a generar ingresos para sus familias; entre estas diversas actividades podemos citar: reciclaje, ventas de ropas, lencerías, comidas rápidas, productos para el hogar, etc.

Cada una recibirá una parte del crédito y se comprometerá a pagar de forma puntual sus cuotas, así de este modo cuando concluyan su primer ciclo podrán acceder a un crédito superior.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as T-shirts, pants, shirts, and footwear; ingredients for foods like: vegetables, meat, sugar, fruits; and to purchase supplies for recycling.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith E. is 39 years old, is married with five children, and she lives in Benin city. She sells cooking pots and plastics. She needs a loan in the amount of $875 to buy more cooking pots and plastics for sale. She has been in business for the past ten (10) years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy coolers, pots and plastics for sale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is 54 years old. She lives in Benin City, and is married with 7 children. She sells yams and plantains. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more yams, plantains, and maize to then sell. She has been in business since 1987, and she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more yams and plantains for sale

loans.name: Dajana

texts.en: Dajana is a 21-year-old woman from Laktaši. She is not married, has no children, and lives with her parents. This is the first loan she has sought through Kiva and she is seeking this 1,200 BAM loan to buy automotive parts for her auto-mechanic shop. With the loan proceeds, she is confident that she will be able to help her family's business grow and to generate additional monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase automobile parts for an auto-repair shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi C. is 42 years old, married with one child, and she lives in Benin City. She sells women's clothes and shoes. She is asking for a loan of $875 to buy more women's clothes and shoes. She has been in business since 1989, and she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes, shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en: Mirjana was born in 1982 and she lives in Laktaši. She is not married and has no children. She owns a hair salon and her monthly income is 700 BAM. This is the first loan she has sought through Kiva and she is seeking this loan in the amount of 1,200 BAM to enable her to buy equipment for her shop. In practice, she intends to improve upon the services that her salon offers and, as a result, to generate additional monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase certain equipment for her hair salon

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. sells drinks and pepper soup. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with one child and is 27 years old. She learned her business for a year and has been a LAPO client for 3 years. She needs a loan of $300 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy drinks for sale

loans.name: Marcela De

texts.es:
Marcela is 34 years old. She is dedicated to the commerce of potatoes that she produces and subsequently sells in CHAPISIRKA. Marcela has 5 children ages 1 year, 6 years, 8 years, 10 years and 12 years respectively. Her husband helps her in the activities of the cultivation of potatoes. Likewise, he collaborates with the care of the children. Marcela has been dedicated to this activity for a very long time along with her husband. She possesses 10 pack donkeys with which she transports the product. Also she owns the lands where she cultivates the potatoes. When there is no crop (for some reason), she purchases and then re-sells the product. Marcela has some competition, since the zone where she cultivates is traditional for the cultivation of potatoes. Nevertheless she has been capable of gaining a stable portion of the market for potatoes. With the credit she requests, she will buy potatoes (capital for operations) at the market price. Nevertheless as she has gained enough experience in this area, she has been able to obtain better prices for this activity. The present loan is her fifth. The previous loans were paid in a normal manner, although it should be mentioned that the client had some payments behind schedule due to problems related to the sowing of the potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcela de 34 años de edad se dedica al comercio por menor de papa CHAPISIRKA mima que produce y posteriormente vende. Marcela cuenta con 5 hijos de 1 año, 6 años, 8 años, 10 años y 12 años respectivamente. Su esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades del cultivo de la papa. Asimismo, colabora con el cuidado de los niños. Marcela se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo junto a su esposo. Ella posee 10 burros de carga con los cuales transporta el producto. También es propietaria de los terrenos donde cultiva la papa. Cuando no existe produccion (por algun motivo), compra y luego re-vende el producto. Marcela cuenta con alguna competencia, ya que la zona donde ella cultiva es tradicional en el cultivo de la papa. Sin embargo ella ha sido capaz de establecer una porción estable del mercado de la papa. Con el credito obtenido, comprará papa (capital de operaciones) a los precios del mercado. Sin embargo como ella cuenta con bastante experiencia en este rubro, ha podido conseguir los mejores precios para esta actividad. La presente es su quinta secuencia. Los anteriores creditos los canceló con normalidad, cabe mencionar que la cliente tuvo algunos dias de retraso, esto debido a problemas relacionados con la siembra de la papa.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is 42 years old. He is dedicated to the transportation of passengers. Mario has 3 children ages 4 years, 10 years, and 12 years respectively. His wife works in the home, although she has taken up a business selling hamburgers.

Mario is a very responsible person when it comes to his family and he thinks in the future to expand his income by dedicating himself to heavy transportation (fleets). Mario has been dedicated to auto transportation for a enough time (100 months) always showing responsibility and taking care in his activity.

There is a lot of competition in the area, nevertheless he has a lot of experience which permits him to guarantee his income and, even more, to provide his family with a stable source of income.

With the loan obtained, he will proceed to repay the legal expenses from the acquisition of a plot of land. Thus also will the client proceed to repay his balance with Agrocapital. This is the fourth loan for Mario. The previous loans where repaid in a normal manner, although his average payment time was 1 day behind schedule, but he can qualify as a good client to our institution.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario de 42 años de edad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Mario tiene 3 hijos de 4 años, 10 años y 12 años respectivamente, su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa, sin embargo ella retomará su negocio de venta de hamburguesas.

Mario es una persona muy responsable con su familia y piensa en el futuro ampliar sus ingresos dedicando se al transporte pesado (flotas). Mario se dedica al autotransporte desde hace bastante tiempo (100 meses) siempre demostrando responsabilidad y esmero en su actividad.

Existe mucha competencia en el rubro, sin embargo este cuenta con mucha expereriencia lo cual le permite asegurar sus ingresos y más aun proveer a su familia con una fuente de ingresos estable.

Con el credito obtenido, procederá a la cancelación de los tramites legales producto de la adquisición de un lote de terreno. Así tambien el cliente procederá a la cancelación de su saldo con Agrocapital. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de Mario, los anteriores canceló con normalidad presenta un promedio de mora minimo 1 día de retraso pero se puede calificar como un bueno en función a nuestra institución.

loans.use: To repay the legal expenses from the purchase of a plot of land.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es:
Aniceto is 41 years old. At present he works in SOBOLMA LTD. as the operator of a wood-shaving machine and in his free time he does electrical work. Aniceto lives in his own house along with his second wife and children, as well as a stepchild that participates in this loan.

Aniceto is a long time worker for SOBOLMA LTD. In his electrical work also he has enough experience that he does not lack for clientele. He does not have direct competition since he is an old and reliable employee. He has very good recommendations for being responsible and punctual. The activities that he carries out as an electrician provide an extra income that helps him a lot with his economy.

The present request will be used to pay for a surgical operation that has to be performed. This is the third loan for Aniceto with our institution. The previous loans were repaid in a punctual manner and at present he does not have another loan in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Aniceto de 41 años de edad actualmente trabaja en SOBOLMA LTDA. como operador de viruteadora y en su tiempo libre realiza trabajos de electricidad. Aniceto vive en su casa propia junto a su segunda esposa e hijos, al igual que un hijastro que participa del crédito.

Aniceto es trabajador antiguo de SOBOLMA LTDA., en su trabajo de electricidad también tiene bastante experiencia por lo cual clientela no le falta. No tiene competencia directa ya que es dependiente antiguo y fijo, tiene muy buenas recomendaciones por ser responsable y puntual. Las actividades que realiza como electricista es un ingreso extra que le ayuda mucho en su economía.

La presente solicitud está destinada a pagar la operación quirúrgica que tiene que realizarse. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Aniceto con nuestra institución, los anteriores créditos los ha pagado de manera puntual y actualmente no tiene otro crédito en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To pay for a surgical operation.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
WALTER is a young father of a three-year-old boy who is well connected to the work of his father and who accompanies his father to work while his mother prepares food so that they can get together at lunchtime. Walter always had the desire to employ himself in transportation, and now that he works driving his motorcycle taxi, he is not far from achieving all that he has desired so much. With the same promise of daily involvement, he sells spare parts for the cars and motorcycles that are abundant in his area, a characteristic of the place that has made his business very favorable. But in spite of this great opportunity, there are days when Walter doesn't carry certain tools or certain parts because they are expensive, though having them would, without a doubt, help to increase his income. It is because of this that he is seeking a loan for the purchase of a greater quantity of parts.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

WALTER, es un joven padre de un pequeño niño de tres años quien está tan vinculado a la labor de su padre que sale a trabajar con él mientras su mamá prepara sus alimentos para reunirse a la hora del almuerzo.Walter siempre tuvo el deseo de desempeñarse como transportista y ahora que trabaja con su moto taxi no esta lejos de llegar a convertirse en lo que tanto desea, con el mismo empeño de su desenvolvimiento diario vende repuestos para los carros y motos que abundan en su localidad, característica que ha hecho muy propicio su negocio. Pero pese a esta gran oportunidad hay días en que Walter no posee algunas herramientas o algunos repuestos porque son costosos, que le ayudaría sin duda a aumentar sus ingresos. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos.

loans.use: An increase in capital to acquire a greater number of spare parts.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma suffered the loss of her husband in a fateful car accident, which really affected the family’s emotional and financial stability. Undoubtedly, life had to go on, so Vilma had to take charge of the household and work in order to provide her children with food and an education. We found Vilma preparing her delicious mazamorras, a popular South American pudding-like dessert, which were ready to be sold in a small stand near the country’s central highway. She rents this business space, but she would like to build a small restaurant next to that business space so that she can work there permanently.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

VILMA sufrió la pérdida de su esposo en un fatídico accidente de tránsito, este suceso afectó mucho la estabilidad emocional y económica de su familia. Pero sin duda la vida tenia que proseguir y Vilma tuvo que tomar las riendas de su casa y trabajar para procurarles alimentación y educación de sus hijos.Así encontramos a Vilma preparando unas deliciosas mazamorras que estaban listas para su venta en una casita pequeña instalada en la autopista central de su país. El espacio en el que se desempeña es alquilado y tiene el deseo de construir un pequeño restaurante próximo a este espacio con el deseo de desempeñarse de manera continua en el.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of pastries

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Having a talent for cooking is a characteristic that has helped Maribel prepare her delicious tamales that she makes in bulk from home almost everyday. She starts during the early hours of the day so that the tamales can be ready for the women who come to buy them and sell them on the streets or in stands. This is quite an arduous task because it takes a lot of effort to make so many tamales. She would like to increase her capital with the aim of setting up a fruit business because she has seen a great demand in this field.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El tener un don para la cocina es una característica que ha ayudado a Maribel en la preparación de sus riquísimos tamales que elabora en casa en grandes cantidades todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para que las señoras que vienen a comprarlos los tengan ya listos para venderlos de manera ambulatoria en las bodegas de su ciudad.Esta es una tarea muy cansada debido a que demanda mucho esfuerzo por la cantidad de los mismos.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de pronto instalar también un negocio de venta de frutas ya que ha observado la gran demanda de esta actividad.

loans.use: Increase capital to boost production

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Ciriaco has a seven people in his family: himself, his wife, and his five children. His children are 20, 18, 15, 13 and 12 years old respectively. Ciriaco and his son named Codeudor are employees of the business SOBOLMA LTD, a motortaxi company in Warnes. Motortaxis are important because it is one of the main means of mobilization for city dwellers. They purchased a new motorcycle to transport their clients and to guarantee that they are able to sell their services for a price comparable to the rest of the motortaxi market.

Their predecessors in the institution always complied with repayment of their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

Ciriaco tiene una familia que se encuentra conformada por 7 personas, él, su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 20, 18, 15, 13 y 12 años respectivamente. Ciriaco al igual que su hijo (codeudor) son empleados fijos de la empresa SOBOLMA LTDA. y amobs en sus tiemos libres se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en moto, es decir trabajan como mototaxistas en Warnes. En ambas actividades su nivel de competencia es medio, sobre todo en el de transporte de pasajeros ya que es uno de los principales medios de movilización de los ciudadanos. Compraran un nueva moto para transportarse y para trabajar de acuerdo al precio que este en el mercado. Sus antecedentes en la intitución son excelentes, demostró un cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Buy a New Motorcycle to Improve His Mototaxi Company

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar, who had, a short time ago, dedicated himself to the growth and production of citrus fruits in cultivation because of a number of obligations that he had to meet, was with much effort able to buy himself a motorcycle to work and earn additionl income for his household with which he satisfactorily covered the academic expenses for his three daughters, who are without a doubt the greatest source of happiness in his daily life. Every day, he leaves very early to be able to transport people to their destinations and, now that classes have started, to transport students to their respective centers of education. Due to the large volume of work and to the local weather and climate, his vehicle has suffered from some imperfections, and he wishes to quicky fix those so that he can continue his daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Omar, hace poco tiempo se dedicaba a la producción de cítricos en sus terrenos de cultivo, a consecuencia del sin número de necesidades que tenía que satisfacer, logró comprarse con mucho esfuerzo una moto para trabajar y llevar un ingreso adicional a su hogar a fin de cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos escolares de sus tres hijas quienes sin duda son su mayor motivo de alegría día a día.Todos los días sale desde muy temprano para poder trasladar a las personas a sus destinos y ahora que empezó las clases traslada a los estudiantes a sus respectivos centros educativos. Debido al enorme trabajo y a las consecuencias climáticas su herramienta ha sufrido algunos desperfectos y desea solucionarlos pronto para continuar con su diaria labor.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and maintenance for his transport vehicle.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
OLINDA and her beloved husband work their hardest every day in each of their activities with the desire of helping their young daughter quickly recover her voice. During selected periods, Olinda travels to the capital of their country with the goal of acquiring items of clothing that she can offer in their small shop, which is very popular and well known in their city. Her desire to increase her capital, so that she can soon schedule an operation for her daughter, has led her to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

OLINDA y su querido esposo se esfuerzan a diario en cada una de sus actividades con el deseo de ayudar pronto a su pequeña a recobrar la voz.Ella viaja durante determinados períodos a la capital de su país con el objetivo de adquirir prendas de vestir para ofertarlas en su pequeño espacio de ventas muy popular y conocido de su ciudad.Su deseo de incrementar su capital con el propósito de pronto programar la operación de su pequeña la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: An increase in capital to be able to offer a greater number of items of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Olivar

texts.es:
Being a father is a great responsibility, more so if you are the head of the household who assumes the expenses of a young one on the way, as does Olivar. Olivar works from sunup to sundown to be able to put together everything necessary before his wife, who is currently in delicate health due to her pregnancy, gives birth. This condition, however, has not made it inconvenient for him to fulfill his obligations, as is his habit, in his small shop. Olivar is very worried because he needs a very expensive part for his vehicle so that he can continue to transport people in the community, as he is already accustomed to doing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that, by purchasing this piece of equipment, he can return to his work routine.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Ser padre es una gran responsabilidad en la familia y más si eres la cabeza del hogar y quien asumirá los gastos del pequeño que viene en camino como, Olivar, quien trabaja de sol a sol para poder juntar lo necesario para el parto de su esposa que se encuentra delicada de salud por su embarazo, sin embargo este estado no ha sido inconveniente para desempeñarse como de costumbre en su pequeña bodega.Olivar está muy preocupado debido a que su vehículo necesita de una pieza muy costosa para transportar a las personas de comunidad como ya estaba acostumbrado, por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de solicitar su envío en corto tiempo a fin de retornar a su rutina laboral.

loans.use: To buy a spare part for his vehicle.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
JUAN, who works very hard on his small farm all day, is motivated by what he and his wife may do with her business of selling food and drink, an activity which presents her with fantastic possibilities for prosperity in her location in a zone of great commercialization. Because of these possibilities, Juan invests the majority of the money he earns from selling his produce in the business of his wife, who dedicates herself to preparing appetizing lunches and serving frozen beverages, which are indispensible in such a warm place. In spite of the fact that Juan, through his achievements, brings home a considerable sum of money, the sum hasn't been sufficient for the growth and improvement of his wife's place of business, and he requires a loan to be able to invest in her business and make it properous.

Translated from Spanish by SheiL. Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

JUAN, trabaja muy duramente en su chacra todo el día, motivo por el cual hayamos a su esposa en su negocio D. venta D. comida y bebidas, actividad que le da grandes posibilidades D. prosperidad por su ubicación en una zona D. gran comercialización. Por eso Juan invierte L. mayor parte D. las ganacias que obtiene D. L. venta D. sus productos en el negocio D. su esposa, quien se dedica a preparar sus apetitosos almuerzos y servir las heladas bebidas que son indispensables en tan calurosa localidad.A pesar D. que Juan en las cosechas trae una suma muy considerable, no ha sido suficiente para L. ampliación y mejoramiento D. su local y requiere D. un préstamo para poder invertirlos en este negocio y hacerlo próspero.

loans.use: Enlargement and improvement of his beloved wife's sales space.

loans.name: Ada's Group

texts.es:
The group is made up of 15 women from the company Cabañas in the city of Caacupé, Paraguay. They are enterprising, hard-working women dedicated to wide-spread activities, but that doesn't effect the good organization of the group.

Currently, the women are in their seventh loan cycle in the Committee of Enterprising Women program and each member has a line of credit. The group started after some initial informational meetings in the home Ninfa Vázquez, who learned of the program from a cousin who's a member in another group. Thanks to the meetings, the women started to mobilize and soon they were able to form a group of 15, the minimum requisite number. Today they are ready for their eighth loan cycle.

Ada A., president of the committee, says it was a little difficult to reach a consensus on how to divide the first loans among the members — there were always differing opinions. But as time went on their relationship strengthened, and today one of the characteristics of the group is the harmony and mutual respect they have for each other. She considers the group's success comes from the fact that each member must meet the objectives as an individual and as a group.

Among the activities that these women participate in are: selling plants, selling crafts, a convenience store, a kiosk, selling clothes, and the majority are dedicated to selling "chipas" — a very popular traditional dish in Paraguay. To invest in these different business, the women are requesting a loan which they plan to repay monthly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé; el grupo esta compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a actividades diversas, pero esto no influye negativamente en la buena coordinación del grupo.

Actualmente ellas están en el 7to. Ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y manejan una línea de crédito promedio de Gs. 713.000 por cada integrante. El comité se inició con unas primeras reuniones informativas que se realizaron en la casa de la señora Ninfa Vázquez, quién tuvo conocimiento del programa a través de una prima que es integrante de otro grupo.

Gracias a las reuniones informativas, las señoras empezaron a movilizarse y en corto tiempo lograron juntar 15 señoras que es el requisito mínimo para formar el comité. Hoy día ellas ya están listas para pasar al 8vo ciclo de renovación.

Ada A., presidenta del comité, manifiesta que en los primeros ciclos fue un poco difícil llegar a consensuar entre todas, siempre había opiniones dispares, no obstante a medida que fue pasando el tiempo el grupo se fue fortaleciendo y hoy una de las características de este comité es la armonía y el respeto mutuo entre todas, y considera que le éxito de un comité se da por la sencilla razón de que cada integrante debe estar comprometido con los objetivos que se han trazado en forma individual y como integrante del grupo.

Entre las actividades que desarrollan estas mujeres están: venta de plantas, ventas de artesanías en barro, despensas, kioscos, venta de ropas, y la mayoría se dedica a la venta de “chipas” comida típica muy consumida en el Paraguay. Para invertir en estos diferentes negocios, estas mujeres solicitan el crédito que se comprometen a pagar mensualmente de forma puntual.

loans.use: To purchase items like oil, cookies, sugar, cotton, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, milk, clothing, seeds, fertilizer, etc. / Para la compra de mercaderías tales como aceite, galletas, azúcar, almidón, queso, aceite vegetal, leña, harina, leche, ropas para niños, damas, caballeros, semillas, abono, entre otros.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana is 64 years old, married and has four children. She's dedicated to making and selling leather thermoses for more than 25 years.

She learned her craft from her parents, who taught her how to work with this activity. Cipriana is very well known in the region for the quality of her work, and her products have a quick turnaround, especially at the end of the month and the year. She also receives orders from customers in other cities like Asunción (the capital), Ciudad del Este, Encarnación and exports her products to Argentina.

Cipriana says that thanks to her work she and her husband were able to build a home, pay for their children's education and cover household expenses.

With previous loans she's received from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya she was able to purchase materials necessary to do her work. Today the demand for her products is higher and more varied than ever before, since thermoses with different colors, designs, names and sports logos are in style. She is requesting a loan to purchase large quantities of leather, threads, paints, special needles, glue, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Cipriana tiene 64 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de termos forrados en cuero hace ya más de 25 años.

El oficio de trabajar en el arte de forrar termos y guampas lo heredó de sus padres, quiénes le enseñaron a trabajar en esta actividad. Cipriana es muy conocida en la zona por la calidad de su trabajo y posee gran movimiento de ventas, especialmente los fines de mes y fin de año. También recibe pedidos de clientes de otras ciudades como Asunción, Ciudad del Este, Encarnación e inclusive exporta sus productos a la Argentina.

Cipriana, dice que con este trabajo ella y su marido pudieron edificar su casa propia, cubrir los gastos de la educación de sus hijos, y mantener los gastos propios de una familia.

Con los préstamos otorgados anteriormente por la Fundación Paraguaya, ellos pudieron comprar materiales para realizar sus trabajos. Hoy día la demanda de sus productos es cada vez más alta y variada, ya que hoy por hoy están de moda los termos forrados de colores y con diseños bordados de dibujos, nombres y hasta insignias de clubes deportivos.

Hoy solicitan el crédito para la compra de materiales en grandes cantidades como cueros, hilos, pinturas, agujas especiales, pegamento, etc.

Tiene proyectado alquilar un salón en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Caacupé para exponer su trabajo, ella es conciente de que en este rubro hay mucha competencia pero afirma que su trabajo es muy demandado por su buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchase supplies like leather, thread, paints, etc. / Para compra de cueros, hilos, pinturas, etc.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es:
Clemencia is married with 2 children. She sells various products for women like silver jewelry, cosmetics, new and used clothing, and other items.

She has worked in this business for over 10 years and has a loyal customer base that is always in need of her products. Clemencia’s previous loans from Fundacion Paraguaya helped her to increase her working capital, investing it in wholesale merchandise since that is the best way for her to get her products at a low price.

With the profits from her business, she helps her husband to pay the living expenses and her children’s education. She says that there are weeks when things go very well where she has had her best sales records; now she has begun selling school supplies since classes are just beginning.

Clemencia requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as creams, makeup, silver jewelry, clothing, pens and notebooks and large quantities in order to meet the strong demand of her new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Clemencia, es una señora casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos para damas como ser joyas de plata, cosméticos, ventas de ropas nuevas y usadas, entre otros.

Ella se dedica a este rubro hace ya más de 10 años, posee una clientela fija que constantemente solicitan sus productos. Clemencia nos comentó que los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya anteriormente, le sirvieron para aumentar su capital de trabajo, invirtiéndolo en mercaderías a precio mayorista, ya que esta es una de las maneras en que uno consigue los productos a mejor precio.

Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio, ella puede ayudar a su marido a hacer frente con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos. Ella nos cuenta que hay semanas dónde le va bastante bien y registra mayor movimiento de ventas; y actualmente ella ha incorporado entre su stock de mercaderías artículos de librería y útiles escolares ya que estamos en época de inicio de clases.

Clemencia solicita hoy un crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como cremas, maquillajes, joyas de plata, ropas, lápices y cuadernos en grandes cantidades y así abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene de sus clientes nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase of creams, makeup, silver jewelry, clothing, pens and notebooks in large quantities

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 48 years old. He has been earning a living transporting people in his vehicle for many years. Currently he lives in his brothers' house which is located by radial 17, between quinto and sexto anillo.

The transportation business is very arduous and requires a lot of time, patience and knowledge of the different areas of the city. Since Jose has a lot of experience in this business he knows the city very well. The competition in this business is significantly high; but the demand for the service is just as high, especially in Santa Cruz, which is one of the largest cities. Jose has his seniority in his favor, since he knows where are the strategic places to find clients.

The loan will be used to provide maintenance to his vehicle, to purchase tires, etc. There isn't a set fare for the transportation, it depends on the distance and the amount of passengers. Jose has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Jose de 48 años de edad trabaja como transportista de pasajeros desde hace muchos años atras, actualmente vive en la casa de sus hermanos que se encuentra ubicada por la radial 17 entre el quinto y sexto anillo. El rubro de transporte es muy arduo y requiere de mucho tiempo, paciencia y conocimiento de las áreas de la ciudad, Jose como tiene bastante experiencia en esta actividad conoce muy bien la ciudad. La competencia en este rubro es bastante elevada y competitiva, pero así también de elevada es la demanda por este servicio sobre tod en Snata Cruz que una de las ciudades más grandes, entonces Jose tiene a favor su antiguedad ya que sabe cuales son los lugares estrategicos para ubicar clientes. La presente solicitud es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, compra de llantas y otros. No existe una tarifa especifica para el transporte ya que el mismo depende de la distancia y la cantidad de pasajeros. Jose tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: To provide maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Anta Group

texts.en:
“Anta” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty to grow crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Anta”, is located at approximately 3,400 meters above sea level, in the community with the same name in the province of Acobamba. The main activities of the population are the growth of corn (lower altitudes), potatoes and wheat (higher altitudes), and people also have cows, bulls and sheep. In the small town the people have shops and proviD. several services. Currently the bank has completed its first loan cycle. The bank is just six months old with 10 female borrowers currently and a total loan of 4,400 soles (about $1,575 US). The loans range from 200 to 800 soles. The group was able to save over 2,100 soles (about $750 US) in the first loan cycle and will continue to save in the future.

Most members, during their first cycle, learned to do business. Previously most production was for auto-consumption, but more and more they have learned to do business and earn a little money with the work they do. Other very important things they learned are to save and to be responsible. With their savings they hope for their children to study and to be professionals.

One of the members of the community bank is María Dorotea C. B.. María buys sheep and sells them at local markets. With her 200 soles loan, she will buy more sheep and sell them. Sometimes she kills one of the sheep to sell the meat. Like most people in the area, she grows peas, barley, beans and corn her in a small field, but mostly for consumption by her family. In the first cycle she managed to save some money which she can use to buy school supplies now that school is starting again. She has learned in FINCA Perú to save and has received good advice about how to live in harmony with her family. Her dream for the future is to have all her children studying in five years, to have a bigger business, and to gain more experience.

Euforsinia P. S. is another member of the bank who has a business buying fruits in boxes that trucks bring all the way from Huancayo, one of the mayor cities in the central Andes. Euforsinia sells the fruit at local markets. Another business she runs is buying and selling pigs, guinea-pigs and sheep. Like all women in the community bank, she also has her fields with corn, peas and beans, most of the production being for auto-consumption. With her 300 soles loan, she will buy fruits. With her savings she is able to increase business by buying and selling more animals. In FINCA Peru she has learned to save, to be more responsible and to practice her values.

loans.use: New supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of athletic shoes, new and used clothing (t-shirts, dress shirts, dresses, jeans, etc.)

loans.name: Erasma

texts.es:
