Erasma is an elderly woman who had to take hold of the reins of her household due to her beloved husband’s terrible illness. This experience was detrimental to her family stability, so she had to go out into the streets and sell what she makes best: sweet corn cakes and tamales. Because of her daily comings and goings, which take a toll on her, she would like to get settled into a business space in which she can sell her products with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ERASMA, es una mujer de avanzada edad que tuvo que asumir las riendas de su hogar, debido a la penosa enfermedad de su querido esposo.Este hecho perjudicó la estabilidad de la familia y Erasma, tuvo que salir a las calles a vender lo que mejor podía hacer y desde entonces se dedicó a la venta de humitas y tamales de manera ambulante, debido a lo pesado del trajín diario desea establecerse en un local para ofertarlos desde este lugar con mayor comodidad.

loans.use: Rental of business space

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, besides working for a public department, sells beauty products for a living, relying on her family and friend’s support for having a successful business. She wishes to increase her capital in order to offer a greater quantity and variety of products, with the aim of settling into a business space in a shopping center so that she can better manage her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

SONIA, además de desempeñarse para un departamento público se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de manera contando con la importante ayuda para un exitoso desempeño con su entorno familiar y amical.Tiene el noble deseo de incrementar su capital para ofertar mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos a fin de establecerse en un espacio dentro de un centro comercial para mejor administración de sus ganacias.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity and variety of products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is from Tarma, a city that watched her grow but had to watch her leave when she got married and decided to take on new challenges in her life: working in agriculture alongside her beloved husband. She learned this skill thanks to her partner, who was always there to support her. She quickly learned the tricks of the trade, and now plants fruits and coffee with great efficiency. She would like to purchase a greater quantity of manure and fertilizer in order to increase her crops this harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

LOURDES, es de Tarma ciudad que la vio crecer pero que tuvo que verla partir cuando se casó y decidió emprender nuevos retos en su vida y dedicarse a la agricultura con su querido esposo, fue una de las cosas nuevas que aprendió gracias al apoyo de su pareja quien siempre estuvo con ella para apoyarla.Rápidamente aprendió los gajes del oficio y ahora siembra frutas y café con mucha eficiencia.Desea comprar mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes para obtener mayor cantidad de frutos en este cosecha anual.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Vilfredo

texts.es:
With the help of his beloved parents, Vilfredo was able to obtain his own work tools so that he could carry out his daily tasks around his city. He has a young daughter and would like to increase his earnings so that he could provide her with wellbeing. For this reason, he decided to set up a small pharmacy in his house so that his dear wife can practice the profession that she is so passionate about and for which she prepared at a prestigious university in her city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Con ayuda de sus queridos padres Vilfredo, a podido adquirir su herramienta de trabajo para desempañarse a diario por los alrededores de su ciudad. Tiene una pequeña niña y desea incrementar sus ingresos para otorgarle mayor bienestar por esa razón ha decidido instalar una pequeña farmacia en casa a fin de que su querida esposa ejerza la profesión que tanto la apasiona y para la cual se preparó en una prestigiosa universidad de su ciudad.

loans.use: Set up a small, home pharmacy

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 40 years old, married, with 3 children. She has sold garden plants for more than 12 years.

She inherited the trade from her parents who were great plant salesmen. Now and for the past 10 years, Francisca has been in charge of and managed her parents’ business with great care and responsibility.

She tells us that there are many similar businesses in her city, since the good weather and the fertile ground are good for the cultivation of plants. In spite of the competition, she has many loyal customers who come from various parts of the country to buy their plants from her.

She would like to open a sales stand next to the main city highway at kilometer 55. She believes that this will help visitors and foreigners that come to Caacupe on weekends to see her goods.

She would use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, flowerpots, and other items for her nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de plantas para jardín hace ya más de 12 años.

El oficio lo heredó de sus padres quiénes fueron grandes comercializadores de plantas, actualmente, el negocio fundado por sus padres ahora esta a cargo de la señora Francisca, quien hace más de 10 años lo administra con mucha responsabilidad y esmero.

Ella nos cuenta que existen muchos negocios del mismo tipo en su ciudad, ya que el buen clima y la tierra ayudan a la buena producción de plantas. A pesar de la alta competencia, ella posee buena cantidad de clientes formados, pues de distintos puntos del país vienen a comprar sus plantas.

Tiene proyectado abrir un puesto de venta y exposición en el km. 55 al costado de la ruta principal de la ciudad, de esta forma la señora piensa que sus productos serán observados por los visitantes de otras ciudades y extranjeros que llegan a Caacupé especialmente los fines de semana.

El préstamo solicitado desea utilizarlo para la compra de semillas, abono, macetas e insumos para su vivero.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, seeds, and flowerpots, etc.

loans.name: Tekove Pora Group

texts.es:
The committee is composed of 15 hard-working women from the Kennedy neighborhood of Caacupe. The majority of the members work in the production and street sale of chipas (a typical Paraguayan dish made with eggs, cheese, and corn starch), other group members sell clothing, home-made candy, and groceries. They are currently in the 7th cycle of the Entrepreneurial Women program and manage an average line of credit per person of ~$199.

The committee’s first meetings were in Mrs. Dora C.’s home, who was the first to find out about the program and gathered her hard-working neighbors to propose that they work together as a committee. She rounded up 15 very entrepreneurial women, each with a lot of desire to progress.

Since the formation of the group, they have worked very hard and have punctually paid off each of their previous loans. There have been no problems or arguments amongst group members, rather, each day they are more united and work as a team. They support each other a lot, and one of the norms they’ve adopted as a group is buying their goods wholesale in order to get better prices and discounts in their purchases.

Maria G., the committee president, states that they have learned a lot with this program since, more than just receiving a loan, they have received training in matters of public relations, self-esteem, business administration, and marketing among others.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Kennedy de la ciudad de Caacupé, la gran mayoría de las integrantes de este comité se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas (comida típica paraguaya muy consumida, esta hecha a base de huevos, queso y almidón) en forma ambulante, otras se dedican a la venta de ropas, dulces caseros y despensa. Ellas están actualmente en en el 7to. Ciclo del programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 900.000 por cada integrante.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Dora C., quién fue la primera en tener conocimiento del programa y reunió a sus vecinas trabajadoras para proponerles trabajar juntas como comité. Ella logró juntar el mínimo requerido de 15 señoras todas ellas mujeres emprendedoras y con muchas ganas de progresar.

Durante todos estos meses han trabajado y cumplido puntualmente con sus préstamos anteriores, no han surgido problemas ni diferencias entre ellas, por el contrario, cada día están más unidas y trabajan en equipo. Ellas se apoyan bastante y una de las formas de trabajo que adoptaron es la de comprar sus materias primas en cantidades mayoristas para lograr así obtener mejores precios y descuentos en sus compras.

Maria G., presidenta del comité, manifiesta que aprendieron bastante con este programa ya que aparte de recibir un préstamo también recibieron capacitación tales como relaciones públicas, el autoestima, como administrar su negocio, marketing, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of commodities such as corn starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, milk, clothing for men, women, and children, and groceries such as fruit, sugar, milk, flour, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Vda De

texts.es:
Victoria is 58 years old and lives alone, following the death of her husband sometime ago. She has children but they are all financially independent.

Victoria makes empanadas (turnovers), cakes, masas (pastries) and other items made to order. She also earns income from a rental property and from her widower pension. She has approximately 9 years of experience with both businesses. She does not have a lot of competition because her experience and the quality of her products make her masitas very popular. She also always has tenants in the apartment. The products Victoria buys to make her cakes and pastries vary depending on the demand and they are priced according to the market.

This loan is to be used to expand her home which is where she makes her baked goods. This is her second loan with our institution and she has shown to be a responsible person that always pays on time.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria es una señora de 58 años de edad, actualmente vive sola su esposo falleció hace un tiempo atrás, tiene hijos pero todos son economicamente indepedientes.

Victoria realiza empanadas, tortas, masas y otros a pedido, también percibe ingresos que provienen del aquiler de un departamento y de su renta por ser viuda.

En ambos negocios tiene una experiencia aproximada de 9 años, por lo que la competencia no es muy representativa para ella ya que con el tiempo de experiencia y la calidad de sus productos ella cuenta con una alta demanda de sus masitas, además que nunca le faltan inquilinos en el departamento. Los productos (insumos) que compra Victoria para la elaboración de empanadas, tortas y masas varian de acuerdo a la demanda de los mismos y los precios están de acuerdo al mercado.

Esta solicitud es para la ampliación de su vivienda que es donde elabora los productos de repostería, es la quinta secuencia con nuestra institución y demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: To expand her home

loans.name: Marta's Group

texts.es:
The committee is composed of 15 hard-working women from the Kennedy neighborhood of Caacupe. The majority of the members work in the cultivation and sale of garden plants, some sell groceries, and a few sell clothes for men, women, and children. A special characteristic of the group is their unity, which is demonstrated as they coordinate the sale of their products each weekend in the main neighborhood square.

The group is currently in the 7th cycle of the Entrepreneurial Women program, where each member manages an average credit of ~$188. The members are involved in the sale of plants, clothing, and groceries.

The women of the committee found out about the program through the local newspaper, and got in contact with the Caacupe office program advisor. The group of 15 women formed quickly, calling itself the “Tekova Pora Rekavo” committee, and the first meetings were carried out in group president Marta S.’s home. They are very grateful to Fundacion Paraguaya for the support they are receiving through the program, and that not only are they receiving credit, but also training that helps them learn how to confront the challenges that come with being small businesswomen.

The loan they receive will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, flowerpots, seeds, and garden plants; other women will invest it in the purchase of basic products like sugar, herbs, milk, and beef among others.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Kennedy de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y venta de plantas para jardín, algunas poseen despensas y una minoría se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, una de las características muy especial del grupo es que son muy unidas, inclusive cuando deben coordinar la exposición de sus productos los fines de semana en la plaza del barrio.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 7mo. ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 853.000 cada integrante. Entre las actividades que realizan se encuentran: vendedoras de plantas, vendedoras de ropas, y despensas.

El comité se inició gracias a que una de las señoras se enteró a través del diario local (prensa) y se puso en contacto con el asesor del programa de la oficina de Caacupé y rápidamente empezó a formarse el grupo de 15 señoras que lo denominaron Comité “Tekove Pora Rekavo” y sus primeras reuniones lo llevaron acabo en la casa de la presidenta la señora Marta S., quien además manifestó estar muy agradecida a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que están recibiendo ya que a través de este programa no solo reciben el crédito si no también están recibiendo capacitación y esto les permite asimilar nuevos conocimientos para afrontar los desafíos que conlleva ser un microempresaria.

El préstamo que reciban lo invertirán en la compra de abonos, macetas, semillas, plantas para jardín, otras señoras lo invertirán en la compra de productos de consumo diario como azúcar, yerba mate, leche, carne, entre otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, flowerpots, garden plants, sugar, beef, herbs, flour, milk, charcoal, drinks, and clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Rogelia's Group

texts.es:
The committee is composed of 15 hard-working women of the San Isidro neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. The group is now in the seventh cycle of the Entrepreneurial Women program. Most of the members sell essential, basic products, fast food, clothing, cold drinks, cheese, and home-cooked meals. Being close neighbors facilitates daily communication amongst the group’s members.

The 15 women manage an average line of credit per person of ~$220, which they use to purchase merchandise to supply their businesses.

The committee was created when these women found out about Fundacion Paraguaya’s credit programs for women of scarce resources through another group of women. They were able to round up their San Isidro neighbors till the group reached 15 members; the first group meetings were then carried out in Mrs. Amalia G.’s home.

The committee’s goals include being recognized by the local municipal government to get permission to carry out cultural and artistic events in the neighborhood in order to raise money for the improvement of neighborhood streets, the school playground, and the main square. Their children will be the direct beneficiaries of these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo esta actualmente en el 7mo. Ciclo del programa Mujeres emprendedoras, gran parte de las integrantes son comerciantes de productos de primera necesidad, venta de comidas rápidas, ropas, bebidas heladas, comedores y venta de queso. Son vecinas del mismo barrio lo que facilita la comunicación diaria entre sus integrantes.

Las 15 señoras están manejando una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 1.000.000 por cada integrante y este monto lo invierten en su totalidad en la compra de mercaderías para surtir sus negocios.

El comité fue creado gracias a que se enteraron por medio de otras integrantes de otro comité de mujeres, que en la Fundación Paraguaya tienen un programa de crédito para mujeres de escasos recursos y por medio de esa información se fueron juntando las vecinas del barrio San Isidro hasta completar las 15 integrantes y posteriormente se realizaron las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Amalia G..

Tienen proyectado como comité ser reconocido por la Municipalidad local para obtener con mayor facilidad permisos para realizar eventos culturales y artísticos en el barrio para recaudar fondos e invertir en el mejoramiento de las calles y de la plaza del barrio con el objetivo de que sean sus hijos los beneficiados directos de estas mejoras e inclusive tienen pensado ayudar a la escuela del barrio a mejorar el parque deportivo que poseen con los fondos que ellas tienen pensado recaudar.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, such as sugar, herbs, milk, cookies, starch, beef, as well as the purchase of clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Jaqueline Eliz

texts.es:
Jaqueline is 40 years of age and juggles two different businesses. She sells cosmetics via catalogue and has a call center.

Jaqueline is a single mom with two children and lives with her mother who helps her to take care of the children.

She sells Yanbal and Avon cosmetics and has a call center in her home. She has been doing these two activities for over four years.

There is a lot of competition in both activities, but also a lot of demand for these goods and services. Thanks to her experience over the years she has a loyal clientele.

The price of her cosmetics depend on the brand and the sales from the call center depend on the destination called. Her voice provider has set rates and she receives aproximately 30% of every Bs.100 called.

This is her third loan with Agrocapital and Jaqueline has allways taken care of her payments on time. She currently has no pending debts with other financial institutions.

Please note that Jacqueline was not present when we went to take her picture, so we only profiled a picture of her call center.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Expand call center

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Ms. Maria de Jesús D. is a self-sacrificing woman that must travel over 40 kilometers every day to set up her fruit salad stall in the capital. She specializes in fruit salads as they are very popular for dessert in Paraguay. The high temperatures in this country make a refreshing fruit salad a most appetizing option after a meal.

María begins her day in the early hours of the day, traveling to the municipal market to purchase the fruits necessary to prepare her fruit salads. She also purchases the necessary plastic spoons and cups to serve her product. Then she travels to the city center, where she sets up her stall daily in a street corner. Her clientele is made up primarily of office workers from the vicinity. She is well known and loved.

Her sales day ends at 6 p.m., and after taking down her stall and traveling home she begins her role as wife and mother. María is a mother of six, her children study and also take care of a fruit salad salad stand at home. Her children love their mother and to help increase the family income they also prepare and sell the fruit salad at home.

María is one of the many Paraguayan women that sacrifice her days from sunrise to sunset to feed her children and provide an education for them. She is requesting a micro loan to invest in a greater variaty of fruit. With more variety, she will be able to sell fruit juices as well as her fruit salads. Her clients have allready expressed an interest in being able to buy fruit juices from her.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Fruit purchase

loans.name: Ever Franz

texts.es:
Ever is 34 years old and has an internet cafe / calling center near Gabriel Rene Moreno University.

Ever lives with his two children on his own, as his wife left the country a long time ago to find employment.

His business is quite busy as it is located very close to the university and a lot of students use his premises. He has been doing this line of work over the past six years.

There is a lot of competitors in the area, but he gets a lot of footfall thanks to his strategic location and wishes to expand his business.

The price of the equipment he wants to purchase is dictated by the current market value. This is his fourth credit with Agrocapital and he has always shown lots of responsability and fulfilled his loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase IT equipment for internet access

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cloth, threads and other materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria Trinity is the owner of a general store. She primarily sells food and other products for the home such as sugar, flour, oil, canned goods, cleaning supplies etc. She also sells cosmetics and clothes among others supplies. It has been 18 years since she started her business and she is very pleased with her own achievements.

María is a mother of two older, married children, and has six grandchildren that she adores equally. Her husband traveled to Spain six years ago in search of work, but unfortunately he abandoned her completely and has not sent help since he left because he now has another family.

In spite of the emotional blows that María has endured, she has remained strong for her children and has fought to stay ahead for herself and her family. Her love for her kids and her grandchildren have been her fortress.

Now, María has greater goals. She want to continue progressing and growing her business so that she can save and invest in other local businesses. Today, Maria is asking for a loan that will afford her the opportunity to purchase merchandise in greater quantities and thus with better discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria T., es dueña de una tienda de ventas de varios productos en general. Principalmente vende comestibles e insumos para el hogar como azúcar, harina, aceite, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza etc., también vende cosméticos, ropas entre otras cosas. Hace 18 años que monto su negocio y dice que esta muy contenta de sus logros.

María es madre de dos hijos ya mayores y casados, tiene seis nietos a quienes ella adora y brinda amor por igual. Su esposo viajo hace seis años a España en busca de trabajo, pero lastimosamente la abandono totalmente, y no le ha enviado ayuda desde entonces, ya que este hombre ya tenía otra familia sin que María tuviera conocimiento de ello.

A pesar de los golpes emocionales que María ha recibido, ella ha sabido mantenerse fuerte para sus hijos, y ha luchado sola para salir siempre adelante. El amor de sus hijos y sus nietos han sido la fuente de su fortaleza.

María hoy día tiene mayores metas, ella desea seguir progresando hasta lograr ampliar su negocio, para ello ha empezado a ahorrar un poco de dinero que el día de mañana lo invertirá en la ampliación del local comercial. Hoy día María solicita un crédito que le permitirá adquirir mercaderías en mayores cantidades y con buenos descuentos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as: drinks, sweets, dairy product, bakery products, meat, sugar, flour, oil and others.

loans.name: Areli

texts.es:
Areli has been harvesting coffee in her crop fields for a long time. She comments that this job is quite arduous because it requires a great deal of compromise and investment, since the slightest oversight can affect production considerably. Because she is expanding her field of action, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of manure and fertilizer so that she can continue her work and quickly become the city’s best coffee grower.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ARELI, desde hace mucho está dedicada a la producción de café en sus campos de cultivo y nos comenta que esta labor es muy dura y requiere de mucho compromiso e inversión, ya que el menor descuido puede afectar considerablemente la producción. A razón de que está incrementando su radio de acción solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes a fin de continuar con su labor y en poco tiempo convertirse en la mejor agricultora de café de su ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot is single-handedly raising her young son due to the terrible loss of her husband not too long ago. She still lives in her parents’ house. As a working mother, Margot relies on her parents, who lovingly look after her child until she comes home. Everyday, she travels throughout her city, looking to increase her sales. For this reason, she has decided to partake in selling dairy products, since she has seen a demand for this while she has been visiting every corner of her city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGOT, se ha quedado sola a cargo de su pequeño hijo hace poco tiempo debido a la terrible pérdida de su querido esposo. Aún habita la casa de sus padres y para su desenvolvimiento laboral cuenta con el apoyo de sus queridos padres quienes cuidan del pequeño con mucho amor hasta el retorno de su querida madre. Recorre a diario su ciudad en búsqueda de pedidos que le ayuden a incrementar sus ventas, por esta razón ha decidido también incursionar en la venta de productos lácteos ya que ha observado su demanda durante todo este tiempo que lleva recorriendo los rincones de su ciudad.

loans.use: Increase capital to sell dairy products

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy recently obtained a vehicle in order to offer public transportation services in her community, as well as to improve her beloved family’s quality of life. She now plans on setting up a space in her house in which to offer internet services to the youth of her community. She has seen a need for these types of services because of comments that her young daughter and husband, who are looking forward to contributing to this new business, have made.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

EDY, hace poco adquirió un automóvil para brindar servicios de movilidad a su comunidad y también para mejorar la calidad de vida de su querida familia. Ahora tiene proyectado instalar en su hogar un espacio para brindar el servicio de internet a los jóvenes de su comunidad ya que ha observado la necesidad de este servicio a través de los comentarios de su pequeña hija y esposo, quienes están muy deseosos y gustosos de contribuir con esta nueva labor.

loans.use: Increase capital to open an internet café in her community

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
I have everything ready to install security bars on my brick fence. I need to protect my family since my husband works all day, and we have a 4-year-old daughter. We do not allow her to play in the street because of the dangers that exist, so we chose to construct a small protective wall and install security bars. I am requesting a loan of $400.00 USD in order to put security bars on an existing protective wall in front of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo ya la preparación para poner las rejas en mi vivienda necesito que mi familia este protegida ya que mi esposo trabaja todo el día y tenemos una niña de 4 años, no la podemos dejar que juegue en la calle debido a los peligros que hay así es que preferimos poner una barda pequeña y las rejas”. Solicito $ 400.00 dlls para poner rejas en la barda que ya tenemos construida en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Installation of security bars on a protective wall in front of my house

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
For a long time, RAQUEL and her family have been dedicated to transporting fruits from her birth city to different parts of the country with the help of a fleet of three trucks that they acquired many years ago. Her husband and her children are in charge of driving the vehicles, while she is in charge of administering them and seeking out clients who desire their services. Due to the fact that many times their services are requested for longer days, she has decided to set up a small hardware store in her house so that, in this manner, her family would be able to sustain themselves satisfactorily during those times when those requests take more time than they had predicted.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

RAQUEL y su familia desde hace mucho están dedicados al transporte de frutas desde su ciudad natal hasta los diferentes departamentos de su país, con la ayuda de una flota de tres camiones que han adquirido hace muchos años. Su esposo y sus hijos se encargan de conducir sus vehículos y ella de administrarlos y buscar a los clientes que deseen se les preste el servicio. Debido a que muchas veces esperan la petición de sus servicios por largos días ha decidido instalar una pequeña ferretería en su hogar de esa manera se sostendrían satisfactoriamente durante el período en el que los pedidos tarden más de lo previsto.

loans.use: A quick shot of capital to set up a hardware store.

loans.name: Seeds Of Hope Group

texts.es:
The committee "Seeds of Hope" is a group of enterprising women that retains the majority of its first members. This group is now in the 7th cycle of its program titled "Committee of Enterprising Women" run by the Paraguayan Foundation.

The committee has saved 789,053 Paraguayan Guarani (approximately USD 185) that has been deposited in a cooperative in the city. The ladies who belong to the committee are dedicated to a variety of activities. They use the loan as operating capital to purchase merchandise and other necessary supplies to improve upon their businesses.

Among the activities that these women carry out are: selling clothes; selling food; selling lingerie for ladies; recycling; selling jewels; and selling pigs. They take care of everything and sacrifice all in order to guarantee their children have a better life than they had themselves. They want their children to be able to dedicate their time to studying so that they can help themselves to move up. Today, these women are committed to pouring their efforts into their enterprises in order to improve the lives of themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité “Semillas de Esperanza” es un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que aún mantiene a la mayoría de sus primeras integrantes. Este grupo se encuentra ahora en el 7º ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” que maneja la Fundación Paraguaya.

El comité lleva ahorrado Gs. 789.053 que se encuentra depositado en una cooperativa de la ciudad. Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades productivas para llevar adelante a sus familias, ellas utilizan el préstamo como capital operativo, es decir, invierten su dinero en la compra de mercaderías e insumos necesarios para sus respectivos negocios.

Entre las actividades que realizan estas mujeres podemos citar: venta de ropas, comestibles, lencería para damas, reciclaje, venta de joyas y cría y venta de cerdos. Todas se esmeran y sacrifican para sacar adelante a sus hijos, desean que ellos logren estudiar y superarse, ya que ellas no corrieron con esa suerte y hoy día deben redoblar sus esfuerzos para salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase: cardboard; plastics; aluminum; iron (to recycle); fruits (oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, watermelons); cosmetics; beverages for sale (such as beer, carbonated water and other refreshments); balanced food for hogs; among others things.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni has been working in the agricultural field for many years in order to help with the household expenses and assist her beloved husband, who fulfills his duties with honor. She grows corn, potatoes, and other vegetables. She is awaiting the harvest with the noble hope of yielding greater profits with the sale of her produce this year. With the aim of improving the quality of her crops, she would like to purchase more manure and organic fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

YENI, se dedica desde hace mucho a la labor agrícola para servir de apoyo y sustento monetario a su hogar y a la actividad que desempeña dignamente su querido esposo.Siembra maíz, papa y demás vegetales, está en espera de la cosecha y tiene el noble deseo de obtener mejores ganancias con la venta de sus productos este año; para tal fin desea incrementar la compra de abonos y fertilizantes naturales con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
Anali was able to obtain a motorcycle taxi with the help of her dear husband after much hard work. They use this work tool as a means of support for the family. Despite this investment, things have not improved much at home, so they found the need to render domestic services to that families who require them. Because of her great talent and dedication, she plans on setting up a space in her home to offer a variety of high-quality meals in her community. She is convinced that her daily work performance will raise her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ANALI, con mucho esfuerzo y con la importante ayuda de su querido esposo ha podido adquirir un mototaxi para que su familia obtenga de esta herramienta de trabajo el sustento diario. A pesar de esta inversión las cosas en casa no parecen haber mejorado mucho y se ha visto en la necesidad de prestar sus servicios domésticos a las familias que la requieran. Debido a su gran talento y a su dedicación tiene proyectado instalar en casa un espacio para ofertar diversos platillos de excelente calidad a su comunidad, esta convencida que este desempeño diario hará que su familia eleve su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Increase capital to set up a space for food sales in the house

loans.name: Marina Genoveva

texts.es:
Marina works in a noodle manufacturing plant. She works as an operator in different shifts. In her spare time and during the weekends she earns money cleaning and doing laundry for two women. She has been cleaning their houses for a long time. Her husband works in the auto bodywork business in the Abra area of the city. This couple has three children ages 12, 9 and 5.

Marina has many years of experience in the cleaning business. On the other hand, she has been working at the noodle plant for one year. Her husband has over five years of experience in the auto bodywork business. The competition in the different businesses is significantly high, but the families that hire Marina trust her, which means she always gets work from them. Additionally, her husband's clients know him well and trust him to do a good job.

The loan will be used to purchase tools for modern auto bodywork. Marina has a good credit history and a good payment record.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Marina trabaja en una fabrica de fideos como operaria en diferentes turnos y en los momentos libres y fines de semana se dedica a efectuar labores de limpieza en la casa de dos señoras desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, también en las mismas casas lava ropa. Su esposo es chapero y trabaja en la zona del Abra. Esta pareja tiene tres hijos de 12, 9 y 5 años respectivamente.

En el rubro de limpieza tiene muchos años de experiencia, mientras que en la planta de fideos trabaja desde hace un año, por otra parte su espos tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años en el negocio de la chapería.

La competencia en los diferentes negocios es bastante elevada, pero la confianza de las familias que contratan los servicios de Marina hacen que ella tenga trabajo seguro en estas casas, además que los clientes conocen también muy bien a su esposo y confian en él sus trabajos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de herramientas para la chapería moderna. Marina tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y un buen comportamiento de pagos.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's auto bodywork business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a working mother who fulfills her duties with the same passion with which she operates her general store. She leaves her shop once a month in order to visit the big markets in her city and purchase the products that her customers have requested. She relies on the support of her beloved daughter, who looks after the shop during her mother’s absence. Esperanza wishes to boost her sales by means of increasing her capital with the aim of contributing to the dreams of her beloved daughter and husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ESPERANZA, es una trabajadora madre de familia que desempeña con la misma pasión con la que atiende su hogar en su pequeña bodeguita, mensualmente abandona su espacio de trabajo para acudir a las grandes ferias de su ciudad a comprar lo necesario para abastecer las peticiones de sus clientes y para que el lugar no este desatendido cuenta con la importante ayuda de su querida hija.Tiene deseos de incrementar sus ventas a través de un incremento de su capital de trabajo con el objetivo de contribuir con los sueños de su querida hija y esposo.

loans.use: Increase capital to boost sales

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana has worked breeding animals and cultivating corn since she was very little, thanks to the instruction of her beloved parents. Right now she is waiting for the harvest and has decided to invest a large part of her income into the purchase of a larger crop field on the outskirts of the city. She would like to raise the quality of life for her family. Nevertheless, she has run into difficulties and it's getting harder to realize this dream. For this reason she is asking for your generous support with the aim of finishing what she set out to do.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Fabiana, se dedica a la crianza de animales y al cultivo de maíz, desde muy pequeña gracias a la iniciativa y enseñanza de sus queridos padres. Está en espera de la cosecha y había pensado invertir gran parte de sus ganacias en la compra de un terreno más grande en las afueras de su ciudad para elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia, sin embargo las dificultades se han presentado y estos sueños quizá no se concreten. Por esa razón solicita vuestro noble apoyo a fin de concretar lo que tanto había planificado.

loans.use: To obtain one more crop field

loans.name: Mirian's Group

texts.es:
This committee is comprised of enterprising women and heads of families. Each member carries out an activity in order to increase the total income of their homes; meanwhile, each is a caretaker of their home, a wife and a mother.

Among the activities these women participate in are: selling fast foods and beverages; maintaining food pantries for selling goods; selling from newsstands; selling clothes; and collecting recycling.

At present this committee is in its sixth cycle of the program, which is proof of the sense of responsibility and desire to progress that each one of its members possesses. They are requesting a loan to purchase merchandise and supplies to continue the member’s activities.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité está compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras y cabezas de familias. Todas realizan actividades para poder incrementar el ingreso económico de sus hogares y además de ello son amas de casa, esposas y madres.

Ellas realizan distintos tipos de actividades como venta de comidas rápidas, despensas, kioscos, ventas de bebidas, venta de ropas y reciclaje.

Actualmente este comité se encuentra en el sexto ciclo del programa, en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes. El crédito que ellas solicitan desean invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías e insumos para sus distintas actividades, estos les permitirá seguir progresando cada día mas.

loans.use: To buy meats, dairies, baking products, fruit, vegetables, plastics, cardboards, tshirts, pants, cosmetic, lingerie, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
Raimundo and his beloved wife have immersed themselves in agriculture since they were very young. When they got married and first wanted to start a family they decided that agriculture would be the family's main source of sustenance. Every day they work together with the dream of realizing their children's dreams. They also dream of becoming the best farm workers in the area and have decided to improve their work with better seeds and fertilizers that will help them reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

RAIMUNDO y su querida esposa desde muy pequeños han estado inmersos en las labores agrícolas, cuando decidieron unirse para conformar su propia familia decidieron hacer de esta actividad la principal fuente de su sustento familia. Juntos día a día se desempeñan con el deseo de ayudar a concretar los deseos de sus queridos hijos, también sueñan en convertirse en los mejores agricultores de su zona y han deseado iniciar su labor con la compra de mejores semillas, abonos y fertlizantes que contribuirán a alcanzar la meta que se han trazado.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is married, has two children and lives with her family in her own home. Currently she works with her husband in the Centro de Salud Chilimarca (clinic). Both are employees in this institution.

The loan is to be used to pay off what they owe for the purchase of a property she bought from her father.

Cristina has a good credit history and currently she only has debts with Agrocapital. No other debts appear in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Cristina es una señora casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con su familia en su casa propia. Actualmente trabaja junto a su esposo en el centro de salud de Chilimarca, ambos con empleados dependientes de esta intitución. La solicitud de la presente es para el pago de un saldo que deben por la compra del inmueble a su padre. Cristina tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y actualmente sólo tiene deudas con Agrocapital, no reporta otros en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To pay off a debt for the purchase of a property

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
The committee was formed in July of 2006. The present committee was created by Teresa De Jesus Valiente who heard talk of the “Committee of enterprising women” from some women who had formed the own group.

The present day Committee integrated 16 women from the neighborhood of San Isidro in the city of Lambaré. This program promoted entrepreneurship and solidarity of its members. The committee possesses a savings fund that each of its members contributes to and additionally, each member hosts an activities in order to be able to contribute further to the fund such as hamburger cook-outs, barbeques, and early morning meals.

These ladies, who are also housewives and mothers, are dedicated to an additional activity to generate income for their homes. Among the activities that members of the committee participate in are: selling natural remedies (medicinal plants); jewelry making; clothes making; dressmaking; the sale of fruits, vegetables and fast foods.

The requested loan will be used to purchase merchandise and necessary supplies such as: fabrics, threads, fruits, milk, meat, flour, sugar, oil, eggs, jewels, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

Este Comité se formo en julio del 2006. El contacto con este grupo se realizó a través de la señora Teresa De Jesús Valiente, quien oyó hablar del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” de unas señoras que ya conformaron su propio grupo.

El Comité esta integrado 16 mujeres del barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Lambaré. Este programa ayuda a fomentar el emprendedurismo y la solidaridad de las integrantes. Ellas poseen un fondo de ahorros que cada una aporta y además realizan diferentes actividades extras para aportar a sus ahorros como hamburgueseadas, asados, meriendas etc.

Estas señoras se dedican a diferentes actividades para generar ingresos extras para sus hogares, ya que ellas son amas de casa y madres. Sus actividades son: venta de remedios naturales (plantas medicinales), joyas, ropas, frutas, verduras, comidas rápidas, modistas.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercaderías e insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, frutas, lácteos, carne, harina, azúcar, aceite, huevos, joyas, etc.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase goods and necessary supplies such as: fabrics, threads, fruits, milk, meat, flour, sugar, oil, eggs, jewels, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
I have been running a small cake shop in my home for 2 years. I cannot complain because thank God everything has gone fine. I have several plans in mind, such as purchasing more ingredients and baking pans in order to prepare cakes of different sizes and flavors. Unfortunately, I do not have the capital to carry out my plans. I am requesting $800.00 USD in order to purchase cake ingredients and baking pans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una pequeña pastelería en mi casa desde hace 2 años no me puedo quejar gracias a dios me ha ido bien, tengo varios planes que me gustaría realizar como es la compra de más ingredientes y moldes para preparar pasteles diferentes y de distintos tamaños y sabores, pero no tengo el capital para hacerlo” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para comprar ingredientes y moldes para la preparación de pasteles

loans.use: Invest in cake shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is a beautiful woman who works breeding sheep and chickens in her home. By selling the animals Sonia is able to keep up with her house expenses and her personal necessities. In her picture she is showing us a chicken while she waits for her sheep to return from their monthly visit to the veterinarian. She would like to build a better space for her animals and therefore is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary materials.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Sonia, es una guapa señorita que se dedica desde hace mucho a la crianza de carneritos y gallinitas en su hogar, con la venta de estos puede satisfacer los gastos de su hogar y sus necesidades personales, ahora nos muestra una gallinita mientras espera el retorno de sus carneritos de su visita mensual al veterinarios.Tiene deseos de construir un mejor espacio para su desarrollo y solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales.

loans.use: Construction of a breeding area

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy is a single young man who works in agriculture and animal husbandry. He works so that he can cover his expenses and take care of his mother. He wakes up early every morning to walk through and work his many dispersed crop fields. As all of this walking was exhausting, he decided to buy a mule so that he could travel these long distances and optimize his time. Nevertheless, he still needs to devote more time to the care of his mother. She needs medications for her ailments and the degradation of her health. Fredy wants to increase his crop production with the aim of augmenting his income so that he can better care for his mother. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

FREDY, es un joven soltero que trabaja en la agricultura y en la crianza de animales para poder solventar sus gastos y los de su madre a quien cuida.Es por ello que desde muy temprano sale rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo que tiene en zonas muy distantes y las horas de caminata son cansadas, gracias a que pudo adquirir un caballito se traslada a tan distantes lugares y puede optimizar su tiempo para invertirlo en el cuidado de su anciana madre.Sin embargo su madre necesita mucho más que cuidados, necesita medicamentos para sus dolencias por su resquebrajamiento de su salud y para que Fredy pueda velar por ella quiere aumentar su producción a fin de tener un incremento en sus ingresos. Por ello requiere un préstamo de para la compra de semillas para sus sembríos

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Juana De

texts.es:
Juana is 51 years old and she separated from her husband several years ago. Currently she lives in her own house with one of her daughters who is in her last year of school. Her other daughters have their own families and are independent from her.

Juana has been earning a living selling chicken for over nine years. Two years ago she started selling prepared food as well. Her chicken business is well known in the area, since she is practically the only one with that kind of business. Her food stand is also doing very well, it is located behind a large manufacturing plant in an area where there is a lot of construction work going on, which means she has a lot of customers.

She only has enough money to do small home improvements to her home, such installing a shed, reinforcing the pillars in the walls, etc. She is an old client of the institution, this would be her third loan. With the first loan she was excellent but with the second loan she was late a few times, this is the reason why it was decided to give Juana a second chance with this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Juana de 51 años de edad es una señora sola, separada hace varios años de su esposo, actualmente vive solo con sus hijas en casa propia, una de sus hijas es dependiente aún y esta en último año de colegio, el resto de sus hijas ya tienen sus familias y son independientes. Juana se dedica a la venta de pollo desde hace más de 9 años atrás y hace dos años que vende comida. Su venta de pollo es bastante conocida en su zona, es practicamente la única con ese negocio, la venta de comida es muy buena ya que esta ubicada detrás de una fabrica grande y en una zona donde hay muchas construcciones, por lo que tiene bastante clientela. El dinero sólo le alcanzara para realizar unas pequeñas obras en su casa como poner tinglado y calaminas a la parte donde están sus mesas y reforzar los machones. Es antigua cliente de la institución, este es su tercer crédito. Su comportamiento en el primero fue buenisimo y en el segundo tuvo algunos retrasos, por lo que se dio la oportunidad a doña Juana para este nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Prisciliano

texts.es:
Prisciliano ya tiene un buen dinero ahorrado con el que piensa comprar un terreno, donde futuramente edificara su local de ventas.

Prisciliano C. sells cosmetics. He has been working using credit from the Paraguayan Foundation since 2003. He began as the collector for a cosmetics distributor and little by little he saved to become a seller of cosmetics himself.

Now he has built a large client base and continues to dream of a day when he can guarantee a fixed amount of sales for his business. He visits his clients and this helps him to meet new people that eventually become new clients.

Thanks to the good quality of his products and his friendly demeanor, his clients are satisfied with his products and would like to have a location of his own.

He is always increasing his offerings, thus Prisciliano is seeking a loan to be able to acquire a larger selection of merchandise like body creams, anti-wrinkle aids, makeup, perfume, hair dye, shampoo, salon accessories, brushes etc.

Prisciliano already has money saved with which he can begin to think about buying land to build his store on in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Prisciliano C. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y bajo pedido. Trabaja con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.003. Empezó como cobrador de una empresa distribuidora de cosméticos y poco a poco fue ahorrando para poder dedicarse el mismo a las ventas.

Hoy día tiene una gran clientela formada y sueña con poder contar el día de mañana con un local de ventas fijo. El visita a sus clientes y estos lo ayudan referenciandolo a nuevas personas que luego pasan a ser clientes nuevos.

Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y su amabilidad, sus clientes están bastantes satisfechos con sus productos y lo apoyan para que tenga un local propio.

Como cada vez aumentan más sus pedidos, hoy día, Prisciliano solicita un crédito para poder adquirir un gran lote de mercaderías como cremas para el cuerpo, antiarrugas, maquillajes, perfumes, tintes para cabello, shampoo, accesorios para peluquerías, cepillos, etc.

Prisciliano ya tiene un buen dinero ahorrado con el que piensa comprar un terreno, donde futuramente edificara su local de ventas.

loans.use: To buy goods such as body cream, antiwrinkle creams, makeup, perfume, hair dye, shampoo, accessories for a salon, brushes etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo is 30 years old, single and lives in his family's house. He earns a living selling religious products such as CDs , DVDs, bibles, t-shirts, key chains, etc. He has very little competition in the area, therefore his sales are not affected.

The loan will be used to purchase religious merchandise as well as furniture to display his products. This is his fifth loan with our institution and he has demonstrated to be timely with his payments. Currently he has two credits with other institutions and he pays them in a timely manner as well.

Let it be noted that Guillermo did not want to come out in the picture, therefore only his business was photographed.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermo es soltero y tiene 30 años de edad, y actualmente vive en casa de sus familiares. Se dedica a la venta de artículos religiosos, cd´s, dvd´s, biblias, poleras, llaveros y otros. En la zona tiene muy poca competencia, por lo que su nivel de ventas no se ve afectado. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de articulos religiosos y compra de muebles para la exhibición de sus productos. Esta es la quinta frecuencia con nuestra institución y demostro ser una persoan puntual en sus pagos. Actualmente tiene dos créditos con otras instituciones financieras en las que también tiene un comportamiento regular. Se hace notar que Gillermo no quizo salir en la foto por lo que solo se tomo a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of religious merchandise

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is 50 years old. She makes and sells artisan bread from her home. Her husband is a night watchman for the company Sobolma Ltda. She lives in her own house with husband and their three children, who also contribute to the business.

She has two years of experience working in her bakery, and it is said that the taste and quality is very good. Her location is very good, because there is never a shortage of clients. Plus, her husband has been contributing for various years while working at the company Sobolma Ltd.

There is competition, now that there are other businesses working in the same market, but since bread is a staple of the people there is sufficient demand. On top of that, Felicita has many regular clients.

This credit will be for the purchase of a sewing machine that costs 170usd, and with the rest flower, sugar, lard, and jars. This is the third time Felicita has borrowed with the institution, and almost all loans were repaid perfectly with the exception of one group loan with another financial organization will be canceling that agreement.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Felicita de 50 años de edad elabora y comercializa pan casero en su propio domicilio de forma artesanal. Su esposo se desempeña como sereno en la empresa SOBOLMA LTDA. Felicita vive en su casa que es propia jusnto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, quines la colaboran en su negocio. Tiene una experiencia de dos aos en el negocio de la panadería, por lo cual se considera que sabe acerca del mismo además que la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, como también la ubicación con la que cuenta es estratégica ya que no le falta clientela. Por otra parte su esposo trabaja hace varios años en la empresa SOBOLMA LTDA. La competencia se podría decir que es mediana ya que también hay otros negocios que se desempeñan en el mismo rubro, pero el pan a ser un artículo de primera necesidad es bastante demandado, además que Felicita cuenta con clientela fija. El presente crédito es para comprar una máquina de costura que tiene un valor de $us. 170.- y con el resto comprará harina, azúcar y manteca por QQ y latas para tener stock. Esta es la tercera secuencia con la institución y casi todos fueron pagados excelentemente a excepción de uno pequeño que corresponde a un crédito grupal en otra institución financiera que recién lo cancelará.

loans.use: Capital for investment in Bakery

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is 51 years old. He makes a living making and selling french fries on his motor bike.

He has four children that are in school, and his wife helps him with his french fries business.

Florentino rents his 4-wheeler and his motorcycle. He’s been making french fries for over 12 years, and he has seen both the competition and the demand rise over the years.

This loan is for the purchase of a motor whose price can vary. This will be Florentino’s fifth solicitation from our institution and he has had an excellent credit history and repayment of his loans.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Florentino tiene 51 años de edad y obtiene ingresos de una vagoneta, de la renta de una moto, y de la elaboración y comercialización de papas fritas. Tiene cuatro hijos que actualmente están estudiando y su esposa le ayuda con el negocio de las papas fritas. Florentino tiene una vagoneta que la trabaja en la línea de transportes FLORIDA de la cuál le pagan una renta diaria, también recibe una renta por el alquiler de su motocicleta. El negocio de las papas fritas tiene una antiguedad de más de 12 años respectivamente, y si bien la competencia es elevada la demanda por este tipo de producto es igual. El presente crédito es para la compra de un motor cuyo precio varia de acuerdo a las exigencias del mercado. El presente crédito es la quinta solicitud de Florentino en nuestra institución y demostró tener un excelente cumplimiento en todos sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of a motor

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastasio is 51 years old. He operates a sheering machine at the company SOBOLMA Ltd. He also does landscaping and gardening, and he also receives income from renting parts of his house.

He lives in his house with his wife and two children in the town of San Antonio in the South West of Warnes.

He has worked for many years with the aforementioned company, and also has a lot of experience with his other jobs which he is centered around.

There is practically no competition given that he is a fixed worker and dependant. There is no shortage of renters, and the landscaping is something he can always do in his spare time. In any matter, these activities highly contribute to his income. With this solicitation Anastasio will acquire construction materials to make expansions to his home, buy bricks, tiles, cement, sand, and other materials.

This is his third loan with our institution and has always demonstrated himself as being responsible and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Anastacio de 51 años de edad es operador de guillotina a pedal en SOBOLMA LTDA. y paralelamente realiza trabajos de jardineria y también recibe una renta mensual por el alquiler de su casa. Actualmente vive en su casa propia del barrio San Antonio en la zon sur oeste de Warnes junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Anastacio trabaja desde hace varios años atrás en la empresa anteriormente mencionada y también tiene bastante experiencia en sus otras actividades por lo que siempre se encentra traajando. La competencia practicamente es nula ya que es un trabajador fijo y dependiente, no le faltan inquilinos para su casa y en cuanto a la jardinería sólo le dedica sus tiempos libres, pero de igual manera estas actividades contribuyen de manera importante a su economía. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá materiales de construcción para ampliar su vivienda, comprará ladrillo, teja, cemento, arena y otros. El presente es el tercer crédito en nuestra institución y siempre demostro ser responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Remberto

texts.en:
Remberto is 46 years old. He with his wife and 3 children live in a house located on Cuellar final Street, to the South West of Warnes. This house still is not registered to his name.

Remberto works as a lumber in a sawmill for tree trunks and wood. He has a lot of experience in this field, and as a result he has 2 chainsaws. His wife is a co-applicant for this loan and would like to open a small bakery run out of their home.

Remberto’s competition is small, since there are not many people who do what he does. On the other hand the bakery has more competition, but the family is very well known in the area.

They want to buy a new oven with the capacity of six trays, and a container all for the price of $210usd. The remaining money will go towards the wholesale purchase of flower, sugar, lard, and other goods that will be required. This is the third loan Remberto is making with our institution and has repaid all of them on time. He has no other loans out at this time.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Remberto es un señor de 46 años de edad que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la calle Cuellar final, al suroeste de Warnes junto a su esposa y tres hijos, este inmueble que habitan aún no se encuentra registrado a su nombre. Remberto se desempeña como motosierrista de madera en un aserradero de troncas o maderas, actividad en la cual tiene muchos años de experiencia, para este efecto cuenta con dos motosierras. Su esposa que es la codeudora quiere implementar una pequeña panadería artesanal en su domicilio. La competencia para Remberto es baja ya que no hay muchas personas que se dediquen a esta actividad, por otra parte la panadería tendrá más competencia pero como la famili es bastante conocida en la zona contarán con el apoyo de los mismos habitantes. Compraran un horno nuevo con capacidad de seis latas y una garrafa todo al precio de $us. 210.- el dinero restante será para comprar por mayor harina, azúcar, manteca y otros insumos que vayan a requerir. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Remberto en nuestra institución y todos los préstamos los canceló de manera puntual y no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Operating capital for a bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seafood wholesale

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura has belonged to the Ccori Soncco Communal Bank, which means Heart of Gold, for 12 years. The bank has taught her to be punctual, responsible, to love her fellow members and to live better in her home.

Maura is married, 62 years old and has 10 children, six of whom still live with her. She runs a convenience store out of her home, selling vegetables, groceries and meats for many years. On Sundays she sells Mondongo, a popular regional dish, and also prepares meals for different events.

Maura needs a loan of 2000 soles ($725), which she will use to purchase rice, oil, noodles, beans, sugar, treats and meats. She will use her earnings for her children's education and to save for an emergency.

Maura's dreams are to have a nice home, enlarge her store and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maura pertenece al Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa “Corazón de Oro” hace 12 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser puntual, responsable, quererse entre las socias y a vivir mejor en el hogar.

Maura es casada, tiene 62 años y 10 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con ella, Maura tiene una bodega en su casa, donde vende verduras, abarrotes, carnes, actividad que realiza hace muchos años. Además Maura los días domingos vende Mondongo ( comida típica de la región), también brinda servicio de preparación de comida para diferentes compromisos.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, menestras, azúcar, golosinas y carnes.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijos y para alguna emergencia. Los sueños de Maura son tener una casa bonita, ampliar su bodega y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, noodles, beans, sugar, treats and meats / Maura necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, menestras, azúcar, golosinas y carnes.

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.es:
Felicitas, Rufina and Maribel belong to the Future communal bank, where they learned to be punctual and how to save.

Felicitas is married, 69 years old and has five children. She makes clothing typical of the region such as blouses and long skirts, which she sells at the local fair. She also runs a convenience store out of her home.

Rufina is married, 50 years old and has seven children, four of whom still live with her. She sells vegetables at the local market. On Sundays, she goes to the fairs in the region to purchase grains to sell at market.

Maribel is single and 24 years old. She travels to the regional fairs to purchase grains to sell at the Santa Clara market. She also sells natural medicines via catalogue. She also recently started breeding hamsters.

Felicitas, Rufina and Maribel needs loans of 1000 soles ($375), 1000 soles and 600 soles ($200), which they will use to purchase fabrics, milk, sugar, noodles, cookies, corn, grains and natural medicines.

Felicitas, Rufina and Maribel dream of seeing their children become successful, of expanding their businesses and having their own stores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel pertenecen al Banco Comunal Futuro, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales y a ahorrar.

Felicitas es casada, tiene 69 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas confecciona ropa típica D. la región como centros, blusas, fustanes, que los venD. en la feria D. Las Nazarenas. Además Felicitas tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Rufina es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Rufina venD. verduras en el mercado 12 D. abril. Además Rufina los días domingos viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales y los venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Maribel es soltera y tiene 24 años, Maribel viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales y lo venD. en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Maribel venD. medicinas naturales por catálogos. Maribel recientemente comenzó a criar cuyes.

Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. telas, leche, azúcar, fideo, galletas, maíz, linaza, quinua y medicinas naturales.

Los sueños D. Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio más granD., un local propio y tener una granja D. cuyes.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, milk, sugar, noodles, cookies, corn, grains and natural medicines / Felicitas, Rufina y Maribel necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, leche, azúcar, fideo, galletas, maíz, linaza, quinua y medicinas naturales.

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.es:
Máxima, Marina and Teofila have belonged to the Future communal bank for three, two and two years, respectively.

Máxima is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She sells groceries at a post in the local market. She also sells maize liquor that she makes herself.

Marina is single and 19 years old. She sells bananas wholesale at the Nery García market. She buys her products in the Ayacuchana forest, where she also sells fish.

Teofila is a 47-year-old married mother of two. She travels to the different fairs in the region to purchase grains, small animals and cheese to seel at the Nery García market. She also breeds the animals.

Måxima, Marina and Teofila need loans of 600 soles ($225), 600 soles and 1000 soles ($350) to purchase soft drinks, milk, noodles, sugar, honeycomb, fish, bananas and cattle.

Máxima and Teofila dream of building their own home, that their children get a good education and that their businesses improve, while Marina wants to work with Kiva partner Finca and study to earn a degree.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Máxima, Marina y Teofila pertenecen al Banco Comunal Futuro hace 3, 2, 2 años respectivamente.

Máxima es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Máxima vende abarrotes en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril. Además Máxima vende chicha que ella misma prepara.

Por otro lado Marina es soltera y tiene 19 años, Marina vende plátanos por mayor en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra en la selva Ayacuchana. Además Marina vende pescado en la selva ayacuchana.

Mientras que Teofila es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Teofila viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compra cereales, animales menores, quesos, productos que vende en el mercado Nery García. Además Teofila se dedica a la crianza de animales.

Máxima, Marina y Teofila necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, leches, fideo, azúcar, pañales, pescado, plátano y ganado vacuno.

Los sueños de Máxima y Teofila son construir su casa, que sus hijos estudien, que sus negocios mejoren, mientras que Marina desea trabajar en Finca y estudiar una carrera.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, milk, noodles, sugar, fish, bananas, and cattle / Máxima, Marina y Teofila necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, leches, fideo, azúcar, pañales, pescado, plátano y ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.es:
Rosa Clelia and Ana have belonged to the Ccori Soncco communal bank, which means "Heart of Gold", for 13, one and eight years respecitively.

Rosa is a 53-year-old single mother of one son. She travels to the different fairs in the region to purchase cheese, small animals and grains to sell at the local market. She also does weavings with her son, making items like tapestries and blankets.

Clelia is a 38-year-old single mother of two. She sells clothing and shoes by order, brining in the merchandise from Lima.

Ana is a 29-year-old widow and mother of two. She sells meat at a post in the local market and also sells to restaurants and other districts. She buys the animals at the regional fairs and sometimes in Lima.

Rosa, Clelia and Ana need loans of 1000 soles ($350), 600 soles ($225) and 1200 soles ($425) to purchase wool, thread, wheat, barley, cheese, undergarments and pork.

Rosa, Clelia and Ana dream of improving and expanding their businesses, having their own homes and getting their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa, Clelia y Ana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa “Corazón de Oro” hace 13, 1, 8 años respectivamente.

Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 53 años y 1 hijo, Rosa viaja a las ferias donde compra queso, animales menores, cereales y lo vende en el mercado Grau. Además Rosa junto a su hijo realizan tejidos en telar como tapices, frazadas.

Por otro lado Clelia es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Clelia vende ropa y zapatos a pedidos, su mercadería lo trae de la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Ana es viuda, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Ana vende carne en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco, también reparte a los restaurantes y distritos cercanos, los animales los compra en las ferias y algunas veces en la ciudad de Lima.

Rosa, Clelia y Ana necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilo, trigo, cebada, queso, ropas interiores, cerdo.

Los sueños de Rosa, Clelia y Ana son mejorar su negocio de artesanía y vender a otros mercados, tener casa propia y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase wool, thread, wheat, barley, cheese, undergarments and pork / Rosa, Clelia y Ana necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilo, trigo, cebada, queso, ropas interiores, cerdo.

loans.name: Gladiz Maruja's Group

texts.es:
Maruja, Gloria and Olga belong to the Pampachacra communal bank and are from the community of the same name.

Maruja is a 41-year-old single mother with one son. She has a small convenience store in the community.

Gloria is married, 32 years old and has five children. With the loan, she plans to start breeding small animals.

Olga is a 44-year-old single mother of two. She buys and sells tara (a native plant), sows and tuna in her community.

Maruja, Gloria and Olga dream of having their own homes, to have a bigger business and for their children to get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maruja, Gloria y Olga pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pampachacra, ellas son de la comunidad de Pampachacra, distrito de Quinua.

Maruja es madre soltera, tiene 41 años y 1 hijo, Maruja tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad.

Por otro lado Gloria es casada, tiene 32 años y 5 hijos, Gloria con el préstamo que obtendrá comenzara con la crianza de animales menores.

Mientras que Olga es madre soltera, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Olga compra y vende tara, cochinilla y tuna en su misma comunidad.

Maruja, Gloria y Olga necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, tara, cochinilla y para implementar su pequeña granja.

Los sueños de Maruja, Gloria y Olga son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, tener casa propia, tener un negocio más grande y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Maruja, Gloria and Olga need loans to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks, tara (a native plant), sows, and to start a small farm / Maruja, Gloria y Olga necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, tara, cochinilla y para implementar su pequeña granja.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabrina has belonged to the Wiñarisun communal bank, which means "We grow" in Quechua, for three years. She is 46 years old, married and has six children. She sells meat at a post in the centeral market Monday-Saturday, and on Sundays she travels to the different fairs in the region to purchase her animals.

Sabrina needs a loan of 2000 soles ($750) to invest in the purchase of cattle. She will use her earnings to feed her children and pay for their education. Her dreams are for her children to be successful, to improve her business and to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sabina pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa “Crezcamos” en quechua hace 3 años.

Sabina es casada, tiene 46 años y 6 hijos, Sabina venD. carne en un puesto del mercado Central, actividad que realiza D. lunes a sábado, los días domingos junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. compran los animales.

Sabina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para la educación y alimentación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. Sabina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: Purchase cattle / Sabina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Since she was young, Rosalba has successfully sold cosmetic products for several different brands. On marrying, she devoted herself to this activity due to the need to help her husband with household expenses and to pay for the education of their two children. Additionally, since her youngest daughter was born she hasn't wanted to find work which would absorb a lot of her time, so she dedicated herself to increasing sales.

Now she needs a loan of US $750 which she will repay in four months in order to pay for a batch of merchandise which they have already provided. Let us help Rosalba by contributing economically to her case.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba se dedica a vender productos cosméticos desde joven viene haciéndolo exitosamente para diferentes líneas. Al casarse se dedico arduamente a esta actividad por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto de la casa a su esposo y para solventar la educación de sus 2 hijos, además de que al nacer su ultima hija ya no quiso seguir trabajando en algo que le absorbiera mucho tiempo por lo cual se dedico de lleno a las ventas.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $750 que pagara en 4 meses para pagar un lote de mercancía que ya le surtieron. Ayudemos a Rosalba contribuyendo económicamente a su caso.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has belonged to the Wiñarisun Communal Bank ("We Grow" in Quechua) for 10 years. She is a 47-year-old single mother of two boys. She sells clothes at the Sunday market in her neighborhood. She also has a store where she has sold groceries, fruits and vegetables for three years.

Reyna is requesting a loan of 2000 soles ($725), which she will use to purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk. Her earnings will go toward building a home and caring for her youngest son.

Reyna's dreams are to build a home, enlarge her business and that her children are better off than she is.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa “Crezcamos” en quechua hace 10 años.

Reyna es madre soltera, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos varones, vive en el distrito de Quinua, Reyna vende ropa en la feria dominical de su distrito. Además Reyna tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza hace 3 años.

Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, leche.
