Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la construcción de su casa y para los gastos de su hijo menor. Los sueños de Reyna son construir su casa, que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk / Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, leche.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina has belonged to the Wiñarisun Communal Bank ("We Grow" in Quechua) for 10 years. She is 45 years old, married and has five children. She sells meat at the center market in Ayacucho, Peru; she purchases the animals at the different fairs in the region.

Catalina needs a loan of 3000 soles ($1,075), which she will use to purchase goats, cattle and pigs. Her earnings will go toward her children's education.

Catalina's dreams are for her children to be successful, her business to prosper and to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Catalina pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa “Crezcamos” en quechua hace 10 años.

Catalina es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Catalina vende carne en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los compra en las diferentes ferias de la región.

Catalina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino, vacuno y porcino.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Catalina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea prospero y mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Purchase goats, cattle and pigs / Catalina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino, vacuno y porcino.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela M. has always been a very hard-working woman: after separating from her husband she had to find an activity which would generate income but at the same time permit her to care for her children who today are 9 and 7 years old as she had no one else who could look after them. The solution was to start a business in her house selling stationery and hiring a computer. The result of this first effort was that she stocked more merchandise: additionally, she now also has a cyber cafe installed in the same location.

She is asking for a loan of $750 dollars that she will repay in 4 months to invest in her business buying merchandise. With your contributions Adela will continue generating income which will allow her to maintain her children.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Adela M. siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora después de separarse de su esposo tuvo que encontrar una actividad que le generara ingresos pero que a la vez le permitiera cuidar a sus hijos que actualmente tienen 9 y 7 años, ya que en ese entonces no tenia quien se los cuidara fue que inicio un negocio en su casa vendiendo papelería y rentando una computadora. a base de esfuerzo fue que surtió mas mercancía, ahora además de esto cuenta con un ciber café en las mismas instalaciones.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $750 que pagara en 4 meses para invertirlos en su negocio comparando mercancía. Con tus aportaciones Adela seguirá generando ingresos que le permitan mantener a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel T. sells clothes and shoes. He is married and the father of three children aged 7, 11 and 13. He decided start-up a business because in the place where he used to work he used to earn very little and it was insufficient to cover the family's expenses: it was for this reason that he decided to sell clothes and shoes. His initial idea was to sell in rotating markets, but with the lack of a vehicle to transport his stock he instead set-up outside his mother's house because it was located at a good place to catch passing trade. For the last year he has also sold outside his own house.

He now needs a loan of US $475 which he will repay in six months in order to buy stock and to increase his sales as he also has an ambition to establish another business selling food. With your help, Miguel will be able to make his dreams come true.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Miguel Ángel T. se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, es casado y padre de familia de 3 hijos de 7, 11 y 13 años. El decide hincar un negocio porque en el lugar donde trabajaba ganaba muy poco y no era suficiente para solventar los gastos de su familia; fue entonces que decide vender ropa y zapatos su idea inicial era hacerlo en mercados rodantes pero como carecía de un vehiculo para transporta la mercancía fue que se instalo afuera de la casa de su mama porque se ubicaba en un buen punto de trafico de gente, y desde hace un año lo hace también en las afueras de su casa.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ventas ya que tiene como meta poner otro negocio de venta de comida. Con tu ayuda Miguel podrá realizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aurelia's Group

texts.es:
Odilia, Diana and Aurelia have belonged to the Ccori Soncco Communal Bank ("Heart of Gold") for two years, four months and seven years, respectively.

Odilia is 44 years old, married and has four children. She sells cheese at wholesale and retail at the local market. She purchases her products in the town of Alpachaca, where she also buys clothing, fruits and vegetables.

Diana is a 20-year-old single mother of one daughter. She makes traditional breads of the region in her parents' oven and sells it to stores.

Aurelia is 59 years old, married and has three children. She travels to the different fairs in the region to purchase cheese and small animals and sells them door to door in the city of Ayacucho.

Odilia, Diana and Aurelia need loans of 1000 soles ($400) apiece, which they will use to purchase cheese, gruits, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, lard and small animals.

Odilia, Diana and Aurelia dreams are to see their children be successful, enlarge their business and own a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Odilia, Diana y Aurelia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa “Corazón de Oro” hace 2 años, 4 meses, 7 años respectivamente.

Odilia es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos, Odilia vende quesos al por mayor y menor en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra en la comunidad de Alpachaca, donde vende ropa, frutas, verduras.

Por otro lado Diana es madre soltera, tiene 20 años y 1 hija, Diana elabora panes típicos de la zona, actividad que realiza en el horno de sus padres, sus productos los reparte a tiendas.

Mientras que Aurelia es casada, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Aurelia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compra queso, animales menores y lo vende caminando de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Odilia, Diana y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, frutas, azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina, manteca y animales menores.

Los sueños de Odilia, Diana y Aurelia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio más grande y una panadería.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, gruits, sugar, noodles, rice, flour, lard and small animals / Odilia, Diana y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, frutas, azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina, manteca y animales menores.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.es:
Sofía, Angélica and Victoria have belonged to the Ccori Soncco Communal Bank ("Heart of Gold") for one, one and two years respectively.

Sofía is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She travels to the regional fairs once a week to sell fruits and purchase grains and potatoes to sell at the local market.

Angélica is 34 years old, married and has three children. She travels to the fairs to sell fruits and vegetables, and to purchase grains to sell at the local market.

Victoria is 35 years old, married and has four children. She sells vegetables at retail in the local market.

Sofía, Angélica and Victoria need loans of 600 soles ($350 approx.), 800 soles ($500), and 600 soles, respectively, which they will use to purchase bananas, oranges, grains, rice, sugar, oil, salt, cilantro and spinach.

The dreams of Sofía, Angélica and Victoria are to build a home, enlarge their business and for their children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sofía, Angélica y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa “Corazón D. Oro” hace 1, 1, 2 años respectivamente.

Sofía es casada, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Sofía viaja a L. feria una vez por semana donD. venD. frutas y D. L. feria compra cereales, papa, productos que venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Por otro lado Angélica es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Angélica viaja a las ferias donD. venD. verduras, frutas y en las ferias compra cereales que venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Victoria es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Victoria venD. verduras por menor en el mercado Nery García.

Sofía, Angélica y Victoria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. plátano, naranja, cereales, arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, culantro y espinaca.

Los sueños D. Sofía, Angélica y Victoria son construir su casa, tener negocios más grandes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, oranges, grains, rice, sugar, oil, salt, cilantro and spinach / Sofía, Angélica y Victoria necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano, naranja, cereales, arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, culantro y espinaca.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Mrs. Saron T., 56 years old, is married with four children. Two of her children are working, and one attends school while the other stays at home. Saron is a subsistence farmer growing vegetables throughout the year in Rotheng Village in Kandal Province. She usually works on a field with her husband, Chieng Eourng, who is on the left in the picture. As cultivatable land is becoming rarer and less fertile, she wants to access a loan of $275 to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and more vegetable seeds to support her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un S., age 60 is a widow with four children. She works as a housewife, and looks after the children and cooks food for the family members. Her daughter, Ms. Son Chanmarina (pictured here), age 30, works as a hair dresser in Phnom Penh. She earns about $10 per day. Two daughters help Ms. Son Chanmarina in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Un S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase hair dressing tools for her daughter. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy a grinding mill. She will hire local people to run this machine and earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase hair dressing tools and a grinding mill

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men H., age 39, has five children. She owns a plot of farmland and grows rice. Usually, she earns about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kok Tin, works raises ducks. Every day he sells the eggs at the market, and earns approximately $3 a day. Two children help their mother, and the others are students.

To expand the business, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more ducks to raise and more food for the ducks. This will allow all the ducks to grow very quickly and produce eggs every day.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise and more food for the ducks

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom S., age 26, has a Karaoke bar at her house. She also sells a variety of soft drinks and some food to the customers who come to sing a song. She earns about $5 a day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver around the market close to thier house. Usually, he earns a profit of about $4 a day. They have one child.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to start a new business to earn more to support the family. She plans to purchase cashew nuts in bulk and and resell them for profit. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy speakers to use at the Karaoke bar.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts in bulk to resell, and purchase speakers for the Karaoke bar

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Mrs. Kam S., age 58, collects firewood and sells it to the local people in the village. She earns approximately $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chem Sart, age 68, is a chief in the community and also owns a plot of farmland where he grows rice. He earns around $1.50 a day.

Three children live away home, and two are garment workers, who each earn $60 a month. The other children are students. (Mrs. Kam S. and her daughter are pictured here.)

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for their children to commute to work and reduce daily expenses. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to buy wood to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commute and repair house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mrs. Hout N., age 55, has three children, and sells corn in her village. She earns about $5 a day. Her husband supplements the family’s income working as a police officer; he makes $2 a day.
Ms. N. is requesting a loan from Kiva to combine with their savings to purchase wood to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair the house

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep T., age 39, lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells fruit in a busy market and earns a profit of approximately $4 a day. Her husband is a government official and earns $150 a month. Their chilren are all students.

To help increase the family's income, Mrs. T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more fruit to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell in the market

loans.name: Yom

texts.en: Mrs. Yom V. was born in 1956 and now lives in Prek Rung Village in Kandal Province. She is a fish seller in a market next to the village, usually earning around $2 a day, and a single mother with two children, one of whom works in a factory while the other helps her at the market. In order to improve her living conditions, Yom is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish to resell at the market.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S., 33, is a mother of two children, who are students. Mrs. S. sells fruit in a busy market, and she earns around $2 a day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. Usually he earns a profit of about $4 a day. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn E., born in 1954 and a single mother with four children, sells water lilies in a local village, Tropeng Sva in Kandal Province. Two of her children are garment factory workers, while the others are too young to attend school or work. In order to improve her living conditions, she is requesting a loan of $400 to buy a cow to raise for breeding.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  a cow.

loans.name: Antigua Altagracia's Group

texts.en:
Antigua Altagracia is a proud mother of two boys, aged 25 and 17, both studying at the university. Her husband works as an independent taxi driver. To supplement the family revenue and support her boys’ studies, Antigua sells clothing to men and women in the Libertador community of Santo Domingo. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan, together with four other women who know each other and have been executing small projects jointly. With her loan, Antigua will buy more clothing in bulk to keep satisfying her customers’ needs and improve her family’s lifestyle.

Antigua Altagracia’s group members are: Claudia P. M., a fellow entrepreneur who sells silver jewelry; Valentina E. F., who wishes to expand her business of selling men’s clothing; María D. R. M., who operates a small silver jewelry business, and Socorro Trinidad A., who will purchase beauty products to resell in the community.

loans.use: Funds will be invested to purchase clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Bhyanti

texts.en:
Bhyanti Dongol lives in Khokhana, Lalitpur, with her husband and two children. Her son is studying in grade 10 and her daughter in grade 8. Her husband, Mr Sankha lal Dongol, is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables on his farm and sells them in the local market in the mornings and evenings each day. The economic condition of the family is not good because Mr Dongol's income is insufficient to fulfill the family's needs, so Mrs Dongol decided to utilize her free time by raising goats. At present she has seven goats. She sells their milk in the local market.

Now she wants to buy a few more goats to meet the increasing demand for milk, and to that end she is requesting a loan of Rs15000.00 ($250).

loans.use: To buy five more goats.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very energetic and hard-working entrepreneur and the proud mother of a unique four-year-old daughter. She is also the leader of a group of five women who carry on various businesses in the community. Elizabeth has been selling tennis equipment and shoes for more than three years in the Libertador community of Santo Domingo, and since moving into a small store, she has been able to increase her customer base significantly. With her loan, Elizabeth is hoping to introduce a new line of fashionable tennis equipment in order to attract new people to her business.

Elizabeth’s group members are: Rosa J. B., who plans to expand a beauty products store; Ercilia Del Carmen G. P., who will buy more shoes for her business; Amantina Nieve S., who will acquire women’s clothing for her small business, and Jenny C. J., who will purchase silver jewelry to resell in her community.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and tennis equipment for a small business.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Mrs Pramila Dongol lives in Khokhana, Lalitpur. Khokhana is one of the more underdeveloped villages of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs D. lives with her husband and one son, who is studying in grade 4.

Mrs D. and her husband, Mr Ramesh Dongol, started idol making work five years ago. They make different types of gods’ idols and sell them in the local market. In their area the demand for idols is increasing constantly, so to meet the demand they need to invest in their work. Mrs Dongol is requesting a Rs 10000.00 ($US175) loan to buy raw materials such as waxes and bronze for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her craft work.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju L. is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and husband. Her husband is a taxi driver and her father-in-law works in a small hotel. Mrs L. is a shopkeeper.

Mrs L. opened her grocery shop two years ago to increase the quality of life of her family. She sells a variety of grocery items. She wants to further expand her business so she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to buy necessary grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu L. lives with her husband Mr Chakra Bahadur L. and their three children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Her two daughters are studying in grades 8 and 2 respectively and her son is in primary school.

Mrs L. opened her small business two years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her shop. In particular she makes Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee. The demand for food is increasing in her area, so Mrs L. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($175) to buy necessary ingredients for her shop.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her work.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs Sarita L. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur with her husband and their daughter. Her husband's name is Dorja L.. He is a taxi driver in Kathmandu valley. Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs L. is a grocery shopkeeper. She opened her shop two years ago to support her husband and improve the economic condition of her family. Due to a lack of money she can’t expand her business, so she is requesting Rs10000.00 ($US175) to buy grocery items such as rice, maize, paddy and so on. She wants to use her income to provide a good education for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Mrs Santi T. lives with her husband, Bhim Bahadur T. and two children in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in businesses like grocery shops, utensil shops and so on. Her husband is a taxi driver, while both her daughter and son are studying in primary school.

Mrs T. opened a grocery shop a year ago, where she sells different types of items. Due to a lack of funds she can’t buy goods for her shop, so she is asking for her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($175) to buy goods like rice, dal and noodles. She spends her income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Susila

texts.en:
Mrs Susila L. lives in Sanepa, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. Susila L. is a newly married woman and lives with her husband, Mr. Amir Gurung, who is a taxi driver.

Susila L. is a grocery shopkeeper. She opened her shop a year ago, to support her husband, and there she sells different types of items.

In Sanepa the demand for grocery goods is increasing due to the migration of people from villages. So Mrs L. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to buy items to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her store.

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs Krishna Kumari M. lives in a single family in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. Mrs. M. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband's name is Sakundas M. and he works as a gardener. Her sons are studying in grade 12 and 11 respectively. Her husband's income is not enough to support the family and to provide education for their children. To upgrade the living standard of her family, Mrs M. opened a grocery shop a year ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize and cold drinks.

She is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Rajya Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Rajya laxmi S. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, Raju S., and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Mrs. S. and her husband opened a grocery shop seven years ago. They sell different types of grocery items in their shop, but due to a lack of funds they cannot purchase enough goods. So to expand their business Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to buy grocery items. The shop is their only source of income and both of them work very hard to make their business a success. Mrs. S. wants to provide a better education for her daughter with their increased income

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina Dongol is a 32 year-old lady who lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Hari D. and their son. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son is studying in grade 9. Her husband's income is not sufficient to run her family smoothly. In order to upgrade their living standard she opened her grocery shop a year ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize and biscuits in her shop.

Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($US175) to expand her business. She wants to add new varieties of grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To expand the range of grocery items in her shop.

loans.name: Nani Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Nani Maiya D. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Ashukazi D. and three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her daughter is studying in grade 12, her sons are studying in grades 9 and 8 respectively.

Mrs. D. opened a grocery shop six months ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good, and it is hard to provide a good education for her sons because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. That's why she opened the shop.

Due to a lack of funds she can’t buy goods for her shop. So she has applied for her first loan of Rs 10000 ($US175) to buy goods such as rice, dal, noodles, and so on. She wants to provide a better education for her children and to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Sareourn

texts.en: Mrs. Sareourn P., 35, who lives in Tropeng Sva in Kandal Province, Cambodia, is the married mother of three children, all of whom are too young to work or attend school. She is a "middle man" who usually buys fish to resell in the local market, generating an income of around $2 per day; her husband, Mr. Chom Orm, a wedding chef, typically earns around $2 a day. Sareourn would now like to request a loan of $400 to buy more rice to support the whole family.

loans.use: To buy more rice to support the whole family.

loans.name: Qamar Din

texts.en: Qamar Din lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with his family. He has a retail shop where he works part time. He has a large number of clients and so he is requesting an individual loan to buy extra goods like rice, oil, baskets, shampoo and sweets to enlarge his shop. He wants to make a good monthly income to help his family and make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To buy extra goods such as rice, oil, baskets, shampoo and sweets for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ourk

texts.en: Mrs. Ourk P. is a subsistence farmer and fish seller in Kompong Por Village, Cambodia. She is 37 years old and the mother of a child enrolled in a local school. Her husband, Ra Chhay, is a fisherman who typically earns about $3.50 a day. Additionally, Mrs. Ourk usually works on a cultivatable field which is next to the village.  In oder to make her land more fertile, Mrs. Ourk requests a loan of $175 to buy fertilizer and fuel for her pump.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her pump.

loans.name: Love

texts.en: Love O. is 38 years old. She lives in Benin City and is married with 6 children. She sells local gin (Ogogoro). She is asking for a loan of $875 to buy more local gin (Ogogoro) for sale. She learned this business for 2 weeks and has been in the business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy more local gin (Ogogoro) for sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is 21 years old. She lives in Benin City, and she is single. She sells phone accessories & drinks. She is asking for a loan of $450 to buy more phone accessories & drinks for sale. She learned this business for 3 months and has been in it since 2006.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories & drinks for sale

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en: Mrs. Soklim L. was born in 1977 and now lives in Kompong Por Village, Cambodia.  Married with five children, three of whom attend school while the others stay at home, Soklim works as a fish seller in a local village. Mr. Chamreon, her husband, is a fisherman and works with her. She now hopes to purchase a motorbike to travel to the next village to sell fish. In order to buy it, however, she needs a loan of $425.  Soklim thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Basil

texts.en: Basil E. is 53 years old. He lives in Benin City; he is married with 9 children. He sells bolts, nuts & pure water. He is asking for a loan of $600 to buy more bolts, nuts & pure water for sale. He learned this business for 7 years and has been in business since 1979.

loans.use: To buy more bolts, nuts & pure water for sale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel E. is 42 years old. He lives in Benin City; he is married with 5 children. He sells and services gas and electric cookers. He is soliciting for a loan of $875 to buy more gas and electric cookers to sell at his business. He learned how to do this business for a year, and has had his own business since 1993.

loans.use: To buy more gas & electric cookers for sale

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul A. is 32 years old. He lives in Benin City and he is single. He repairs phones and also sells phone accessories. He is soliciting a the loan of $450 to buy more phone accessories for sale. He learned this business for 6months and has been in business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories for sale

loans.name: George

texts.en: George N. is 43 years old. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria where he is married  with one child. He produces bricks He is soliciting for a loan of $875 to buy more materials for production of bricks for sale. He learned this business for 18months and has been in business since 1992.

loans.use: To buy materials for production of brick for sale

loans.name: Jan Agha

texts.en:
Jan Agha lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He was in Iran for about eight years; when he came back one year ago he opened a retail shop. Through this business he is helping his family, but he wants to help more, so he has decided to expand his business.

He requests an individual loan to expand his stock to attract more clients, to make a better income to help his family. He and his family are happy that he has the opportunity to further his business.

loans.use: To expand his stock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth Ebote is 45 years old of age, married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City with her family where she sells her pineapples, a trade she learned for 6 months before she started her business in 1981. She has very little  money to run her business hence she needs a loan of $525 to expand her business. She has been with LAPO for 4 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence E. is 40 years of age, married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City where she sells wine to those in her community. She needs a loan of $875 to boost her business. She learned the business for 6months and started hers in 2006. She has been borrowing and repaying loans from LAPO for 4 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more wine for sale

loans.name: Martins

texts.en: Mr. Martins N. is 31 years old and lives in Benin City. He is still single and deals in furniture decoration (Glass Tables & Shelves). He learned his kind of business for 7 years from his Uncle and started his own business in 2003. He needs a loan of $875  to buy more furniture decoration for sale. This will enable him meet the demand of his costumers. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more furniture decorations for sale

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina E. S. is 38 years of age. She is married with 4 children and  lives in Benin City where she sells female shoes, bags & clothes. She learned this business for 4 years and started her own business in 1996. She needs a loan of $1200 to enable her buy more female shoes, bags & clothes for sale. She has been with LAPO for 2 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more female shoes, bags & clothes for sale

loans.name: Roe

texts.en: Rose I. is 28 years of age.  She is single and leaves in Benin City. She deals in the sales of provisions and cosmetics for a living, This is a business she learnedfor 5 years from her friend. She started her own business in 2005. She needs a loan of $875 to enable her buy more provisions and cosmetics for sale. She has been in LAPO for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy E. is 41 years of age.  She is a widow with 3 children, and lives in Benin City where she sells provisions & foodstuffs. She learned the trade from her mother before she started her business in 1992. She needs a loan amount of $525 to buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale. She has been with LAPO for 5 years is a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 41 years old. She lives in Benin City.  She is married with 6 children. She sells yams. Joy is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more yams for sale. She learned this business from her friend and has been in this business since 1988. She has been with LAPO for the past 5years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca R. is 54 years old; married and has 6 children. She sells foodstuff. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has be a LAPO member for 2 years. She is requesting for a loan of $525 to  buy more foodstuff for sale. She thank you.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith N. is 36 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 4 children. She has a shop were she sells provisions and drinks. She has been in business since 1995. She asks for a loan amount of $1200 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Stalla

texts.en: Stalla O. is 25 years old. She lives in Benin City and she is single. She sells female clothes. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more female clothes for sale. Stalla learned this business in 4months and started her business in 2004. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sale

loans.name: Azizallah

texts.en:
Azizallah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children, one son and two daughters. His two daughters are married and live with their families; his son is working with him.

Azizallah has a retail shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Now he wants to expand his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra fruit to complete his stock, increase his business and help his family.

loans.use: To buy extra fruit to complete his stock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther U. is 50 years old. She is a widow with 5 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been LAPO client for 5 years. She is requesting  a loan amount of $1200 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old.  She has been in this business since 1988 and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. Sarah needs a loan amount of $875 to buy more clothes for sale.She has been with LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a mother of five children. She is fifty-five years old and has been selling beans, brown rice, peanuts, and peanut butter which she prepares herself for the past ten years.

Grace travels six hours to the northern part of Ghana to buy her products and retail them to her customers. With her prior loan from Sinapi she has been able to save and she has now started building a house for her family.

Grace wants to use this new loan to buy more bags of beans, bags of rice, and gari (a processed form of cassava eaten in all homes in Ghana) to avoid price hikes as her products would soon enter into lean season.

To guarantee her loan from Sinapi, she has joined the group called “Nyame Aseda” (meaning God’s Thanksgiving) which exerts peer pressure to re-pay the loan on time.

In the photo, Grace displays her products on a busy market day.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts, beans, bags of rice

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is the mother of six children. She travels throughout Ghana purchasing items such as palm fruits and meats and resells them to local providers in Kumasi. In addition to the cost of the products, she incurs considerable expense traveling to such places as Tamale in the Northern Region of Ghana. She will use the loan to help with transport costs and to purchase additional products. She also hopes to use her profits to help pay for her eldest daughter’s fees at the local polytechnic institute.

Comfort is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hand Is in It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

On the day of the photo, Comfort was meeting with other members of her trust group. Consequently, she was unable to show us her products.

loans.use: To help with transport costs for her products

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a mother of forty years old and has two children who are currently schooling. She has been selling peanuts, white rice, beans, etc. for ten years now. She travels a lot to the northern parts of Ghana to buy her products.

Georgina wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of beans, bags of rice, and bags of peanuts so that she reduces her traveling days and also to prevent price hikes during the lean season from affecting her profits.

To help Georgina reduce medical costs and save more money, she has registered with the National Health Insurance Scheme to take care of her and the family’s medical bills.

She is a proud member of the group “Nyame Aseda” (meaning God’s Thanksgiving) which guarantees for each other to re-pay the loan from Sinapi.

In the photo, Georgina displays her products in a busy market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of beans, and bags of peanuts

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is the mother of four children. She has owned a supermarket in the small community of Akom for six years. She sells items such as milk, oats, sugar, and tinned fish. She hopes that the proceeds of this loan will allow her to expand her inventory and increase her sales. With increased sales, she hopes to help pay for the children’s school fees and to help with housekeeping expenses.

Sophia is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hand is in It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To help expand her inventory of grocery items

loans.name: Teresah

texts.en:
Teresah is the operator of a traveling bag (suitcase) and dressing bag business. She has operated the business for three years, but recently got sick and was unable to restock her inventory. She has now rejoined her trust group and is planning on using this loan to restock her inventory. She was a long-term member of the trust group and started by selling simply lingerie and undergarments and then expanded to more expensive bags.

In addition to running her business, Teresah is taking care of her sister’s four children. Her sister passed away recently.

Teresah is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hand Is In It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To restart her traveling and dressing bag business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is thirty-six years old and she is not married. She has no child. Hawa has been selling peanuts, rice, beans, etc. for ten years now in the open-air market place.

Hawa travels to Takyiman which is in the northern part of the country to buy her products. To enable her do active business, she has employed an assistant to sell the products when she travels.

Hawa wants to use her new loan to stock more bags of peanuts, rice, and beans to prevent price hikes during the lean season from affecting her profits.

She is a happy member of the group “Nyame Aseda” (meaning God’s Thanksgiving). The group exerts peer pressure on members to re-pay their loan from Sinapi.

In the photo, Hawa displays her products in the market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts, bags of rice, and bags of beans

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is the mother of seven children. She operates a kenkey stand and sells mostly to local school children. Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian dish that is prepared with boiled fermented maize meal and is wrapped in plantain or banana leaves. Martha will use the loan to purchase more maize and to buy cooked fish to be served with the kenkey.

Martha will use the profits from her increased sales to help pay her children’s school fees.

Martha is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hand Is in It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and cooked fish for re-sale

loans.name: Diaa Dial Group

texts.fr:
Our group wants to work with the women of the village by renewing our salt extraction equipment in order to make our production capacity more profitable. Among us, there are those who want to do buying and selling and another who wants to raise cattle. This amounts to several different businesses, but this makes it so that our group may have the solidarity for repaying the loan. The group that will extract salt will have the biggest output, enabling it to export its product from Senegal to Mali and to Guinea. The group that will do buying and selling will be able to guarantee the repayment of loans starting from the very first months while the animals that we will have bought will be fattened enough to be sent to market. We have chosen these three businesses in order avoid downtime. Given this, we are sure our work will continue unbroken.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Notre groupe veut travailler avec les femmes du village en renouvellant notre matériel d'extraction de sel pour rendre notre capacité de production plus rentable. Parmis nous, il y a celles qui veulent faire du commerce et une autre faire de l'embouche bovine. Ce qui fait plusieurs activités différentes, mais qui font que notre groupe puisse être solidaire pour le remboursement du prêt. Le groupe qui fera l'extraction du sel aura une plus grande production et lui permettra d'exporter son produit hors du Sénégal, vers le Mali et la Guinée. Le groupe qui fera le commerce pourra garantir le remboursement des prêts dès les premiers mois en attendant que les animaus que nous auront acheté seront assez gras pour être écoulés dans le marché. Nous avons choisi ces trois activités pour ne pas connaitre une période de pause. avec cela, nous sommes sûres de ne pas interrompre notre travail.

loans.use: Renewal of salt extraction equipment, raising cattle by acquiring cattle and feed

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick E. is 35 years old, married with 2 children. He provides transport services to people living in his community. He has been in this business since 2002. He lives in Benin City, Edo State Nigeria. He needs a loan amount of $600 which will enable him buy a new motorcycle. With a new motorcycle he will be able to serve his customers better. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy additional motorcycle

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en: Prosper O. is married and 43 years old. He hails from Edo State. He is a photographer and has been in this business since 2001. He needs the loan amount of $875 to buy a digital camera and printer for his business.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera and printer for his business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget N. is 44 years old, married and has 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has be a LAPO member for 6 years. She sells drinks. This  is a business she learnt for 12 month. She is requesting for $700 to enable her  buy more drinks for sale. This said will enable serve her customer better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero O. is 45 years old. She is married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks. She has been in business since 1990. She needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more drinks for sale in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Deborah Osaretin

texts.en: Deborah O. is 58 years old. She lives Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is a widow with 9 children. She owns a patent medicine store. She has been in business since 2004. She needs a loan amount of $1200 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy D. is married with 7 children.  She is 42years of old and  hails from Obulosho in Ogun State,Nigeria. She sells drinks and foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past 22 years. Mercy needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Afusatu

texts.en: Afusatu R. hails from  Lagos State Nigeria, She is a goldsmith, hence (i.e she repairs and sells articles made of gold) e.g necklace, engagement and marriage rings and bangles. Se also sells sachet water. At 41 years old, with 4 children Afusatu still has the mind to improve her business. She trained in her skill for 5 years and has been in business since 2005. Afusatu is requesting a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more articles made of gold and sachet water. This she said will help her serve her customer better.

loans.use: To buy materials for Gold production (Jewelry).

loans.name: Fallou

texts.fr:
Mr. N. is a young merchant based at a location behind the bus station in Thiès. His products are essentially tires for personal vehicles and for big trucks. He receives his merchandise by way of this brother, who is based in Europe. He is in charge of the bringing the inventory to market. Each time his brother makes a shipment, he need funds to address the costs of customs, handling, and transport.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr N. est un jeune commerçant basé derrière la gare routière de Thiès, ses produits sont essentiellement les Pneus de véhicules particuliers et gros porteurs. Il reçoit ses marchandises par le biais de son frère basé en Europe. Il est chargé de l’écoulement des stocks. A chaque envoie de son frère, il a un besoin de fonds pour faire face aux frais de dédouanement, de manutention, et de transport.

loans.use: To cover the costs of customs, handling, and transport, and to transport his inventory of tires located in the port of Dakar

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alla

texts.fr:
Mr. T. has been an upholster by profession since he was very young. He became a specialist in the upholstery of vehicles and in making tarps and tents for ceremonies. This business requires working capital that would enable him to acquire the raw materials and accessories for making goods to be sold.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr T. est tapissier de profession depuis qu’il est tout jeune, il s’est spécialisé dans la tapisserie de véhicule, fabrication de bâches et tentes de cérémonies. Cette activité nécessite pour lui un fonds de roulement qui lui permettrit de s’acheter des matières premières et accessoires pour la fabrication de produits destinée à la revente.

loans.use: To build up his working capital

loans.name: Amina's Raha Group

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 13, 10, 7 and 4 years old. Amina owns a small food store that she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in grocery and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Amina's Faraja Group

texts.en:
Amina is 27 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 4 years old. Amina owns a small food store that she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaid , who sells coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Adama Awa

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of two, Ms. D. is a good and honest individual, and she is one of the few rare women devoted to this type of business generally done by men. She just recently started this charcoal business, and the difficulties reside in resupplying the product, due to her fairly limited means. Her ambition is to have more depots for charcoal in her neighborhood. And to do this, she is requesting financial support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée, mère de deux enfants, Mme D. est très brave et c’est l’une des rares femmes à s’adonner à ce genre d’activité généralement faite par des hommes. Elle vient de démarrer récemment cette activité de commerce de charbon de bois et ses difficultés résident dans le réapprovisionnement du produit à cause de ses moyens assez limités. Elle a l’ambition de disposer du plus dépôt de charbon de son quartier et pour cela, elle sollicite un appui financier .

loans.use: To build up working capital to buy more supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Zulfa's Faraja Group

texts.en:
Zulfa is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, aged 12 years old. Zulfa sells snacks. She started her business in 2004. Every day, she works from 5.30am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Zahara, who sells food.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 35 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 14 and 10 years old. Salma sells cookware. She started her business a long time ago. Every day, she works from 8am to 3.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 24 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4 years old. Zainabu sells vegetables. She started her business in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Zainabu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetable for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 24 years old and is married woman with 2children, ages 7 and 4 years old. Zainabu is a vegetables seller, she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 8am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Zainabu has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetable for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel is 26 years old and has lived with his partner Felicia, with whom he has a three year old child, for five years. He worked in his brothers business selling engine lubricants until he began his auto mechanic studies.

After some time and much effort, Ángel was able to go out on his own and open his own shop. Four years have passed since then and, today, his shop is a success.

He tells that in addition to dedicating himself to his profession he also serves as a volunteer fireman in his city, an activity which he loves because it allows him to serve and help others in times of need. His volunteer work is greatly satisfying to him because he feels he can contribute positively to society, and he knows how important the job can be given that his own life was once saved by a fireman.

Ángel’s dream is to one day have a well-equipped shop. He needs a loan to be able to buy oil and lubricants of all types to sell, given that these are in great demand and provide him with a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel tiene 26 años, vive en pareja con Felicia hace 5 años y juntos tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ángel empezó a trabajar como vendedor de lubricantes para vehículos en la empresa de su hermano hasta que comenzó a estudiar mecánica para motos.

Luego de un tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo, Ángel logró independizarse y abrió su propio taller, desde entonces han pasado 4 años y su taller hoy día es todo un éxito.

Comenta que además de dedicarse a su profesión, también realiza otra actividad como Bombero Voluntario en su ciudad, esta actividad la realiza con mucho amor, pues dice que el desea servir a las personas, ayudarlas en los momentos en que necesiten. Ser bombero voluntario le da una satisfacción pues de ese modo siente que útil a la sociedad, además el sabe lo importante que es su ayuda pues el paso por una situación difícil en la que un bombero también le salvo la vida.

El sueño de Ángel es contar algún día con un tinglado bien equipado para utilizarlo como taller. En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de aceites y lubricantes de todo tipo para vender, pues cuenta que tiene mucha demanda y le deja un buen margen de ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase engine oil and other lubricants for vehicles.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
Donato is 51 years old. For the past 23 years he has lived with his partner Cristina, who is 52 years of age. Together, they have five children ranging in age from 8 to 25 years old.

He recounts that previously he dedicated himself to making and selling “chipas”, a typical Paraguayan food made from a base of starch, corn and cheese, which his parents taught him how to make. Donato comes from a humble family, for whom he started working at a very young age to help earn food each day.

A few years ago he suffered a hemorrhage which forced him to put a halt to his business for a time. When he recovered, he invested his savings into purchasing corn, starch, flour, nuts and other merchandise to sell.

Donato has advanced greatly and, thanks to excellent sales, he was able to buy a small truck to use for his business. He previously had to sell to order, and carry the merchandise in bags for delivery. With the loan he is seeking he wants to start buying his merchandise at wholesale prices. This will allow him to improve his profit margins and take advantage of discounts that are offered for purchasing at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Donato tiene 51 años. Vive en pareja hace 23 años con Cristina que tiene 52 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos que hoy día tienen el mayor de sus hijos tiene 25 años y el más pequeño tiene 8 años.

Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de chipas, la chipa es una comida típica paraguaya a base de almidón, maíz y queso que el aprendió a cocinar de sus padres que también se dedicaban a este rubro. Donato proviene de una familia muy humilde, por lo que el trabajo desde muy temprana edad para ganarse el pan de cada día.

Hace unos años, sufrió un derrame facial, por lo que dejo de trabajar en la elaboración de la chipa por un tiempo. Cuando se recuperó, el invirtió unos ahorros y compro granos de maíz, poroto, almidón, harina, maní entre otras mercaderías para vender.

Donato ha progresado bastante, gracias a sus buenas ventas ha podido comprarse una camioneta para realizar sus ventas, ya que anteriormente lo hacia abajo pedido y debía cargarse con las bolsas para transportarlas. Con el crédito que solicita tiene proyectado comprar sus mercaderías en mayor volumen y así obtener mayores ganancias y beneficios con los descuentos especiales que recibe cuando compra al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase of grains of corn, nuts, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is 24 years old, single, and lives with his father who has been ill for several years. He has a sister who works outside of the home.

For the past four years, Eduardo has run a store which he inherited from his parents. He tells with much sadness that his mother, who tended to the store, passed away a few years ago. As a consequence, Eduardo had to leave his studies to care for his father and tend to the business which, along with the small salary earned by his sister, is their only means of income.

Today, he counts on a well-established customer base and his earnings from the store cover their cost of living and the medicines for his father.

He needs a loan to be able to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour, baked goods, etc., to better supply his store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo tiene 24 años, es soltero y vive con su padre quien está enfermo hace varios años, tiene una hermana mayor que trabaja fuera de la casa.

Eduardo posee una despensa que heredó de sus padres, y el administra desde hace mas de 4 años. Cuenta con mucha tristeza que su madre murió hace unos años, ella era quien atendía el negocio, a consecuencia de ello, su padre enfermo y Eduardo tuvo que abandonar sus estudios para cuidar a su padre y atender el negocio que es la única fuente de ingreso además del pequeño sueldo que percibe su hermana.

Hoy día cuenta con una clientela bien formada y los ingresos que le generan la despensa le alcanzan para costear los gastos que le demandan la vida diaria y los medicamentos de su padre.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como: azúcar, arroz, harina, panificados, etc. y así surtir mejor su despensa.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, flour, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in the purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín is 48 years old and has been married for 24 years to Isabel who is 45. Together they have six children 18, 12, 9, 5 and 3 years old. Efraín states that he loves his kids and that it has been a gift from God to have had a number of children. He tells us that he misses his wife greatly who, along with their oldest daughter, traveled to Spain to look for work. Despite this, the children who remain with him support him emotionally and give him the inspiration to continue to struggle to get ahead.

Efraín owns a public transportation enterprise that makes its trips within the city of Itá and neighboring towns. With much effort, he saved money and bought his house and the bus that he uses for the business.

His main objective is to buy another vehicle to put to the same use so he can grow his business. To reach this goal he has been saving for several months, along with money sent by his wife. He seeks a loan to purchase new seats for his bus.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Efraín tiene 48 años, está casado hace 24 años con Isabel que tiene 45 años. El matrimonio tiene 6 hijos de 24, 18, 12, 9, 5 y 3 años respectivamente. Efraín cuenta que ama a sus hijos, que para el fue una bendición de Dios el haber tenido tantos hijos; nos cuenta que su esposa le hace mucha falta ya que ella y su hija mayor viajaron a España en busca de trabajo. Aún así sus hijos son los que le contienen emocionalmente y dan aliento para seguir luchando.

Efraín es propietario de un transporte público que hace sus recorridos dentro de la ciudad de Itá y pueblos aledaños. Con mucho esfuerzo ahorro dinero y compro una casa y el bus que utiliza como transporte.

Su principal objetivo es comprar otro vehiculo para destinarlo a la misma actividad, debido a que no llega a abastecer con un solo vehiculo y de este modo ir ampliando su negocio. Para lograr su objetivo el ha estado ahorrando por varios meses y junto con el dinero que le envía su esposa. En esta oportunidad solicítale crédito para la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su bus.

loans.use: Purchase new seats for his bus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in additional merchandise.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario is 60 years old. He is married to Ramona who is 45 years old. They have been married for 28 years and have had 10 children. Of these children, the oldest is 27 years old and the youngest 6 years old.

Hilario is a sheet metal worker. He creates trays, small charcoal ovens, grills, and other tin items. His oldest children work in the same industry, sharing in the work.

The requested loan will be used to purchase basic materials in order to increase Hilario’s production since he received a large order from a big hardware store in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Hilario tiene 60 años, está casado con Ramona de 45 años. Llevan 28 años de casados y de dicha unión han nacido 10 hijos de los cuales el mayor tiene 27 años y el menor tiene 6 años.

Hilario es hojalatero, el fabrica bandejas, pequeños hornos a carbón, parrillas entre otras cosas de lata. Los hijos mayores se dedican a la misma profesión del padre, ayudándose entre todos.

Hilario proviene de una familia muy humilde, y todo lo que tiene hasta hoy día lo ha ganado con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo honrado, y le ha servido para criar a sus hijos.

El crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para la compra de materia prima para aumentar su producción debido a que en este mes a conseguido proveer a una ferretería grande de la ciudad y que le ha hecho un pedido grande de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise to better stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Tables and Chairs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria Angela is 59 years old. She is married to Geronimo, who's 50 years old. They have been married for 20 years and they assure us that their love gets stronger and bigger each day. Their 3 children are more than proof of their love. They are between the ages of 24, 17, and 16 respectively. She tells us that her older kid is going to college and wants to study computers. The 2 younger kids are going to high school.

Maria Angela is a seamstress. She makes beautiful clothes such as pants, blouses and sweaters which she sells to all whole sellers in the country. Her husband is in public transportation and he travels to different parts of the country.

She tells us that about 25 years ago she used to work as a seamstress in a very well-known store in the city called Riojana. Since then, she has been able to become financially independent by opening up her own dress shop.

Maria Angela tells us with sadness that she was robbed about 5 years ago and they took many of her sewing machines leaving her without her working tools. Since then, she has been applying for loans in order to replace the sewing machines she lost.

At this time, she's requesting a loan to purchase fabrics and threads in huge quantities since she has a lot of oders such as school and work uniforms that she needs to fullfil.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

María Ángela tiene 59 años, está casada hace varios años con Geronimo que tiene 50 años de edad. Ellos llevan más de 20 años de casados y aseguran que su amor es cada vez más grande y fuerte. La prueba de su amor son sus tres hijos que hoy tienen ya 24, 17 y 16 años respectivamente. Ella comenta que el hijo mayor está cursando la carrera universitaria de ingeniería informática mientras que los dos hijos menores aún van a la secundaria.

María Ángela se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir de todo tipo, principalmente pantalones, camisas y bermudas que vende al por mayor a distintos negocios del país. Su esposo es transportista y actualmente realiza fletes a sojeros de diversas zonas del país.

Ella cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba como costurera para una muy conocida tienda de la capital, llamada la Riojana, hace aproximadamente 25 años ella logró independizarse y monto su propio taller de costuras.

María Ángela nos comento con tristeza que hace 5 años fue victima de un robo, donde la despojaron de varias maquinas, quedándose sin sus herramientas fundamentales de trabajo. Desde ese momento han recurrido a los préstamos a fin de adquirir nuevamente dichas maquinarias.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para comprar telas en grandes cantidades al igual que hilos, pues tiene muchos pedidos de uniformes para colegios y oficinas que debe cubrir.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and thread in huge quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice wholesale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is 56 years old. He lives with his living partner, Tomasa, who's 54 years old. They have been together for 26 years and they don't have any children. Miguel is a farmer. He plants lettuce, cucumbers, pumpkins, tomatoes, carrots, beets, etc. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land.

Thanks to their savings, they were able to purchase a house and live a comfortable life. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house.

Miguel starts his day at dawn to go to the main city which is about 2 hours away from the city of Ita to sell his vegetables. He returns in the afternoons to work the land.

With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 56 años, vive en pareja con Tomasa de 54 años. Hace 26 años que están juntos pero no tienen hijos. Miguel se dedica a la horticultura, cultiva todo tipo de hortalizas como lechuga, acelga, pepino, tomates, zapallos, zanahorias, remolachas, etc. Comenta que proviene de una familia de agricultores y afirma que le va muy bien gracias al empeño y dedicación que le otorga al cuidado de la tierra. Gracias a sus ahorros ellos lograron hacerse de casa propia, adquirir otros inmuebles y contar con las comodidades necesarias para una buena vida. Su esposa es su gran apoyo, ella lo ayuda en todo además de cuidar bien de él y su casa.

Miguel empieza su jornada a tempranas horas de la madrugada para trasladarse hasta la ciudad capital que queda a dos horas de la ciudad de Itá, con el fin de comercializar sus productos. Al medio día ya está de vuelta y comienza a trabajar la chacra.

Con el crédito que solicitan en esta oportunidad piensan ampliar el sistema de riego artificial de sus hortalizas, lo cual es fundamental para la agricultura.

loans.use: To expand the irrigation system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of seasonal home products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two more phone kiosks

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells materials, shoes, laces and other items. Her husband is a commercial driver, and they have 4 children. She wishes to improve upon her business.

She is asking for $525 as an additional source of capital to enable her to increase her stock of items for sale.

loans.use: To enable her to increase her stock for sale.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 42585

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo is 56 years old and has been married for 34 years to Prisciliana, who is 55 years old. They have 5 children aged 32, 29, 27, 22 and 20. The three oldest are married and live with their respective partners and have their own houses. The two youngest children, on the other hand, still live at home and help them with the business.

Ricardo tells us that previously he used to work at an oil factory that later went bankrupt. Due to this turn of events he decided to find a different way to earn a living and this is how he got started selling charcoal and firewood.

Thanks to his efforts he was able to support his family and help them get ahead. Additionally he was able to enjoy the comforts of owning his house and a truck that he now uses to deliver his products.

Ricardo proudly mentions that he is doing well in his business and that he can count on the constant support of his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase charcoal and firewood for him to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo tiene 56 años, está casado hace 34 años con Prisciliana de 55 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos de 32, 29, 27, 22 y 20 años respectivamente. Los tres hijos mayores ya están casados y viven con sus respectivas parejas, ya poseen sus casas propias mientras que los dos hijos menores aún viven con ellos y les ayudan en el negocio.

Ricardo cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica aceitera que luego fue a la quiebra. Por tal motivo comenzó a buscar una actividad a la cual dedicarse y fue así que comenzó con la venta de carbón y leñas.

Gracias al fruto de su esfuerzo pudo mantener y sacar adelante a toda su familia, además de obtener comodidades como su casa propia y una camioneta que hoy día emplea en la distribución de sus mercaderías.

Ricardo comenta orgulloso que le va muy bien en su trabajo y que además cuenta con el apoyo constante de toda su familia. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de leñas y carbón para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en: Vesna is a 34-year-old woman from Pojezna, a small village near the town of Derventa. Her husband has a full-time job  and his monthly salary is 500 BAM. By working in the agriculture industry, they generate additional income (approximately 400 BAM per month). Vesna is seeking a loan in the amount of 1000 BAM to buy seeds and additives in order to cultivate their land. More generally, the loan will enable her family to invest in agriculture and land cultivation, which should generate more money for their family so that they can purchase cows in the future.

loans.use: To cultivate the land through the purchase of  seeds and additives.

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.es:
Tranquilino is 60 years old. He has been married for 32 years to Dora and they have raised , with a lot of love, 6 children together. The children are between the ages of 15 and 30 years old. The older ones work in different fields such as computers, technical and public transportation and one of them is an obstetrician. The two younger ones are twins and they go to high school.

Tranquilino is the owner of a book store which he's owned for the past 20 years. He used to work at a gas station, but his enterprising spirit led him to a seek some financial help to start his own business. Little by little, his business grew and with more loans he was able to purchase more inventory for his bookstore.

With time and with perseverance from him and his family, he was able to move ahead and he now owns a beautiful home. Beside the bookstore, he also owns a food stand where he sells fast food which is run by his wife.

Since it's back to school time and because he wants to make sure his bookstore has all the inventory needed for school, he's requesting a loan to purchase school supplies such as books, notepads, pens and pencils, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tranquilino tiene 60 años y está casado hace 32 años con Dora, juntos han criado con mucho amor a 6 hijos. La edad de ellos oscila entre los 15 y 30 años de edad. Los hijos mayores ya trabajan en distintas profesiones como: técnicos en informática, chofer de transporte público, uno de ellos es obstetra. Y los dos hijos menores son mellizos y aún van a la secundaria.

Tranquilino posee una librería, comenta que abrió su librería hace 20 años pero que anteriormente trabajaba en un surtidor pero su espíritu emprendedor lo llevo a solicitar créditos con los que pudo montar su propio negocio. Poco a poco fue agrandando el mismo y con otros préstamos que fue adquiriendo iba surtiendo cada vez más.

Con el tiempo y esfuerzo tanto de él como el de su familia logró salir adelante y ahora ya cuenta con una hermosa casa, fruto de su esfuerzo y perseverancia. Además de la librería, también tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas y que es administrado por el y su esposa, la misma cuenta con una gran afluencia de clientes.

En esta oportunidad necesita un préstamo para la compra de artículos escolares como: libros, cuadernos, lápices, pinceles, etc. Debido a que se han iniciado las clases y desea surtir mejor su librería.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a small entrepreneur from Kahovka, Ukraine. His business is located at the busy central market in Kahovka. Many large outdoor markets like Alexander’s can be found throughout Ukraine, and are in most every city. They are made up of many small individual booths or kiosks where vendors sell all kinds of items ranging from clothing and shoes to groceries, household supplies, and hardware. Alexander just started his business about three months ago to help support his family. He is married and has a fourteen year old daughter. At this point, he has about $1000 invested in his clothing inventory and about $1000 in working capital.

Alexander has requested a loan of $500 to purchase additional inventory. We are excited to have the opportunity to assist Alexander as he establishes his business and look forward to seeing it grow and prosper in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana was born in 1951 and she is married. She lives with her  husband in Pojezna, a small village near the town of Derventa. Her husband is disabled and receives 300 BAM in monthly disability income. This is the first loan she has sought through Kiva and she is hereby requesting a loan in the amount of 600 BAM to purchase a cow. If she is able to buy a cow, she will produce milk products, sell the milk products, and in turn generate additional monthly income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother who supports her family with a small clothing sales business. Her business is located at one of the markets in the city of Kahovka in south central Ukraine. In business for a year, she sells an attractive variety of women’s clothing. Elena currently makes about $200 in profit each month. She has two children – a son who is eighteen and a daughter who is fourteen.

Elena has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new clothing inventory. With the change of seasons, it is important for clothing vendors like Elena to update their inventories for spring and summer. This loan will give Elena necessary capital to buy new clothing items that will sell well and allow her to earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her clothing store

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is a shoe salesman from the central Ukrainian city of Kahovka. He has a small space at one of the outdoor markets in Kahovka where he sells an attractive variety of men’s and women’s shoes. Oleg has been in business for about two years. He has about $2500 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $250 per month in net profit. Oleg is married and has a seventeen year old daughter. Like so many small entrepreneurs in Ukraine, Oleg is working hard to make a better life for his family.

Oleg has requested a loan of $500 to purchase new inventory to sell so that he can continue to operate his business successfully and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with a son and a daughter. Her family is an ordinary, middle-class family from Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. Victoria started her own business 10 years ago and has developed it into a stable and successfully growing trade. Currently, her income is about $400 a month. Victoria likes working in the food market and has many faithful customers. She operates her business with integrity and skill and is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. 

Victoria is hoping to get a loan of $800 to further develop her trade so that she can continue to feed her family. She would like to increase the assortment of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. This additional supply of inventory combined with Victoria’s work ethic and experience will enable her to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir has a business selling auto parts, tools and other small items at an outdoor market in Kahovka, Ukraine. He is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for about seven years.

Auto sales are booming in Ukraine. Higher incomes and the availability of credit have made car ownership possible for more and more people. This is a good sign for business owners like Vladimir who benefit from more customers needing parts and equipment for their vehicles.

Vladimir currently has about $2500 invested in inventory and makes about $300 in profit each month. He has requested a loan of $600 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase new inventory to sell. We are happy to have the opportunity to assist Vladimir with his business and look forward to seeing him continue to be successful.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for his auto parts store.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
The communal bank of "Light and Life" is the first of its kind in the district of Chicacao in Suchitepequez. The members of this group are very proud to be part of it, and they are very happy that they have been able to keep the group unified, responsible and with good credit after 10 loans. The Friendship Bridge is very proud to have this group in their team.

When I entered the house of Doña Zoila A., our meeting place, I noticed that this group was very mixed. There were a combination of Indigenous and Ladina (Indigenous and Spanish) women. This combination gives the group a very special characteristic since each member brings different aspects from their cultures. Not only that, but there are many types of businesses that these women are doing. In this group, we will find women who will use their loan to raise animals, to purchase inventory for convenience stores, beauty salons, to sell pork meat, to sell hot dogs and refreshments and to run a funeral parlour. Due to the variety of businesses, there is also a variety of personalities in this group such as women who are strong, brave, conservative, extroverts or shy. Even though, there is a lot of variety within the grup, they are still very unified.

The women of "Light and Life" like the idea of working through communal banks because they feel that it unifies the women and motivates them. They also believe that it creates leadership within the group since problems are resolved through the board of directors. Last but not least, they love to work with the Friendship Bridge due to the low interest rates and for all the support they give to all the women in Guatemala.
