The dream of all these women is to expand their business and to be profitable. Others want to be able to send their children to college. These women have already made a lot of progress, but they hope for more . They want for their families to be taken care of and to be successful in life, this is why we must help them!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El banco comunal Luz y Vida es el primer banco formado en el distrito de Chicacao, Suchitepequez. Las integrantes de este grupo se sienten realmente orgullosas de ello y no solo de eso. Ellas se dignan de haber sido capaces de mantener un grupo unificado, responsable y cumplidor a lo largo de diez préstamos. The Friendship Bridge también se siente orgulloso de tener este grupo en el equipo.

Al entrar a la casa de doña Zoila A., el lugar de reunión, me di cuenta que este grupo era muy variado. Uno encontraba una combinación de mujeres indígenas y ladinas. Esta combinación le daba al grupo una característica especial al grupo ya que las integrantes llevan consigo los aspectos especiales de sus culturas. No solo eso, sino que también había una variedad de negocios. En este grupo podemos encontrar mujeres que van a invertir su crédito en crianza de pollo, tiendas de consumo diario, perfumería, peluquerías, venta de carne de marrano, venta de hot dogs y gaseosas y una funeraria. Debido a esta variedad, uno podía encontrar distintas personalidades dentro del grupo tales como mujeres aguerridas, valientes, conservadoras, extrovertidas o un poco tímidas. Sin embargo, a pesar de esta variedad la unión del grupo es inigualable.

A las mujeres de Luz y Vida les gusta trabajar bajo la metodología de bancos comunales porque ellas sienten que este estilo de trabajo promueve unidad entre las señoras. Además, creen que promueve liderazgo dentro del grupo ya que cualquier problema es avocado a la junta directiva. Finalmente, a ellas les gusta trabajar con The Friendship Bridge por los bajos intereses y por el apoyo constante que la institución da a las mujeres guatemaltecas.

El sueño de muchas de estas clientas es que su negocio se vuelva sostenible y así ya no tengan que depender de una deuda para poder mantener su negocio. Otras quieren que sus hijos se gradúen del colegio y de la universidad. Estas señoras ya han logrado mucho, sin embargo ellas aspiran a más ¡Ellas quieren que sus familias salgan adelante junto con ellas, es por eso que las tenemos que apoyar!

loans.use: To purchase food supply and refreshments and to raise animals such as pigs and chickens and to run a funeral parlour

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Sra. Estela M. A. is originally from the city of Bluefields. She's 38 years old and she's married to Sr. Antonio Ramirez. They have 5 young children. Sra M. is the owner of a small grocery store for more than 4 years. Her clientele consists of all the people in the neighborhood who like her store for all the variety of products it has.

At this time, she needs to purchase 2 kgs of rice which is $45 per kg, 2 kgs of sugar which is $36 per kg, 2 steel drums of cooking oil at $40 per drum, 2 big bags of toilet paper at $12 per bag, 2 boxes of laundry soap at $18 per box, 1 bale of salt at $7 per bale, 3 boxes of eggs at $4 per box, 25 lbs of cheese at $2 per lb., 15 lbs. of creme cheese at .80 cents per lb., 50 lbs of chicken at $1 a lb. and 2 baskets full of vegetables at $49 per basket.

With this purchase she will increase her inventory and satisfy demand which keeps increasing each day.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Estela M. A. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Ramírez ambos tienen 5 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. M. es propietaria de una pulpería por mas de 4 años sus clientes son los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de productos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 2 quintales de arroz a $ 45. 00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 36.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 40.00 dólares el bidón, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 12.00 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de jabón de lavar ropa a $ 18.00 dólares la caja, 1 paca de sal a $ 7.00 dólares la paca, 3 cajillas de huevo a $ 4.00 dólares cada cajilla, 25 libras de queso a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 15 libras de crema a $ 0.80 centavos dólar la libra, 50 libra de pollo a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 2 canastas de verduras a $ 49.00 dólares la canasta con esta compra podrá aumentar su inventario y de esta manera podrá satisfacer su demanda que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper, laundry soap, femenie hygiene products, salt, eggs, cheese, chickens and vegetables

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 46.48 dólares.

loans.name: Jiltañani Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION " JILTAÑANI" PERTENECE A PRO-MUJER HACE YA HACE VARIOS AÑOS CUENTA CON 17 SOCIAS, DICHO GRUPO TRAJAJA CON EL CENTRO FOCAL DE VILLA ADELA , UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO. PODRIAMOS DECIR QUE LA MAYORIA DE LAS SOCIAS SON CASADAS CON UN PROMEDIO DE 3 HIJOS CADA UNA Y QUE ESTAS MANTIENEN ECONOMICAMENTE A SUS FAMILIAS. LAS ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZAN SON LAS VENTA DE CDS DE MANERA INFORMAL, TAMBIEN TRABAJAN CON LA VENTA DE FRUTA, QUE ESTA LA COMPRAN EN LOS MERCADOS AL POR MAYOR PARA LUEGO OFRECERLA AL POR MENOR; PERO LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL DENTRO LA ASOCIACION ES LA CONFECCION DE ROPA Y OTROS PRODUCTOS COMO SER: MOCHILAS, MALETINES, ESTUCHES ESPECIALES PARA CAMARAS, COMPUTADORAS ETC, ADEMAS DE LA CONFECCION DE ROPA CASUAL COMO SER: BLUSAS, FALDAS Y VESTIDOS. ELLAS AFIRMAN QUE NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA YA QUE PRINCIPAMENTE EL CUERO Y LAS TELAS SUBIERON DE PRECIO PARA ESTO SOLICITAN MAYORES CREDITOS, DE ESTA MANERA CONTINUAR CON SU TRABAJO Y ASI OBTENER GANANCIAS PARA PODER SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA YA QUE PRINCIPAMENTE EL CUERO Y LAS TELAS SUBIERON DE PRECIO.

THE "JILTAÑANI" ASSOCIATION HAS BELONGED TO PRO-MUJER FOR SEVERAL YEARS AND NOW HAS 17 MEMBERS; THIS GROUP WORKS WITH VILLA ADELA COMMUNITY LOCATED IN THE EL ALTO. MOST OF THE MEMBERS ARE MARRIED WITH AN AVERAGE OF 3 CHILDREN EACH WHO ARE ECONOMICALLY SUPPORTING THEIR FAMILIES. MANY OF THEM SELL CDS IN THE INFORMAL MARKET, THEY ALSO SELL FRUIT BY BUYING IT IN THE MARKET AT A WHOLESALE PRICE AND THEN SELLING IT FOR LESS; BUT THE MAIN ACTIVITY WITHIN THE ASSOCIATION IS THE TAILORING OF CLOTHING AND OTHER PRODUCTS: BACKPACKS, SUITCASES, COMPUTERS AND CAMERA CASES, ETC. IN ADDITION THEY MAKE CASUAL CLOTHING LIKE: SHIRTS, SKIRTS AND DRESSES. THEY NEED MORE CAPITAL FOR THE PURCHASE OF RAW MATERIALS, SPECIFICALLY SINCE THE PRICE OF LEATHER AND CLOTH WENT UP CREATING THE NEED FOR HIGHER LOANS. THIS WILL ALLOW THEM TO CONTINUE WORKING AND OBTAINING PROFITS TO SUPPORT THEIR FAMILIES.

loans.use: NEED MORE CAPITAL TO PURCHASE RAW MATERIALS SINCE LEATHER AND FABRIC PRICES INCREASED

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the merchandise she has in the store

loans.name: Grupo Atenas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo denominado Atenas tuvo su inicio en el mes de Noviembre del Año 2.007, una de las integrantes tuvo conocimiento del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras através de una vecina quien ya formaba parte en comité. Viendo el progreso logrado y los beneficios del mismo, esta señora decidió contactar a sus amigas y vecinas para formar su propio comité. Las reuniones informativas fueron un éxito, se logro formar el grupo que está compuesto por señoras muy trabajadoras y activas. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como, venta de mercería, artesanías, cosméticos, helados, comidas rápidas, peluquería, confección de ropas y empleadas domésticas.

El Grupo Atenas esta conformado por 17 integrantes, el Grupo se encuentra localizado en la Ciudad de J. Augusto Saldivar una ciudad que queda a escasos minutos de Itá y se caracteriza por ser una zona principalmente rural.

Estas mujeres además de ser amas de casa y microempresarias, también realizan actividades con el fin de recaudar fondos para mejoras en su barR.. Es un grupo unido y muy puntual en sus créditos, ellas saben que es primordial la responsabilidad en los pagos, la comunicación entre ellas y la solidaridad principalmente. El promedio que desea retirar cada una es de 500.000gs. cada una para invertirlos principalmente en la compra de mercaderías e insumos para sus ventas.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

The group named “Athens” began in November 2007, one of the members became aware of the Committee for Women Entrepreneurs through a neighbor who was already part of the committee. Seeing the progress and the benefits achieved, this woman decided to form her own committee with her friends and neighbors. The informative meetings were a success, they were able to form a group composed of working and active ladies. The members are engaged in various activities such as selling merchandise, crafts, cosmetics, ice cream, fast food, hairdressing, clothing and clothing maids.

The Athens Group is made up of 17 members, the group is located in the City of J. Augusto Saldivar which is a few minutes away from Itá and is characterized by a predominantly rural area.

These women besides being housewives and micro entrepreneurs are also active in raising funds for improvements in their neighborhood. It is a unified group that is very timely in paying their loans; they know that it is their primary responsibilities are to make payments, communicate and ensure solidarity among them. The average each woman would like to borrow is 500.000gs which would be used to invest primarily in the purchase of goods and supplies for their sales.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, ice cream, supplies for hairdressing like shampoo, conditioner, combs, cosmetics; household items like vases, plates, table clothes, sheets; ingredients for preparing food: meat, milk, eggs, flour, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Monsiváis empezó su negocio hace mas de 12 años de manera fortuita, cuando su hija mayor no quiso seguir estudiando entonces buscando una actividad en la que se pudiera desarrollar para que no perdiera el tiempo y se ocupara de algo, fue que decidió vender frituras y refrescos en su casa, poco a poco han invertido al negocio y lo han hecho crecer hasta tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual se convirtió en un negocio familiar ya que su esposo le ayuda a atenderla.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mercancía para la tienda, y poder seguir creciendo así como salir adelante. Ayudemos a Martha y su familia a seguir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Monsiváis started his business more than 12 years ago accidentally when his eldest daughter did not want to continue studying; he began looking for an activity that would allow her to develop so as not to lose time, so they decided to sell fried foods and refreshments at home. They have gradually invested in the business and it has now grown to become a small grocery store, which is also a family business since her husband helps take care of it.

Now they are asking for a loan of $ 675 to be paid off in 4 months to buy supplies for the store, which will ensure their continued success and growth. Let us help Martha and her family to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Saldívar Poty Group

texts.es:
The Group named SALDIVAR POTY from the city of J. Augusto Saldívar was formed in April 2007, by the President María Esther S., who contacted her neighbors in order to form the group, all are neighbors in whom she has confidence. This Group is very organized and unified, and are currently working on their 4th program cycle with excellent qualifcations as to the punctualities of their payments. In addition to this reponsiblity that they demonstrate each of the members stand out on their own, and are very solidary amongst themselves and thanks to this union have formed great bonds of friendship among themselves.

These women of great entrepreneurial spirit know how to carry their families forward, they are loving mothers, lovers of hardwork and dedicated spouses. They are faithful reflexions of our Paraguayan women, who, alongside being strong pillars for their families, struggle day by day to support their families.

The credit they are asking for is in order to purchase merchandise for their businesses selling clothing for women, men and children; articles for the pantry and ingredients to prepare meals such as sugar, milk, bread products, fruits, vegetables, drinks. Others would like to invest in purchasing yarn and fabric in order to make clothing items; others purchase cleaning products for the home abd personal hygiene products in other cases. In general terms they all desire to invest in micro-businesses.

They are very appreciative for the opportunity offered by the Paraguay Foundation to prepare them for larger businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado SALDIVAR POTY de la Ciudad de J. Augusto Saldívar tuvo su inicio en el mes de Abril del año 2.007. El mismo fue formado por la Presidenta María Esther S., quien contacto con sus vecinas para la constitución del grupo, todas son vecinas de confianza. El Grupo es muy organizado y unido, hoy día ya pasan al 4º ciclo del programa con una calificación excelente en la puntualidad de sus pagos. Además de la gran responsabilidad que demuestra cada una de las integrantes, es bueno resaltar, que son muy solidarias entre si y gracias a esta unión se formaron muy fuertes lazos de amistad entre ellas.

Estas mujeres de gran espíritu emprendedor saben llevar a sus familias adelante, son madres amorosas, amas de casa hacendosas, y esposas dedicadas, ellas son un fiel reflejo de las nuestras mujeres paraguayas, que a pesar de ser pilares fuertes dentro de sus familia, también luchan día a día para mantener a sus familias.

El crédito que solicitan desean destinarlo a la compra de mercaderías para sus ventas como ropas para damas, caballeros y niños; artículos para despensa e ingredientes para preparar comidas como azúcar, leche, panificados, frutas, vegetales, bebidas; otras desean invertirlos en la compra de hilos y telas para la confección de prendas; otras compraran artículos de limpieza para el hogar, productos de aseo personal entre otras cosas, en líneas generales todas desean invertirlos en sus micro negocios.

Ellas se sienten agradecidas por la oportunidad que les ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya de capacitarlas para ser mejores empresarias.

loans.use: Clothing sales, cosmes, sugar, milk, bread products, fruits, vegetables, products for the home,  products to clean, personal hygiene products, hair products, yarn, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano Núñez is married and has 11 children, including two who died, one of which in a transportation acccident and the other shortly after birth. Emiliano states that losing these two sons emotionally affected him and his wife tremendously, but with the hlpe of their friends and families they were able to survive this tragedy of their lives.

Emiliana is an entrepreneur, during a number of year he ran a bar/dining establishment in a space that he rented and that was waited on by his wife and girls. After a time he opened a new business, this time out of his own home, and until this day, it reamins the most important source of their earnings. The business they own is attended to mostly by his wife and it has been six years since they opened this space. At the same time they are dedicated to selling raw materials such as fruits, vegetables, meat, milk products, bread products, canned products and products for the home, among other things.

Thanks to their great aptitude for business and their ability to save, they were able to purchase a truck that they use to sell meats and sausages in the areas outside of the city. The loans that the Paraguay Foundation previously provided them with was a great help in order for them to maintain their business.

In the future, Emiliano wishes to expand his business and open a mini market where he can sell a greater variety of merchandise and offer commodity/choice for his clients. Currently, Emiliano is asking for a loan with which he can acquire larger quantities of merchandise for his store, and his providers will offer him discounted proces for the products he does buy.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Emiliano Núñez, esta casado, tiene 11 hijos de los cuales dos ya fallecieron uno de ellos en un accidente de tránsito y otro a los pocos meses de nacer. Emiliano cuenta que la pérdida de sus hijos le afecto mucho emocionalmente a él y su esposa pero que con la ayuda de sus amigos y familiares pudieron sobre llevar el trago amargo que significo esto en sus vidas.

Emiliano es un hombre emprendedor, durante varios años administro un bar-comedor en un local que alquilaba y que era atendido también por su esposa e hijas. Luego de un tiempo abrió otro negocio pero ya en su casa propia y que hasta hoy día es la fuente de ingresos más importante que tienen. El negocio que tienen es una despensa que es atendida principalmente por su esposa y ya van seis años desde que abrieron su local. En la misma se dedican a vender insumos de primera necesidad como frutas, verduras, carne, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, productos para el hogar, entre otras cosas.

Gracias a su buena aptitud para los negocios y su sentido del ahorro, el pudo comprarse una camioneta que lo utiliza para vender carnes y embutidos recorriendo los barrios de la ciudad. Los créditos que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorgo anteriormente también fueron una gran ayuda para mantener ambos negocios.

En el futuro, Emiliano, desea ampliar su despensa y abrir un mini market, en donde pueda vender mayor variedad de mercaderías y ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes. Hoy día Emiliano solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades para su despensa, de este modo, sus proveedores le ofrecen muy buenos descuentos por su compra al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase grass, sugar, bread, drinks, milk products, fruits, vegetables, meat, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Guillerma's Group

texts.es:
Teodora, Evelina and Guillerma belong to the Winarisun Communal Bank which means “we grow” in Quechua for 10, 8, and 9 years respectively. Teodora is married, she is 44 years old and has 4 children, Teodora has been selling meat in the central market of the city of Ayacucho for many years. Evelina is separated, she is 41 years old and has 3 children, she lives in the district of Quinua, Evelina sells food and drinks in her district. Guillerma is married, she is 40 years old and has 3 children, Guillerma sells meat in a small market in the district of Quinua, the animals are purchased from different communities. Teodora, Evelina and Guillerma need loans of 1250 soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of livestock like cattle and sheep, and meat such as pork. The dreams of Teodora, Evelina and Guillerma are that their business grows, to build a home, that their children will be professionals and to have a stable job.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodora, Evelina y Guillerma pertenecen al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa “Crezcamos” en quechua hace 10, 8, 9 años respectivamente.

Teodora es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Teodora vende carne en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Ayacucho hace muchos años.

Por otro lado, Evelina es separada, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, vive en el distrito de Quinua, Evelina vende comida y bebidas en su distrito.

Mientras que, Guillerma es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Guillerma vende carne en el mercadillo del Distrito de Quinua, los animales son comprados de diferentes comunidades.

Teodora, Evelina y Guillerma necesitan préstamos de 1250 soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno, caprino, ovino, carne de cerdo y cuyes.

Los sueños de Teodora, Evelina y Guillerma son que su negocio crezca, construir su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un trabajo estable.

loans.use: Teodora, Evelina and Guillerma need loans of 1250 soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of livestock like cattle and sheep and meat such as pork.

loans.name: Gertrudis' Group

texts.es:
Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis have belonged to the Winarisun Communal Bank for 10, 7, and 11 years respectively. Reina is married; she is 42 years old and has 6 children. Reina lives in the district of Quinua where she has a small grocery store. Furthermore Reina travels to the market of Huanta where she purchases small animals and sells them in the small market in her district. Gloria lives with her boyfriend, she is 35 years old and they have 3 children. Gloria has a restaurant located on a central street in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, Gloria dedicates herself to raising small animals that she sells in the market in the city. Gertrudis is married, she is 48 years old and has 1 son, Gertrudis dedicates herself to farming alfalfa, an activity that she does on her own lands and other lands in the small valley of Huatatas, her sales take place in stores in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, Gertrudis dedicates herself to raising small animals like calves that she sells in the markets. Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis need loans of 450 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, sodas, chickens and for the payment of their rent. The dreams of Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis are that their children will be professionals; their businesses will succeed; to have a tourist attraction and a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Reina, Gloria y Gertrudis pertenecen al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun hace 10, 7, 11 años respectivamente.

Reina es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Reina vive en el Distrito D. Quinua donD. tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. Además Reina viaja a la feria D. Huanta donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el mercadillo D. su distrito.

Por otro lado, Gloria es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Gloria tiene un restaurante ubicado en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Gloria se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores que venD. en el mercado y recreos D. la ciudad.

Mientras que, Gertrudis es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Gertrudis se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa, actividad que realiza en sus propios terrenos y también alquilados en el pequeño valle D. Huatatas, sus ventas lo realiza repartiendo a tiendas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Gertrudis se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, animales menores que venD. a recreos.

Reina, Gloria y Gertrudis necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cuy, azúcar, fideo, gaseosas, gallina y para el pago del arrendamiento D. chacras.

Los sueños D. Reina, Gloria y Gertrudis son que sus hijos sean profesionales, sus negocios mejoren, tener un recreo turístico y un negocio estable.

loans.use: Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis need loans of 450 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, sodas, chickens and for the payment of their rent.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.es:
Dina, Ana and Teofila have belonged to the Aquiles Lanao Flores Communal Bank for 2 years, 8 months, and 8 months respectively. Dina lives with her boyfriend, she is 23 years old and they have 2 children, Dina sells sweets in the door of her house that is located near a high school. Ana is married, she is 40 years old and has 3 children, Ana studies cosmetology and has had her own beauty salon in her house for 2 years. Teofila is single and is 25 years old, Teofila sells cosmetics by catalogue. Furthermore, Teofila studied computers and is working in an Internet café. Dina, Ana and Teofila need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 800 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cookies, caramels, sodas, perfumes, shampoos, and a chair for a beauty salon. The dreams of Dina, Ana and Teofila are to be successful businesswomen, to have a large beauty salon, that their children will be professionals and to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Dina, Ana y Teofila pertenecen al Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao Flores hace 2 años, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Dina es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Dina vende golosinas en la puerta de su casa que esta ubicada cerca de un colegio.

Por otro lado, Ana es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Ana estudio cosmetología y hace 2 años tiene su salón de belleza en su casa.

Mientras que, Teofila es soltera y tiene 25 años, Teofila vende cosméticos por catálogos. Ademas, Teofila estudió informática y esta trabajando en una cabina de Internet.

Dina, Ana y Teofila necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, perfumes, champú y una silla para su salón de belleza.

Los sueños de Dina, Ana y Teofila son ser una empresaria se éxito, tener un salón de belleza grande, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Dina, Ana and Teofila need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 800 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of cookies, caramels, sodas, perfumes, shampoos, and a chair for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Cinthia Noemi

texts.es:
Cinthia has belonged to the Aquiles Lanao Flores Communal Bank for 1 year, in her bank she learned how to manage a business and to save. Cinthia lives with her boyfriend; she is 20 years old and has one daughter who is 2 years old. Cinthia studied cosmetology and nowadays she is studying nursing. Cinthia and her mother have a beauty salon together on a main street in the city of Ayacucho. With the loan that she will obtain she has decided to put in a public telephone booth in the same location. Cinthia needs a loan of 2500 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of dyes, creams, cosmetics and she will put in a telephone booth. The dreams of Cinthia are to succeed, to be a professional, to expand her business, to make a better life for her daughter and her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Cinthia pertenece al Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao Flores hace 1 año, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a como administrar su negocio y a ahorrar.

Cinthia es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija de 2 años, Cinthia estudió cosmetología y actualmente esta estudiando enfermería, Cinthia junto a su mamá tienen un salón de belleza en una avenida principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Cinthia con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado implementar un locutorio público en el mismo local.

Cinthia necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tintes, líquidos, cremas, cosméticos y para implementar el locutorio.

Los sueños de Cinthia son salir adelante, ser profesional, ampliar sus negocios, brindarle todo lo mejor a su hija y mamá.

loans.use: Cinthia needs a loan of 2500 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of dyes, creams, cosmetics and she will put in a telephone booth.

loans.name: Ruth Jenny's Group

texts.en:
Elsa, Ruth, and GracieL. have belonged to the Communal Liberty Bank gor 2, 3, and 1 years. Elsa is 23 years old and has 1 child who is 2 years old. Her occupation is to shave lamb so that it can be used to make typical food, which is then sold at the Nery Garcia Market.

Ruth is 29 and a single mother of one 12 year old boy. She is a baker and makes traditional breads like the chapL. (sweet breads or doughnuts) which she sells at the bus terminal. In addition to that Ruth sells Matamoras (a type of corn cake) at the Nery Garcia Market.

GracieL. is also a single mother and is 21 with a 2 month old son. She sells fire wood from her house. On top of that she also sells food in the market with her mother.

These three women need loans of 450 soles, 1250 soles, 300 soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of lamb, flower, sugar and fire wood. The hopes of Elsa, Ruth, and GracieL. are to increase the capital of their business, buy land, and build homes. They want to eventually become wholesalers and be able to send their kids to school.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Elsa, Ruth y GracieL. pertenecen al Banco Comunal Libertad hace 2, 3, 1 años respectivamente. Elsa es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo D. 2 años, Elsa se dedica a pelar cabezas y patas D. cordero (insumo para preparar comida típica), los cuales son vendidos en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado, Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo D. 12 años, Ruth es panificadora, elabora panes típicos como L. chapL. que venD. en los terminales D. transporte interprovincial. Además Ruth por las mañanas venD. mazamorras en el mercado Nery García. Mientras que GracieL. es madre soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo D. 2 meses, GracieL. venD. leña en su casa. Además GracieL. junto a su mamá venD. comida en el mercado Nery García. Elsa, Ruth y GracieL. necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 1250 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cabezas y patas D. cordero, harina, azúcar y leña. Los sueños D. Elsa, Ruth y GracieL. son incrementar el capital D. su negocio, comprar un terreno, construir su casa, tener un negocio mayorista y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: These three women  need loans of 450 soles, 1250 soles, 300 soles.  This money will be invested in the purchase of lamb, flower, sugar and fire wood.

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
Ana, Rita, and Panila have belonged to the Communal Bank Yana Nawi, which means Black eyes located in Quechua for 3, 2, and 1 years.

Ana is 35 and married with 4 children. She is a loom artisan and makes wallets, hats, and belts. She learned this from her grandparents, and she sells her products in local markets.

Rita is 53 and divorced with 6 children, 3 of which live with her. She sells clothing in demand and her sales have been coming along well. She also sells fruit on foot.

Panila is 23 years old and has one 3 year old daughter. She makes jewelry, which is a craft she learned from her brother. Her sales have been coming along well in the Jesus Nazareno market. Also she sells ceviche (a typical seafood dish from her area).

The three women need a loan of 400 soles each. This money will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, ink, cloth, aprons, stones, metal wire, and bracelets.

They hope to improve their homes, build up their businesses, own their own place, and offer a good education to their kids.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

Ana, Rita y Panila pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Yana Ñawi” que significa “Ojos Negros” en quechua hace 3, 2, 1 años respectivamente.

Ana es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Ana hace artesanía en telar como tapices, carteras, gorras, cinturones, actividad que aprendió D. sus abuelos, sus productos lo venD. en los mercados locales.

Por otro lado, Rita es separada, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Rita venD. ropa D. acuerdo a la demanda, sus ventas lo realiza caminando. Además Rita venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria.

Mientras que Panila es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija D. 3 años, Panila hace joyas D. fantasía, actividad que aprendió D. su hermano, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado Jesús Nazareno. Además Panila venD. cebiche en el mismo mercado.

Ana, Rita y Panila necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lana, hilo, tinte, fustanes, mandiles, polos, piedras, alambres y argollas.

Los sueños D. Ana, Rita y Panila son mejorar su casa, ampliar sus negocios, tener una tienda D. joyería, un local propio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: The three women need a loan of 400 soles each.  This money will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, ink, cloth, aprons, stones, metal wire, and bracelets

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Erny, Elsa, and Norma have belonged to the Sun Communal bank between 4 months and 3 years between them.

Erny is 25 and has two children ages 5 and 3. He has been selling vegetables in the Americas market for 9 months.

Elsa is 31 and a single mother with one daughter 7 months old. She studied cosmetology and has her own beauty salon in a rented location. She also sells candy and sodas from the same location.

Norma is 32 and married with 2 children. She is a native of the Rosapata community. She sells cheeses and cereals that she buys in her communities and sells to the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

The three women need a long of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles. This money will be used to invest in the purchase of onion, tomatoes, lemons, refreshments, candies, ink, liquidsl, cheese, and cereals.

They hope to grow their businesses, buy land, build homes, and provide educations for their kids.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

Erny, Elsa y Norma pertenecen al Banco Comunal El Sol hace 4 meses, 3 años, 8 meses respectivamente.

Erny es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos de 5, 3 años, Erny vende verduras en el mercado Las Américas hace 9 meses.

Por otro lado, Elsa es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hija de 7 meses, Elsa estudio cosmetología y tiene un salón de belleza en un local alquilado. Además Elsa vende golosinas y gaseosas en el mismo local.

Mientras que, Norma es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, natural de la comunidad de Rosaspata, Norma vende quesos, cereales, que compra en su comunidad y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Erny, Elsa y Norma necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebolla, tomate, limón, gaseosas, golosinas, tintes, líquidos, queso y cereales.

Los sueños de Erny, Elsa y Norma son que su negocio sea grande, comprar un terreno, construir su casa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: The three women need a long of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles.  This money will be used to invest in the purchase of onion, tomatoes, lemons, refreshments, candies, ink, liquidsl, cheese, and cereals

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Carmen, Lidia, and Francisca have been part of the Sun Communal Bank for 3, 4, and 3 years

Carmen is 24 years old and with her brother has a photocopy shop at a school. She also helps her father in his café that is located at the same school. With the loan that she will receive, she will open a book store.

Lidia is 58 years old and separated with 9 children, 3 of which live with her. She travels to the fairs 2 times a week where she sells fruit. Also at the fairs she buys cheeses, and grains that she sells in the market the 12 of April.

Francisca is 48 years old and a single mother of 3. She is a baker and makes traditional breads from her area and sells them on foot in the Santa Clara market.

These three women need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 1500 soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of book store supplies like note books and binding machines, grains, and corn.

They hope to get more photo copiers, finish their studies, open a bakery with all the necessary equiptment, and help their children achieve in life

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Carmen, Lidia y Francisca pertenecen al Banco Comunal El sol hace 3, 4, 3 años respectivamente.

Carmen es soltera y tiene 24 años, Carmen junto a su hermano tienen una fotocopiadora en un colegio. Además Carmen ayuda a su papa en su cafetín que esta ubicado en el mismo colegio, Carmen con el préstamo que obtendrá implementará una pequeña librería.

Por otro lado Lidia es separada, tiene 58 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Lidia viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra quesos, cereales, que venD. en el mercado 12 D. abril.

Mientras que Francisca es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Francisca es panificadora, elabora panes típicos D. la zona y lo venD. ambulatoriamente en el mercado Santa Clara.

Carmen, Lidia y Francisca necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lapiceros, cuadernos, máquina para anillados, cebada, trigo, maíz y para la inicial D. una mezcladora D. masa.

Los sueños D. Carmen, Lidia y Francisca son tener más fotocopiadoras, concluir sus estudios, implementar su panadería con toda las máquinas necesarias y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: These three women need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 1500 soles.  This money will be invested in the purchase of book store supplies like note books and binding machines, grains, and corn.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia has belonged to the Solidarity Communal Bank for 1 year.

She is 21 years old and has 2 children 2 and 7 years old. Amelia is an artisan. She weaves quilts and other goods. She learned her craft from her parents, and sells her crafts the Ayacucho city market. She is planning to travel to the city of Huancayo to buy thread at a good price.

Amelia needs a loan of 2000 soles so that she can invest yarn, wool, and dyes.

She hopes to have her own house, and that her kids can do better than her. She also wants to improve her business and directly export her products.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Amelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 1 año.

Amelia es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 2 hijos de 7, 2 años, Amelia realiza artesanía en telar como pisos, frazadas, pasadizos, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, sus ventas lo realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Amelia tiene proyectado viajar a la ciudad de Huancayo para comprar los hilos a un precio mas cómodo.

Amelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo, lana y tintes.

Los sueños de Amelia son tener casa propia, que sus hijos sean mejores que ella, mejorar su negocio y exportar directamente sus productos.

loans.use: Amelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilo, lana y tintes.

loans.name: Sandra's Group

texts.en:
Esperanza, Apolonia, and Sandra have been part of the Solidarity Communal Bank for 2 years, 8 months, and 8 months.

Esperanza is 52 years old and has 7 children. She sells childrens clothing at the Nazarenas fair every Monday. She purchases the clothing and materials in the city of Lima.

Apolonia is 33 years old and has 3 children. She also sells cloths in the Nazarenas fair on Mondays. She travels to the fairs 2 times a week to sell fruit and buys cheeses to resell to local stores.

Sandra is a 25 single mother of 1. She sells clothes to order, and she gets her materials from the city of Lima. She also sells cosmetics from catalogs.

Esperanza, Apolonia, and Sandra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fabric, polos, cheese, and fine lingerie.

These women hope to have their own clothing stores, equip their stores with the proper machines to run their businesses, and offer their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer.

Esperanza, Apolonia y Sandra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 2 años, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Esperanza es casada, tiene 52 años y 7 hijos, Esperanza vende ropa de niños los días lunes en la feria de Las Nazarenas. Además, Esperanza tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de niños, la ropa y la tela son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado, Apolonia es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Apolonia viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana, donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra quesos que reparte a las tiendas.

Mientras que, Sandra es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Sandra vende ropa a pedido, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. Además Sandra vende cosméticos por catálogos.

Esperanza, Apolonia y Sandra necesitan préstamos de 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tela polar, polos, vestidos, conjuntos, queso y lencería fina.

Los sueños de Esperanza, Apolonia y Sandra son tener una tienda de ropa, equipar su taller con todas las maquina y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Esperanza, Apolonia, and Sandra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fabric, polos, cheese, and fine lingerie.

loans.name: Elsy Erika's Group

texts.es:
Elsy, Mariela and Raquel have belonged to the Solidaridad Banco Comunal for 5, 4, and 2 years respectively.

Elsy lives with her partner, is 23 years old and has 1 son. She sells clothing to children, distributing her products to schools. Elsy's goal is to sell natural medicine through catalogs.

Mariela lives with her partner, is 21 years old and has 1 daughter. She buys livestock in various villages and then sells it at the Sunday animal fair in Ayacucho. Somtimes Mariela slaughters the animals and sells them in the April 12th market.

Raquel lives with her partner, is 23 years old and has 2 children. Along with her husband Raquel sells groceries wholesale, which she distributes to the various stories in the city of Ayacucho.

Elsy, Mariela and Raquel need loans of 600, 400 and 1400 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of underwear, natural medicine, sheep, pigs, rice and oil.

Elsy, Mariela and Raquel's dreams are to provide their children with the best possible lives, increase their capital, have a grocery store and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Elsy, Mariela y Raquel pertenecen al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 5, 4, 2 años respectivamente.

Elsy es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Elsy vende ropa de niños, sus productos lo reparte a escuelas. Elsy tiene proyectado vender medicina natural por catálogos.

Por otro lado Mariela es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hija, Mariela compra ganado en los diferentes pueblos y lo vende en la feria dominical de animales de Ayacucho. Algunas veces Mariela beneficia los animales y lo vende en el mercado 12 de abril.

Mientras que Raquel es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Raquel junto a su esposo venden abarrotes por mayor, que reparten a diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Elsy, Mariela y Raquel necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa interior, medicina natural, oveja, cerdo, arroz y aceite.

Los sueños de Elsy, Mariela y Raquel son brindar lo mejor a sus hijos, incrementar su capital, tener una tienda de abarrotes y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Elsy, Mariela y Raquel need loans of 600, 400 and 1400 soles. This moeny will be invested in the purchase of  underwear, natural medicine, sheep, pigs, rice and oil.

loans.name: Melchora's Group

texts.es:
Melchora, Irene and Elva have belonged to the Solidarity Communal Bank for 1 year, 8 months and 8 months respectively. Melchora is married, she is 54 years old and has 6 children, Melchora travels to the markets of the region where she purchases cereals and she sells them at wholesale in the Nery Garcia market. Irene lives with her boyfriend, she is 28 years old and they have 2 children, Irene travels to the fairs 2 times a month where she purchases cereals and potatoes and sells them in Nery Garcia market. Elva lives with her boyfriend, she is 24 years old and they have one daughter, Elva has a small grocery store in a rented location, in the beginning she was selling from a kiosk but now her business is growing. Melchora, Irene, and Elva need loans of 400 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, money they will invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, peas, corn, potatoes, rice, sugar and oil. The dreams of Melchora, Irene and Elva are that their businesses succeed, to expand the store, to have their own home and that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Melchora, Irene y Elva pertenecen al Banco Comunal Solidaridad hace 1 año, 8 meses, 8 meses respectivamente.

Melchora es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Melchora viaja a las ferias D. la región donD. compra cereales y lo venD. por mayor en el mercado Nery García.

Por otro lado Irene es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Irene viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana donD. compra cereales, papa y lo venD. en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que, Elva es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Elva tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en un local alquilado, al inicio Elva vendía en un Kiosco, ahora su negocio esta creciendo.

Melchora, Irene y Elva necesitan un préstamo D. 400 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, arveja, maíz, papa, arroz, azúcar y aceite.

Los sueños D. Melchora, Irene y Elva son que sus negocios mejoren, ampliar su tienda, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Melchora, Irene, and Elva need loans of 400 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, money they will invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, peas, corn, potatoes, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Prek Svay Iii Group

texts.en: Mr. Sophal O. is the Village Bank President of Prek Svay III Group, which consists of 28 members and is located in the village of Prek Svay in Kandal Province. Mr. Sophal is a farmer and he typicalL. works on a field with his wife, Mrs. Sary B., who is also a subsistence farmer in the village. Mr. Sophal is married with five children, two of whom are working while the others are enrolled in school. Mr. Sophal and his wife grow many different kinds of vegetables. A middle man then comes to buy the entire vegetable crop. In order to make their crop more productive, Mr. Sophal needs to access a loan to buy implements to support a pole bean crop. AdditionalL., his water suppL. is insufficient, and so he needs a loan to buy a pump to support his land.

loans.use: To buy implements to grow pole beans and to buy a pump for his field.

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Mrs. Art C. lives in Tropeng Sva Village in Kandal Province. She is a 43-year-old housewife. She is married and the mother of six children, two of whom are working, while the rest stay at home.The whole family is relying on Mr. Sok Hon, Mrs. Art's husband, who is a wedding chef and can generate an income about $2.50 a day. Because of her poor standard of living, she decided to start an animal husbandry business in a local village. To do so she has to apply for a loan to buy cows to raise for breeding. (Mr. Hon is shown in the photo; Mrs. C. was not available).

loans.use: To buy cows for breeding.

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mr. Meth M. lives in the village of Boeng Ka Erk in Kandal province and he is 32 years old. He is married with a child. His wife, Mrs. Sokheourn Soun, is a garment factory worker who can generate an income of around $2.50 a day.

Mr. Meth collects and resells recyclable products. He travels from one local village to another to buy waste, such as empty cans, bottles, and plastics. He resells the recyclables to a middle man for a small profit. . Mr. Meth intends to buy more recyclables to improve his business. He needs to apply for a loan in order to buy them. (His wife is in the picture instead of Mr. Meth M.).

loans.use: To buy more recyclables.
